original: ci'ang med pa /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa /
translated: it is nothing at all;

original: phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i 'du byed las byung ba /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i 'du byed las byung ba /
translated: it arises from the formations that are associated with error;

original: rgyu dang / rkyen la rag lus pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen la rag lus pa /
translated: it depends on causes and conditions;

original: yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched byas pa /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched byas pa /
translated: it is created by the mental faculty and the phenomena element;

original: byed pa / byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa / byed pa med pa /
translated: it is an agent, but it is not an agent;

original: yid kyi skye mched kyis chos kyi skye mched du rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyis chos kyi skye mched du rnam par mi rtog /
translated: the mental faculty does not conceive of the phenomena element,

original: chos kyi skye mched kyang yid kyi skye mched du rnam par mi rtog par shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyang yid kyi skye mched du rnam par mi rtog par shes so //
translated: and the phenomena element does not conceive of the mental faculty.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gnyis ka'i dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are devoid of duality.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid gnyis dang bral bas na de la rnam par dbyer med do //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid gnyis dang bral bas na de la rnam par dbyer med do //
translated: Since they are devoid of the two characteristics, they are not differentiated.

original: skye mched de dag ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba yin yang bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log tu sems pa'i rjes su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: skye mched de dag ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba yin yang bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log tu sems pa'i rjes su brjod pa yin no //
translated: Although these sense-spheres arise in dependence, they are described in accordance with the mistaken thoughts of foolish ordinary beings.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis khong du chud cing rtogs pa ltar na yid kyi skye mched mi skye ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis khong du chud cing rtogs pa ltar na yid kyi skye mched mi skye ba /
translated: As for the noble ones, they understand and realize that the mental faculty is unborn,

original: ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa /
translated: unoriginated,🔽and non-arisen.

original: mi 'gag pa /🔽mi 'ong ba /
analyzed: mi 'gag pa / mi 'ong ba /
translated: It is not blocked.🔽It does not come.

original: ma song ba ste /
analyzed: ma song ba ste /
translated: It does not go.

original: yid kyis yid mi shes /
analyzed: yid kyis yid mi shes /
translated: The mind does not know the mind.

original: yid du rnam par mi rtog /🔽chos kyis chos su mi shes /
analyzed: yid du rnam par mi rtog / chos kyis chos su mi shes /
translated: The mind does not conceptualize the mind.🔽Phenomena do not know phenomena.

original: chos su rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: chos su rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Phenomena do not conceptualize phenomena.

original: gnyis ka stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are empty.

original: gnyis ka dang bral ba'i phyir yid kyis yid kyi mtshan nyid mi shes /
analyzed: gnyis ka dang bral ba'i phyir yid kyis yid kyi mtshan nyid mi shes /
translated: Because both are free from duality, the mind does not know the characteristics of the mind.

original: chos kyis chos kyi mtshan nyid mi shes te /
analyzed: chos kyis chos kyi mtshan nyid mi shes te /
translated: Phenomena do not know the characteristics of phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid de gnyis ka ci'ang med pas de la ni nges pa'i chos gcig kyang med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gnyis ka ci'ang med pas de la ni nges pa'i chos gcig kyang med do //
translated: Since both characteristics are nothing at all, there is not even a single definite phenomenon there.

original: yid kyis mi 'grub la yid 'jig par yang mi nus /
analyzed: yid kyis mi 'grub la yid 'jig par yang mi nus /
translated: The mind cannot be established by the mind, nor can the mind be destroyed by the mind.

original: chos kyis kyang chos mi 'grub la chos 'jig par mi nus so //🔽gnyis ka med @74a *//
analyzed: chos kyis kyang chos mi 'grub la chos 'jig par mi nus so // gnyis ka med @74a *//
translated: Phenomena cannot be established by phenomena, nor can phenomena be destroyed by phenomena.

original: pas yid kyi skye mched ni bdag yid kyi skye mched do snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: pas yid kyi skye mched ni bdag yid kyi skye mched do snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Since both are nonexistent, the mind does not think, “The mind’s sense base is my mind’s sense base.”

original: chos kyi skye mched kyang bdag ni chos kyi skye mched do snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyang bdag ni chos kyi skye mched do snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The phenomena sense base also does not think, “I am the phenomena sense base.”

original: de gnyis ka stong pas sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ka stong pas sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: Since both are empty, they are like an illusion.

original: ming dang / tshig tu rnam par phye nas btags so //
analyzed: ming dang / tshig tu rnam par phye nas btags so //
translated: and words.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched de lta bu rnam par 'byed cing rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched de lta bu rnam par 'byed cing rtog go /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas discern and contemplate the mental sense base and the dharma sense base in this way.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug la rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug la rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa zhe na /
translated: how do bodhisattva-mahāsattvas discern and contemplate the six internal sense bases and the six external sense bases?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis ni thams cad kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa rkyen mang po dang / phyin ci log tu ldan pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis ni thams cad kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa rkyen mang po dang / phyin ci log tu ldan pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: The twelve sense bases are all born from unreal, numerous conditions and the possession of error.

original: mtshan ma gnyis su gyur pa'i phyir phyi dang / nang gnyis so //
analyzed: mtshan ma gnyis su gyur pa'i phyir phyi dang / nang gnyis so //
translated: Because of the two transformations of characteristics, there are the two: external and internal.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag yang dag pa'i chos ma thos pa skye mched bcu gnyis kyi yang dag pa nyid mi shes pa'i phyir mig gi skye mched la chags nas bdag mig gi skye mched gi mig gi skye mched ces chags /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag yang dag pa'i chos ma thos pa skye mched bcu gnyis kyi yang dag pa nyid mi shes pa'i phyir mig gi skye mched la chags nas bdag mig gi skye mched gi mig gi skye mched ces chags /
translated: Because childish ordinary beings who have not heard the true Dharma do not understand the reality of the twelve sense bases, they are attached to the eye sense base and think, “I am the eye sense base,” or “The eye sense base is mine.”

original: gzugs kyi skye mched la chags nas bdag gzugs kyi skye mched bdag gi gzugs kyi skye mched ces chags pa nas rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched la chags nas bdag gzugs kyi skye mched bdag gi gzugs kyi skye mched ces chags pa nas rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang /
translated: They are attached to the form sense base and think, “I am the form sense base,” or “The form sense base is mine.” In the same way, they are attached to the ear, sound, nose, smell, tongue, taste, body, tactile objects, mind,

original: chos kyi @74b bar du bdag yid /🔽bdag gi yid /
analyzed: chos kyi @74b bar du bdag yid / bdag gi yid /
translated: and mental phenomena sense bases.🔽They think, “I am the mind sense base,” or “The mind sense base is mine.”

original: bdag chos / bdag gi chos so zhes chags so //
analyzed: bdag chos / bdag gi chos so zhes chags so //
translated: They think, “I am mental phenomena,” or “Mental phenomena are mine.”

original: de ltar chags pas na skye mched bcu gnyis kyis kun nas klags shing bcings te lam rgyud ldar yang dang / yang 'khor bar gyur nas 'byung ba'i lam mi shes so //
analyzed: de ltar chags pas na skye mched bcu gnyis kyis kun nas klags shing bcings te lam rgyud ldar yang dang / yang 'khor bar gyur nas 'byung ba'i lam mi shes so //
translated: Because of such attachment, they are bound and fettered by the twelve sense bases, and as they repeatedly circle in saṃsāra, they do not know the path of liberation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis la yang dag par brtags na skye mched bcu gnyis rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis la yang dag par brtags na skye mched bcu gnyis rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: “Great bodhisattva beings who investigate the twelve sense fields in this way see the twelve sense fields to be unreal,

original: sgyu ma / snying po med pa /🔽gsog / gsob lta bu /
analyzed: sgyu ma / snying po med pa / gsog / gsob lta bu /
translated: illusory, and without essence.🔽They are like a fraud, a swindle,

original: stong pa / sgyu ma lta bur mthong /🔽mig gi skye mched la bdag gam /
analyzed: stong pa / sgyu ma lta bur mthong / mig gi skye mched la bdag gam /
translated: empty, and like an illusion.🔽They are not attached to the sense field of the eyes,

original: bdag gi bar mi chags pa nas chos kyi skye mched kyi bar du bdag gam bdag gi bar mi chags so //
analyzed: bdag gi bar mi chags pa nas chos kyi skye mched kyi bar du bdag gam bdag gi bar mi chags so //
translated: or to the sense field of sights, or to the sense field of eye consciousness, up to and including the sense field of mental phenomena, which they are not attached to as a self or as belonging to a self.

original: de ltar mi chags pas na rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi chags pas na rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Since they are not attached in this way, they are free of discursive thought.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis la shin tu mkhas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis la shin tu mkhas so //
translated: Bodhisattvas are thus very learned with regard to the twelve sense fields.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar skye mched rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pas skye mched bcu gnyis thams cad la mi chags mi thogs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar skye mched rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pas skye mched bcu gnyis thams cad la mi chags mi thogs /
translated: great bodhisattva beings who are skilled in the methods of the sense fields are not attached to or obstructed by any of the twelve sense fields.

original: skye mched rnams shes par bya ba dang / mthong bar bya ba la'ang rtog la skye mched rnams rnam par 'byed pa la'ang mkhas pas rkyen mang po las skyes pa'i chos kyi skye mched bcu gnyis khong du chud cing rtogs pa dang / mtshan ma med pas skye mched bcu gnyis kyi mtshan ma 'jig pa dang /
analyzed: skye mched rnams shes par bya ba dang / mthong bar bya ba la'ang rtog la skye mched rnams rnam par 'byed pa la'ang mkhas pas rkyen mang po las skyes pa'i chos kyi skye mched bcu gnyis khong du chud cing rtogs pa dang / mtshan ma med pas skye mched bcu gnyis kyi mtshan ma 'jig pa dang /
translated: They understand and realize the twelve sense bases that arise from many conditions, and they destroy the signs of the twelve sense bases with signlessness.

original: @75a *// skye mched rnams rten pa'i lam gyi rjes su mi gnas pa dang / skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid med par shes pa dang / mtshan nyid rnams kyi sbyor pa'i thabs kyi mtha' dag kyang shes shing rtogs so //
analyzed: @75a *// skye mched rnams rten pa'i lam gyi rjes su mi gnas pa dang / skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid med par shes pa dang / mtshan nyid rnams kyi sbyor pa'i thabs kyi mtha' dag kyang shes shing rtogs so //
translated: They do not abide in the path that supports the sense bases, and they understand and realize the knowledge of the characteristics of the sense bases and the complete methods of the application of characteristics.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma byas pa'i 'khrul 'khor las phyogs bzhi nas chu 'bab pa ltar skye mched bcu gnyis kyang de bzhin du phyi nang gi rten cing 'brel ba las bya ba kun byed par gyur te /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma byas pa'i 'khrul 'khor las phyogs bzhi nas chu 'bab pa ltar skye mched bcu gnyis kyang de bzhin du phyi nang gi rten cing 'brel ba las bya ba kun byed par gyur te /
translated: Just as the four directions of the water flowing from the magical machine created by the magician are the same, so too the twelve sense-spheres function in all activities through the mutual dependence of the internal and external.

original: de la yang dag par dngos por dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de la yang dag par dngos por dmigs su med do //
translated: However, in reality, they are not perceived as substantial.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis po 'di sngon gyi las kyi 'khrul 'khor gyis rnam par bcings pas bya ba kun byas par gyur to //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis po 'di sngon gyi las kyi 'khrul 'khor gyis rnam par bcings pas bya ba kun byas par gyur to //
translated: These twelve sense-spheres are bound by the magical machine of past karma and thus function in all activities.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: skye mched ces bya ba ni bus pa so so'i skye bo shes pa'i blo med pa dag gi nyon mongs pa skye zhing mched par byed pa'i sgo'i mig ni gzugs kyi sgo ste /
analyzed: skye mched ces bya ba ni bus pa so so'i skye bo shes pa'i blo med pa dag gi nyon mongs pa skye zhing mched par byed pa'i sgo'i mig ni gzugs kyi sgo ste /
translated: The so-called sense-spheres are the doors through which the afflictions arise and increase for foolish ordinary beings who lack the wisdom of understanding. The eye is the door for forms,

original: byams pa dang / sdang ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa dang / sdang ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it gives rise to love and hatred.

original: gzugs kyang mig gi sgo ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyang mig gi sgo ste /
translated: Forms are also the door for the eye,

original: byams pa dang / sdang ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa dang / sdang ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they give rise to love and hatred.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi bar du ste /
translated: The same is true of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: yid chos kyi sgor gyur pas byams sdang skyed do //
analyzed: yid chos kyi sgor gyur pas byams sdang skyed do //
translated: The mind is the gateway to phenomena, and so it gives rise to love and hatred.

original: chos kyang yid kyi sgor gyur pas byams sdang skyed la de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis ni byams sdang dang 'tshogs shing 'dus pa ste yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes so //
analyzed: chos kyang yid kyi sgor gyur pas byams sdang skyed la de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis ni byams sdang dang 'tshogs shing 'dus pa ste yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes so //
translated: Phenomena are the gateway to the mind, and so they give rise to love and hatred. In this way, the twelve sense sources are the gathering and combination of love and hatred, and one does not understand their true characteristics.

original: 'jig @75b rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig @75b rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo dang / skye mched kyi mtshan nyid la shin tu legs par rtags pas byams pa dang / sdang bas rnam par 'ching bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo dang / skye mched kyi mtshan nyid la shin tu legs par rtags pas byams pa dang / sdang bas rnam par 'ching bar mi 'gyur /
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas, by thoroughly investigating the nature and essence of the sense sources and the characteristics of the sense sources, are not bound by love and hatred.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye mched rnams shin tu rtogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye mched rnams shin tu rtogs so //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas thoroughly understand the sense sources.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis shes par bya pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis shes par bya pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////
translated: This was the fourth chapter on the twelve sense sources.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa la mkhas pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa la mkhas pa zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ expertise in discerning and understanding the twelve links of dependent origination consist in?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gnyis la rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gnyis la rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings discern and understand two kinds of dependent origination.

original: ci'ang med pa'i phyir ma rig pa zhes btags te /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa'i phyir ma rig pa zhes btags te /
translated: Because of the complete absence of anything, there is what is called ignorance.

original: ma rig pa la chos med pa'i phyir ma rig pa zhes btags /
analyzed: ma rig pa la chos med pa'i phyir ma rig pa zhes btags /
translated: Because there is no phenomenon called ignorance, it is called ignorance.

original: ma rig pas ma rig pa mi shes pa'i phyir ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ma rig pas ma rig pa mi shes pa'i phyir ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because ignorance does not know ignorance, it is called ignorance.

original: ji ltar ma rig pa mi shes pas ma rig pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma rig pa mi shes pas ma rig pa zhe na /
translated: How is it that ignorance does not know ignorance?

original: ma rig pa la nges pa'i chos su dmigs su med pas ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la nges pa'i chos su dmigs su med pas ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because no definite phenomenon can be observed in ignorance, it is called ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhe na /
translated: “Why is it that the condition of ignorance gives rise to formation?

original: chos thams cad ni ci'ang med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ci'ang med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are completely nonexistent.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag rnam par 'du byed pas na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag rnam par 'du byed pas na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Because ordinary people are conditioned by ignorance, it is said that “conditioned by ignorance, conditioning karma arises.”

original: 'du byed las rnam par shes @76a *//
analyzed: 'du byed las rnam par shes @76a *//
translated: From conditioning karma, consciousness arises.

original: shes pa skye bas na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa skye bas na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Because consciousness arises from conditioning karma, it is said that “conditioned by conditioning karma, consciousness arises.”

original: ming dang / gzugs ni mtshan nyid gnyis te /
analyzed: ming dang / gzugs ni mtshan nyid gnyis te /
translated: Name-and-form has two characteristics.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs so //
translated: Therefore, “conditioned by consciousness, name-and-form arises.”

original: ming dang gzugs las drug gi skye mched skyes pas de bas na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched do //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs las drug gi skye mched skyes pas de bas na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched do //
translated: From name-and-form, the six sense bases arise. Therefore, “conditioned by name-and-form, the six sense bases arise.”

original: drug gi skye mched las reg pa skye bas de bas na skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa'o //
analyzed: drug gi skye mched las reg pa skye bas de bas na skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa'o //
translated: From the six sense bases, contact arises. Therefore, “conditioned by the six sense bases, contact arises.”

original: reg pa las chor ba skye bas de'i phyir reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa las chor ba skye bas de'i phyir reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
translated: From contact, feeling arises. Therefore, “conditioned by contact, feeling arises.”

original: tshor ba las sred pa skye ste /
analyzed: tshor ba las sred pa skye ste /
translated: From feeling, craving arises.

original: de bas na tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa'o //
translated: Therefore, “conditioned by feeling, craving arises.”

original: sred pa las len pa skye ste /
analyzed: sred pa las len pa skye ste /
translated: From craving, grasping arises.

original: de bas na sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa'o //
translated: Therefore, with craving as condition, grasping comes to be.

original: len pa las srid pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: len pa las srid pa 'byung ste /
translated: From grasping, existence arises.

original: de bas na len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa'o //
translated: Therefore, with grasping as condition, existence comes to be.

original: srid pa las skye ba byung bas de bas na srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa las skye ba byung bas de bas na srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye pa'o //
translated: From existence, birth arises. Therefore, with existence as condition, birth comes to be.

original: skye bas rga ba dang / shi ba dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba 'ba' zhig gi phung por gyur pas de bas na skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba dang / shi ba dang / yid blong ba dang /🔽smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i phung po zhes brjod de /
analyzed: skye bas rga ba dang / shi ba dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba 'ba' zhig gi phung por gyur pas de bas na skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba dang / shi ba dang / yid blong ba dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i phung po zhes brjod de /
translated: From birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish come to be. Therefore, with birth as condition, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish come to be.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig tu gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig tu gyur ro //
translated: Thus there is only a great mass of suffering.

original: de la kun 'dus pa ni blo phyin ci log tu gyur nas rig pa dang 'gal bar byed cing ma rig pa'i phung por bsags nas srid pa phyi ma'i @76b 'dod pa bskyed de dga' ba dang / chags pa la gnas thams cad du skye ba tshol ba ni srid pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de la kun 'dus pa ni blo phyin ci log tu gyur nas rig pa dang 'gal bar byed cing ma rig pa'i phung por bsags nas srid pa phyi ma'i @76b 'dod pa bskyed de dga' ba dang / chags pa la gnas thams cad du skye ba tshol ba ni srid pa'i phung po'o //
translated: “The accumulation of all these is the mass of ignorance, which is the cause of the arising of the aggregates of future existence.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: 'jig rten 'di dag rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis kyis rnam par bcings te ma rig pas ldongs nas ma rig pa'i mun pas g-yang sar 'thom zhing ma rig pa'i thog mar 'gro bas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis rdzogs par skyed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dag rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis kyis rnam par bcings te ma rig pas ldongs nas ma rig pa'i mun pas g-yang sar 'thom zhing ma rig pa'i thog mar 'gro bas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis rdzogs par skyed do //
translated: these worlds are bound by the twelve links of dependent origination. Blind with ignorance, they wander in the darkness of ignorance, stumbling into the abyss. With ignorance leading the way, they complete the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar ma rig pa'i yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la shin tu brtags na ma rig pa nyid stong pa nyid thog ma'i mtha' dmigs su med par shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar ma rig pa'i yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la shin tu brtags na ma rig pa nyid stong pa nyid thog ma'i mtha' dmigs su med par shes so //
translated: When bodhisattvas examine the true characteristics of ignorance in this way, they understand that ignorance itself is emptiness, and that the beginning of ignorance cannot be observed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ma rig pa med pa'i phyir thog ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba med bas mkhas pa dag gis mtha' med pas thog ma'i mthar rtogs te thog ma'i mthar rnam par mi 'byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa med pa'i phyir thog ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba med bas mkhas pa dag gis mtha' med pas thog ma'i mthar rtogs te thog ma'i mthar rnam par mi 'byed do //
translated: Since there is no ignorance, there is no beginning. Therefore, the wise understand the beginning to be without end. They do not conceptualize a beginning.

original: rnam par rtog pa yongs su gcad pas ma rig pa la mi chags so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yongs su gcad pas ma rig pa la mi chags so //
translated: By eliminating conceptualization, they do not grasp at ignorance.

original: chos thams cad ci'ang med pas chos ni ji ltar bshad pa ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ci'ang med pas chos ni ji ltar bshad pa ltar ma yin te /
translated: Since all phenomena are nothing whatsoever, phenomena are not as they are explained.

original: chos thams cad ci'ang med ces brjod na'ang de nyid ma rig pa shes shing mthong ba'o /
analyzed: chos thams cad ci'ang med ces brjod na'ang de nyid ma rig pa shes shing mthong ba'o /
translated: Even if it is said that all phenomena are nothing whatsoever, that is itself the knowledge and seeing of ignorance.

original: gang chos thams cad chud cing rtogs na de de nyid rig pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad chud cing rtogs na de de nyid rig pa ste /
translated: If all phenomena are understood and realized, that is the knowledge of reality.

original: de nyid las rig pa gzhan zhes bya ba med kyi /
analyzed: de nyid las rig pa gzhan zhes bya ba med kyi /
translated: There is no other so-called knowledge apart from that.

original: gang rig pa shes shing mthong ba nyid rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rig pa shes shing mthong ba nyid rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge and seeing of knowledge itself is called knowledge.

original: de la ji ltar na ma rig pa shes shing mthong ba zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na ma rig pa shes shing mthong ba zhe na /
translated: How is ignorance known and seen?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽chos thams cad ci'ang med pa /🔽chos thams cad ci'ang dmigs @77a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / chos thams cad ci'ang med pa / chos thams cad ci'ang dmigs @77a *//
translated: It is like this:🔽All phenomena are nothing whatsoever.

original: su med pa /
analyzed: su med pa /
translated: All phenomena are not observed in the least.

original: chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log pa /
translated: All phenomena are unreal and inverted.

original: chos thams cad ji ltar bshad pa ltar ma yin par rig pa na ma rig par shes shing mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ji ltar bshad pa ltar ma yin par rig pa na ma rig par shes shing mthong ste /
translated: When one knows that all phenomena are not as they are explained, one knows and sees ignorance.

original: ma rig pa shes shing mthong ba ni rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa shes shing mthong ba ni rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Knowing and seeing ignorance is called knowledge.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma rig pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ignorance is unobservable.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba'ang chos thams cad ci'ang med de /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba'ang chos thams cad ci'ang med de /
translated: The so-called formations conditioned by ignorance are also all phenomena, which are nothing whatsoever.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ma rig pa'i mun par 'thom pas phyin ci log tu 'du byed kyi las rnams byed de /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ma rig pa'i mun par 'thom pas phyin ci log tu 'du byed kyi las rnams byed de /
translated: Because childish ordinary beings are confused in the darkness of ignorance, they create inverted formations of karma.

original: 'du byed kyi las de ni gzugs med /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi las de ni gzugs med /
translated: Those formations of karma are formless

original: gnas med pas ma rig pas kyang 'du byed kyi las skyed mi nus la byas pa'i chos med pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces brjod do //
analyzed: gnas med pas ma rig pas kyang 'du byed kyi las skyed mi nus la byas pa'i chos med pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces brjod do //
translated: and have no location, so ignorance is also unable to produce the formations of karma. Since there are no phenomena created by action, it is said that formations are conditioned by ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyi las ni 'dus pa 'am /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi las ni 'dus pa 'am /
translated: The formations of karma are neither a collection

original: 'ongs pa'i gnas sam /
analyzed: 'ongs pa'i gnas sam /
translated: nor a location that has come.

original: song ba'i gnas kyang med la 'du byed kyi gnas 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: song ba'i gnas kyang med la 'du byed kyi gnas 'das pa ma yin /
translated: There is no place where it goes, and the place of formation is not the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: not the future,🔽and not the present.

original: da ltar gyi ma yin pas ma rig pa'ang ma rig pas stong /
analyzed: da ltar gyi ma yin pas ma rig pa'ang ma rig pas stong /
translated: Thus, ignorance is empty of ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyi las kyang 'du byed kyi las kyis stong ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi las kyang 'du byed kyi las kyis stong ste /
translated: The karma of formation is also empty of the karma of formation.

original: 'du byed kyi las la gnas med kyang ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed kyi las byung ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi las la gnas med kyang ma rig pa la brten nas 'du byed kyi las byung ste /
translated: Although the karma of formation has no location, it arises from ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyi las kyang ma rig pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi las kyang ma rig pa la mi gnas /
translated: The karma of formation does not abide in ignorance,

original: ma rig pa'ang 'du byed kyi las la mi gnas te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'ang 'du byed kyi las la mi gnas te /
translated: and ignorance does not abide in the karma of formation.

original: ma rig pa'ang ma rig pa mi shes /
analyzed: ma rig pa'ang ma rig pa mi shes /
translated: Ignorance does not know ignorance,

original: 'du byed kyi las kyang 'du byed kyi las kyis @77b mi shes te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi las kyang 'du byed kyi las kyis @77b mi shes te /
translated: and the karma of formation does not know the karma of formation.

original: de ltar ma rig pa dang / 'du byed kyi las ni phyin ci log gi dbang gis ma rig pa las skyes kyang de la ni ma rig pa dmigs su med /
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa dang / 'du byed kyi las ni phyin ci log gi dbang gis ma rig pa las skyes kyang de la ni ma rig pa dmigs su med /
translated: Thus, although ignorance and the karma of formation arise from ignorance due to error, ignorance is not observed in that.

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin dmigs su med; 'du byed kyi las dmigs su med /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin dmigs su med; 'du byed kyi las dmigs su med /
translated: The nature of ignorance is not observed, the karma of formation is not observed,🔽and the karma of formation is not observed in ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyi las kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med kyi mun pa'i thibs bo las mun pa zhes btags te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi las kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med kyi mun pa'i thibs bo las mun pa zhes btags te /
translated: The nature of the action of formative activity is not an object of perception. It is a thick darkness, and so it is designated as “darkness.”

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa'i thibs po las 'du byed kyi las zhes rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa'i thibs po las 'du byed kyi las zhes rnam par rtog ste /
translated: From the thick darkness of ignorance, the action of formative activity is imagined.

original: ci'ang med pa'i chos las bya ba byas pas ma rig pa dang / 'du byed kyi las ni ci'ang med pa'o //🔽'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi las la mi gnas la 'du byed kyi las dang yang ma bral te rnam par shes pa skyes kyang 'du byed kyi las kyis rnam par shes pa bskyed pa
analyzed: ci'ang med pa'i chos las bya ba byas pas ma rig pa dang / 'du byed kyi las ni ci'ang med pa'o // 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi las la mi gnas la 'du byed kyi las dang yang ma bral te rnam par shes pa skyes kyang 'du byed kyi las kyis rnam par shes pa bskyed pa
translated: Since an action is performed with respect to a nonexistent phenomenon, ignorance and the action of formative activity are nonexistent.

original: ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni ma yin no //
translated: “The condition of formative activity gives rise to consciousness” means that consciousness does not abide in the action of formative activity, and yet it is not the case that it is free from the action of formative activity. Even though consciousness arises, it is not that the action of formative activity gives rise to consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'du byed kyi las kyang 'du byed kyi las su mi shes la 'du byed kyi las la ltos pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi las kyang 'du byed kyi las su mi shes la 'du byed kyi las la ltos pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: The action of formative activity does not know the action of formative activity, and it is not dependent on the action of formative activity.

original: skye bo blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag 'du byed kyi las kyi rnam par shes pa skyed mod kyi rnam par shes pa de ni 'du byed kyi las kyi nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: skye bo blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag 'du byed kyi las kyi rnam par shes pa skyed mod kyi rnam par shes pa de ni 'du byed kyi las kyi nang na mi gnas /
translated: “Although the consciousness that produces the formations of karma arises in people whose minds are distorted, that consciousness does not exist within the formations of karma,

original: 'du byed kyi las kyi phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi las kyi phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: nor does it exist outside of them.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas te; rnam par shes pa skye ba'ang med mod kyi 'du byed las kyi rgyun gcig gis bsabs te ma chad pa las rnam par shes pa skyes so //🔽mkhas pa dag ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan @78a *//
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas te; rnam par shes pa skye ba'ang med mod kyi 'du byed las kyi rgyun gcig gis bsabs te ma chad pa las rnam par shes pa skyes so // mkhas pa dag ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan @78a *//
translated: It does not exist between the two, and yet consciousness arises.

original: nyid btsal na dmigs su med de /
analyzed: nyid btsal na dmigs su med de /
translated: The wise, when searching for the characteristics of consciousness, do not observe it.🔽Consciousness does not observe the arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skye bar mi dmigs pa rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa mi shes /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bar mi dmigs pa rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa mi shes /
translated: Consciousness does not know consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par mi mthong /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par mi mthong /
translated: Consciousness does not see consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa la mi gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa la mi gnas so //
translated: Consciousness does not abide in consciousness.”

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba na ming dang / gzugs rnam par shes pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba na ming dang / gzugs rnam par shes pa la mi gnas /
translated: “Conditioned by consciousness is name-and-form” means that name-and-form is not based on consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i pha rol na ming dang / gzugs mi skye ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i pha rol na ming dang / gzugs mi skye ste /
translated: Name-and-form does not arise apart from consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs de ni rnam par shes pa las ma 'ongs kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs pas bus pa so so'i skye bo'i ldongs pa dag ming dang / gzugs su chags te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs de ni rnam par shes pa las ma 'ongs kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs pas bus pa so so'i skye bo'i ldongs pa dag ming dang / gzugs su chags te /
translated: Name-and-form does not come from consciousness, but consciousness observes name-and-form. The ignorant and ordinary beings are attached to name-and-form.

original: rnam par shes pas ming dang gzugs bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ming dang gzugs bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness does not produce name-and-form.

original: mkhas pa dag ni de la brtags na ming dang gzugs su mi dmigs mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni de la brtags na ming dang gzugs su mi dmigs mi mthong ste /
translated: The wise, when investigating this, do not observe or see name-and-form.

original: ming dang / gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs med phyogs med de /
analyzed: ming dang / gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs med phyogs med de /
translated: Name-and-form is formless and directionless.

original: log par rnam par rtog pa las skyes so //
analyzed: log par rnam par rtog pa las skyes so //
translated: It arises from false conceptualization.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yod ces bya ba rnam par shes pa nyid dmigs su med pa yin na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis gzugs skye ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yod ces bya ba rnam par shes pa nyid dmigs su med pa yin na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis gzugs skye ba lta ci smos te /
translated: The defining characteristic of form is said to exist as a condition of consciousness. If consciousness itself is not observed, how much less could form arise as a condition of consciousness!

original: gzugs zhes nges par btags pa'i gnas med do //
analyzed: gzugs zhes nges par btags pa'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no basis for the designation “form.”

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched ces bya ba ni drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis gzugs skye zhes bya bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched ces bya ba ni drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis gzugs skye zhes bya bar mi rung ste /
translated: The condition of name-and-form is said to be the six sense spheres. It is not possible to say that the condition of the six sense spheres is the arising of form.

original: ming @78b ni lus la gnas pas dbugs phyi nang du rgyu bas lus dang / sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams brtas par byed de /
analyzed: ming @78b ni lus la gnas pas dbugs phyi nang du rgyu bas lus dang / sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams brtas par byed de /
translated: Name abides in the body, and the in-and-out breath nourishes the body, mind, and mental factors.

original: skye mched drug ni sgyu ma lta bu med pa las rnam par rtog pa las byung ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug ni sgyu ma lta bu med pa las rnam par rtog pa las byung ste /
translated: The six sense spheres are like an illusion. They arise from the nonexistence of conceptualization.

original: phyin ci log tu bya ba yod do //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu bya ba yod do //
translated: There is an inverted action.

original: drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis reg bya zhes bya ba ni reg bya de gzugs la brten te yod pa yin na /
analyzed: drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis reg bya zhes bya ba ni reg bya de gzugs la brten te yod pa yin na /
translated: The condition of the six sense spheres is said to be contact. If contact exists in dependence on form,

original: reg bya ni gzugs la med do //
analyzed: reg bya ni gzugs la med do //
translated: Tactile objects do not exist in form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gzugs ni shes pa med pa'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: gzugs ni shes pa med pa'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: Form is by nature devoid of cognition.

original: rdo dang / shing dang / tha mi dad kyang skye mched drug las byung ba'i phyir reg bya zhes rnam par phye ste btags so //
analyzed: rdo dang / shing dang / tha mi dad kyang skye mched drug las byung ba'i phyir reg bya zhes rnam par phye ste btags so //
translated: Even though it is not different from stone and wood, it is distinguished and designated as tactile objects because it arises from the six sense sources.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: skye mched drug nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med na reg bya lta ci smos te /
analyzed: skye mched drug nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med na reg bya lta ci smos te /
translated: If the six sense sources themselves are not real and do not exist at all, what need is there to mention tactile objects?

original: reg bya ni stong pa ci'ang med pa ste /
analyzed: reg bya ni stong pa ci'ang med pa ste /
translated: Tactile objects are empty and do not exist at all.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i phyin ci log las skyes te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i phyin ci log las skyes te /
translated: They arise from the false conceptualization of error.

original: reg bya ni yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas so //🔽reg bya nyid stong pa ste reg bya'i mtshan nyid med pas reg byas skye mched drug mi shes /
analyzed: reg bya ni yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas so // reg bya nyid stong pa ste reg bya'i mtshan nyid med pas reg byas skye mched drug mi shes /
translated: Tactile objects do not exist in a place or a direction.🔽Tactile objects are empty because they do not have the characteristics of tactile objects. Tactile objects do not cognize the six sense sources, and the six sense sources do not cognize tactile objects.

original: skye mched drug kyang reg byas mi shes so; ;reg bya'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba ni tshor ba ste reg bya'i nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: skye mched drug kyang reg byas mi shes so; ;reg bya'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba ni tshor ba ste reg bya'i nang na mi gnas /
translated: “The condition of tactile objects is called sensation.” Sensation does not exist within tactile objects.

original: reg bya'i phyi rol na mi gnas so //
analyzed: reg bya'i phyi rol na mi gnas so //
translated: tactile objects do not exist apart from the body.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas /
translated: They do not exist between the two.

original: reg bya de gud nas tshor ba la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin gyi reg bya las tshor ba skyes so //
analyzed: reg bya de gud nas tshor ba la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin gyi reg bya las tshor ba skyes so //
translated: Tactile objects do not come from somewhere else and then be in contact with the body. Rather, tactile sensations arise from tactile objects.

original: reg bya nyid kyang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: reg bya nyid kyang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Tactile objects are not real.

original: med na tshor ba lta ci smos te tshor ba la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med /
analyzed: med na tshor ba lta ci smos te tshor ba la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med /
translated: If they are not real, how could tactile sensations be real? Tactile sensations have no definitive characteristics.

original: tshor ba ni @79a *//
analyzed: tshor ba ni @79a *//
translated: Tactile sensations

original: med pa las phyin ci log tu rtog pa skye ste phyin ci log tu bya ba yod do //
analyzed: med pa las phyin ci log tu rtog pa skye ste phyin ci log tu bya ba yod do //
translated: arise from the misconception of what is nonexistent.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba de gud na sred pa la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin; tshor ba nyid sred pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin /🔽tshor bas kyang sred pa mi shes la sred pa la rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba de gud na sred pa la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin; tshor ba nyid sred pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin / tshor bas kyang sred pa mi shes la sred pa la rnam par mi rtog /
translated: “Conditioned by tactile sensations is craving” means that tactile sensations do not come from somewhere else and then be in contact with craving. Tactile sensations are not the same as craving.🔽Tactile sensations do not know craving, nor do they conceptualize craving.

original: sred pa la'ang tshor ba mi shes la tshor ba la rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: sred pa la'ang tshor ba mi shes la tshor ba la rnam par mi rtog /
translated: Craving does not know tactile sensations, nor does it conceptualize tactile sensations.

original: sred pa'ang tshor ba dang lhan cig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sred pa'ang tshor ba dang lhan cig pa ma yin te /
translated: Craving is not the same as tactile sensations.

original: tshor ba sred pa la mi gnas pa la sred pa las gud na'ang tshor ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba sred pa la mi gnas pa la sred pa las gud na'ang tshor ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Feeling does not dwell in craving, and apart from feeling there is no craving.

original: tshor ba nyid la tshor ba'i mtshan nyid med na tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: tshor ba nyid la tshor ba'i mtshan nyid med na tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If feeling itself has no defining characteristics of feeling, then how much less could there be craving conditioned by feeling.

original: tshor ba sred pa'i nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: tshor ba sred pa'i nang na mi gnas /
translated: Feeling does not dwell within craving.

original: tshor ba'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: Feeling does not dwell outside craving.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas /🔽sred pa nyid kyang sred pa'i nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas / sred pa nyid kyang sred pa'i nang na mi gnas /
translated: Feeling does not dwell in between these two.🔽Craving does not dwell within craving.

original: sred pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: sred pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: Craving does not dwell outside craving.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
translated: Craving does not dwell in between these two.

original: sred pa'i nang na sred pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med de /
analyzed: sred pa'i nang na sred pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med de /
translated: The defining characteristics of craving cannot be apprehended within craving.

original: sred pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa las sred pa zhes btags kyi sred pa ni 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: sred pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa las sred pa zhes btags kyi sred pa ni 'das pa ma yin /
translated: Craving is imputed to be craving from the conceptualization of what is unreal and mistaken. Craving is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: it is not future,

original: da ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ma yin no //
translated: and it is not present.

original: sred pa de ni bcings pa las sred pa skyes pa ma yin /
analyzed: sred pa de ni bcings pa las sred pa skyes pa ma yin /
translated: Craving does not arise from the bondage of craving.

original: bcings pa ma yin pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bcings pa ma yin pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not from that which is not bound.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen gcig gis gcig bsabs pa'i rgyun ma chad pa las tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes @79b btags so //
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen gcig gis gcig bsabs pa'i rgyun ma chad pa las tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes @79b btags so //
translated: From the uninterrupted continuity of causes and conditions, the condition of feeling is designated as craving.

original: mkhas pa dag ni sred pa'i yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni sred pa'i yul na mi gnas /
translated: The wise do not dwell in the object of craving.

original: phyogs na mi gnas /🔽stong pa / gsob /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas / stong pa / gsob /
translated: They do not dwell in a place.

original: gsog lta bu /
analyzed: gsog lta bu /
translated: They are like an empty, hollow,🔽worthless,

original: snying po med pa /
analyzed: snying po med pa /
translated: hollow,🔽and insubstantial thing.

original: yang dag pa ma yin te ci la'ang med par shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin te ci la'ang med par shes so //
translated: They know that nothing exists.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa gud nas len pa la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa gud nas len pa la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: “The condition of craving is grasping” means that craving does not come from elsewhere, relying on grasping.

original: sred pa dang / len pa lhan cig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa lhan cig pa ma yin te /
translated: Craving and grasping are not simultaneous.

original: sred pa las len pa ma bskyed kyang sred pa yod pas rgyu dang / rkyen lhan cig pa'i phyir rjes su len pa zhes bya ba btags so //
analyzed: sred pa las len pa ma bskyed kyang sred pa yod pas rgyu dang / rkyen lhan cig pa'i phyir rjes su len pa zhes bya ba btags so //
translated: Although grasping is not produced from craving, because craving exists, the cause and condition are simultaneous, and therefore the designation of grasping is made.

original: len pa dang / sred pa lhan cig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: len pa dang / sred pa lhan cig pa ma yin te /
translated: Grasping and craving are not simultaneous.

original: sred pa las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: sred pa las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: They are not different from craving.

original: sred pa'ang len pa dang / lhan cig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sred pa'ang len pa dang / lhan cig pa ma yin te /
translated: Craving is not simultaneous with grasping.

original: len pa las tha mi dad pas sred pa'i nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: len pa las tha mi dad pas sred pa'i nang na mi gnas /
translated: Because it is not different from grasping, craving does not exist within craving.

original: sred pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: sred pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: Craving does not exist outside of craving.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
translated: Craving does not exist between these two.

original: sred pa nyid kyang dmigs su med na sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: sred pa nyid kyang dmigs su med na sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If craving itself cannot be observed, how much less could there be something called ‘the condition of craving that is grasping.’

original: len pa'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med do //
analyzed: len pa'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med do //
translated: The defining characteristics of grasping cannot be observed.

original: mkhas pa dag ni len pa de yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med par rtogs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni len pa de yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med par rtogs te /
translated: The wise understand that grasping is not real and does not exist.

original: len pa'i nang na len pa'i mtshan nyid med pas len pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi ma yin te /
analyzed: len pa'i nang na len pa'i mtshan nyid med pas len pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi ma yin te /
translated: Because grasping does not have the characteristics of grasping within it, grasping is not of the past, future, or present.

original: len pa ni len pa'i nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: len pa ni len pa'i nang na mi gnas /
translated: Grasping does not exist within grasping.

original: len pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: len pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: Grasping does not exist outside of grasping.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
translated: Grasping does not exist between these two.

original: phyin ci log las byung ba /
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung ba /
translated: Grasping arises from error.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen las skyes pa'o //🔽rkyen mang po 'dus pa las len pa @80a *//
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen las skyes pa'o // rkyen mang po 'dus pa las len pa @80a *//
translated: It arises from causes and conditions.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: Grasping is said to arise from the convergence of many conditions.

original: chos gang yang lhan cig pa 'am /
analyzed: chos gang yang lhan cig pa 'am /
translated: No phenomenon is coexistent.

original: so so ba med do //
analyzed: so so ba med do //
translated: No dharma is either associated or dissociated.

original: len pa ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: len pa ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Grasping is essenceless.

original: nges pa'i chos med kyang bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i len pa la tshor bar byed do //
analyzed: nges pa'i chos med kyang bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i len pa la tshor bar byed do //
translated: Although there is no definite dharma, childish ordinary beings feel sensation in false grasping.

original: 'du byed thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pas 'jig rten pa dag ni len pas rnam par bcings so //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pas 'jig rten pa dag ni len pas rnam par bcings so //
translated: Since all formative predispositions are false, worldly beings are bound by grasping.

original: mkhas pa dag ni len pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni len pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: The wise, however, realize that grasping is false,

original: stong pa / snying po med pa /
analyzed: stong pa / snying po med pa /
translated: empty, insubstantial,

original: dngos po med pa nges pa'i chos cung zad tsam yang dmigs su med par rtogs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nges pa'i chos cung zad tsam yang dmigs su med par rtogs so //
translated: and that not even the slightest definite dharma can be apprehended as a thing.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba ni len pa'ang srid pa la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba ni len pa'ang srid pa la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin la /
translated: “Conditioned by grasping is becoming” means that grasping does not come into being in dependence on becoming.🔽It is not that grasping is said to be the condition of becoming because grasping is able to generate becoming.

original: len pas srad pa bskyed nus pa'i phyir len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba ma yin gyi srid pa de ni len pa'i nang na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: len pas srad pa bskyed nus pa'i phyir len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba ma yin gyi srid pa de ni len pa'i nang na'ang mi gnas /
translated: That becoming does not abide within grasping,

original: len pa'i phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: len pa'i phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: nor does it abide outside of grasping,

original: gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas te /
translated: It does not exist between the two.

original: srid pa'i de ni len pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: srid pa'i de ni len pa la mi gnas /
translated: The existence of that existence does not exist in grasping.

original: len pa'ang srid pa dang lhan cig pa 'am /
analyzed: len pa'ang srid pa dang lhan cig pa 'am /
translated: Grasping is not together with existence,

original: so so ba ma yin mod kyi rkyen mang po 'dus pa las len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: so so ba ma yin mod kyi rkyen mang po 'dus pa las len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: nor is it separate. However, it is said that the condition of existence is grasping because many conditions come together.

original: len pas srid pa skyed nus la len pas srid pa rnam par mi 'byed do //
analyzed: len pas srid pa skyed nus la len pas srid pa rnam par mi 'byed do //
translated: Grasping is able to produce existence, but grasping does not distinguish existence.

original: len pa nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med pa min na len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba lta ci smos te srid pa la ltos pa med do //
analyzed: len pa nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med pa min na len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba lta ci smos te srid pa la ltos pa med do //
translated: If grasping itself is not real and does not exist at all, what need is there to mention that the condition of existence is grasping? Existence is not dependent.

original: srid pa nyid srid pa zhes dmigs su med de /
analyzed: srid pa nyid srid pa zhes dmigs su med de /
translated: Existence itself is not observed as existence.

original: srid pa nyid kyang srid pa'i nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: srid pa nyid kyang srid pa'i nang na mi gnas /
translated: Existence itself does not exist within existence.

original: @80b srid pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas te /
analyzed: @80b srid pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas te /
translated: It does not exist outside of existence.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas pas srid pa de ni 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas pas srid pa de ni 'das pa ma yin /
translated: It does not exist between the two. Therefore, that existence is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: not future,

original: da ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ma yin no //
translated: and not present.

original: mkhas pa dag ni srid pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa lhan cig pa dang / so so ba ma yin pas srid pa ni shes pa med pa'i rang bzhin can rnam par mi 'byed /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni srid pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa lhan cig pa dang / so so ba ma yin pas srid pa ni shes pa med pa'i rang bzhin can rnam par mi 'byed /
translated: The wise understand that existence is not real, that it is mistaken, and that it is neither united nor separate. Existence is by nature without cognition and is not differentiated.

original: srid pa de ni yul na mi gnas /🔽phyogs na mi gnas so; ;srid pa de ni snga ma'i mtha' med /
analyzed: srid pa de ni yul na mi gnas / phyogs na mi gnas so; ;srid pa de ni snga ma'i mtha' med /
translated: Existence does not abide in a place.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' med /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' med /
translated: Existence does not abide in a direction. Existence has no beginning,🔽no end,

original: da ltar gyi mtha' med do //🔽srid pa de ni yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: da ltar gyi mtha' med do // srid pa de ni yod pa ma yin /
translated: and no present.

original: med pa ma yin pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis kyi nang du srid pa'o zhes khong du chud cing rtogs so //
analyzed: med pa ma yin pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis kyi nang du srid pa'o zhes khong du chud cing rtogs so //
translated: Existence is neither existent nor nonexistent. Therefore, existence is understood and realized to be within the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: mkhas pa blo can dag ni srid pa la stong pa nyid /
analyzed: mkhas pa blo can dag ni srid pa la stong pa nyid /
translated: The wise and the intelligent understand existence to be empty,

original: snying po med pa /
analyzed: snying po med pa /
translated: to be without essence,

original: gsob / gsog lta bur yongs su rtogs so //
analyzed: gsob / gsog lta bur yongs su rtogs so //
translated: and to be like a lie or a fraud.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa de skye ba la ltos nas 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa de skye ba la ltos nas 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: “ Existence is a condition for birth” means that existence does not come about in dependence on birth.

original: skye ba de srid pa dang lhan cig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba de srid pa dang lhan cig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Birth is not together with existence.

original: so so ba'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: so so ba'ang ma yin la /
translated: It is not separate.

original: skye ba de ni srid pa'i nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: skye ba de ni srid pa'i nang na mi gnas /
translated: Birth does not exist within existence.

original: srid pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: srid pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: It does not exist outside of existence.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
translated: It does not exist between the two.

original: srid pas skye ba ma bskyed la srid pa las gud nas skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis gcig gis gcig bsabs pa'i rgyun ma chad pa las sred pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: srid pas skye ba ma bskyed la srid pa las gud nas skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis gcig gis gcig bsabs pa'i rgyun ma chad pa las sred pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Birth is not produced by existence, nor does birth occur apart from existence. It is said that the condition of craving produces birth from the uninterrupted continuity of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: srid pa dang / skye ba gcig gis gcig rkyen byas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: srid pa dang / skye ba gcig gis gcig rkyen byas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Existence and birth are not conditions of each other.

original: rkyen ma byas pa'ang ma yin te /🔽srid pa @81a *//
analyzed: rkyen ma byas pa'ang ma yin te / srid pa @81a *//
translated: They are not nonconditions.

original: nyid kyang dmigs su med na srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba skyes pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: nyid kyang dmigs su med na srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba skyes pa lta ci smos te /
translated: Existence is not perceived, so what need is there to speak of birth arising from the condition of existence?

original: mkhas pa dag ni skye ba de sred pa la mi gnas la skye ba la skye ba'i mtshan nyid med; skye ba la rang bzhin med /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni skye ba de sred pa la mi gnas la skye ba la skye ba'i mtshan nyid med; skye ba la rang bzhin med /
translated: The wise do not consider birth to be based on craving. Birth has no characteristics of birth. Birth has no nature.

original: skye ba la ngo bo nyid med pas nges par dmigs su rung ba'i chos gcig tsam yang med par rtogs so //
analyzed: skye ba la ngo bo nyid med pas nges par dmigs su rung ba'i chos gcig tsam yang med par rtogs so //
translated: Since arising is devoid of essence, one should understand that there is not even one phenomenon that is suitable to be observed.

original: mkhas pa dag gis de ltar skye ba la rang bzhin med la ci'ang med de /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis de ltar skye ba la rang bzhin med la ci'ang med de /
translated: The wise should understand that arising is essenceless and that nothing exists.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis gcig gis gcig bsabs pa'i rgyun tsam zhig bstan pa'i phyir srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes brjod par yongs su rtogs so //🔽skye ba la lhan cig pa'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis gcig gis gcig bsabs pa'i rgyun tsam zhig bstan pa'i phyir srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes brjod par yongs su rtogs so // skye ba la lhan cig pa'am /
translated: In order to teach that it is merely a continuum in which the twelve factors of dependent origination are mutually supportive, it is said that “conditioned by becoming, birth occurs.”

original: so so ba'i chos med de /🔽skye ba de srid pa'i nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: so so ba'i chos med de / skye ba de srid pa'i nang na mi gnas /
translated: Arising does not exist as a phenomenon that is either simultaneous with or sequential to becoming.🔽Arising does not exist in becoming.

original: srid pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: srid pa'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: Arising does not exist outside of becoming.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas so //🔽skye ba de 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas so // skye ba de 'das pa ma yin /
translated: Arising does not exist in the interval between the two.🔽Arising is not past.

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: Arising is not future.

original: da ltar ma yin /
analyzed: da ltar ma yin /
translated: Arising is not present.

original: skye ba de snga ma'i mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / bar gyi mthar dmigs su med do //
analyzed: skye ba de snga ma'i mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / bar gyi mthar dmigs su med do //
translated: Arising is not observed in the prior limit, the later limit, or in the present.

original: skye ba de dngos por dmigs su med pas mkhas pa dag rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa dang / phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: skye ba de dngos por dmigs su med pas mkhas pa dag rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa dang / phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: Since birth is not observed as a thing, the wise do not assert that it is a thing.🔽

original: ci'ang med pa sgyu ma lta bu las skyes par yongs su rtogs so //🔽skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba de rga shi dang / slos pa'i @81b mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin gyi skye bas kyang rga shi dang /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa sgyu ma lta bu las skyes par yongs su rtogs so // skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba de rga shi dang / slos pa'i @81b mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal la ltos te 'ongs pa ma yin gyi skye bas kyang rga shi dang /
translated: Since birth is not observed as a thing, the wise understand that it arises from the coming together of many causes and conditions, and from what is unreal and illusory, which is endowed with error.🔽“Conditioned by birth there occurs aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife” means that aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife do not come from birth.

original: slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba bskyed mi nus so //
analyzed: slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba bskyed mi nus so //
translated: Birth also is not able to produce aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife.

original: rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba skye ba'i nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba skye ba'i nang na mi gnas /
translated: Aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife do not dwell within birth,

original: skye ba'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: nor do they dwell outside of birth.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas so //
translated: It does not dwell between the two.

original: rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba skye ba gnas te skye ba'i phyir rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba brjod pa'ang rgyu dang /
analyzed: rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba skye ba gnas te skye ba'i phyir rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba brjod pa'ang rgyu dang /
translated: The arising of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife is due to the arising of birth.

original: rkyen mang po las skye ba'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen mang po las skye ba'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is due to the arising of many causes and conditions.

original: skye ba nyid rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang lhan cig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba nyid rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang lhan cig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Birth is not together with old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife.

original: so so ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: so so ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not separate from them.

original: skye ba la skye ba nyid kyang dmigs su med na skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: skye ba la skye ba nyid kyang dmigs su med na skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba lta ci smos /
translated: If birth itself is not apprehended, what need is there to speak of the apprehension of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife due to the condition of birth?

original: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal nyid la rga shi dang / sdug bsngal dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal nyid la rga shi dang / sdug bsngal dmigs su med do //
translated: Old age and death and suffering itself are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal nyid rga shi dang / sdug bsngal gyi nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal nyid rga shi dang / sdug bsngal gyi nang na mi gnas /
translated: Aging and death and the nature of suffering do not dwell in aging and death and suffering.

original: phyi rol gyi nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi nang na mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell externally.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
translated: They do not dwell in between.

original: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal 'das @82a *//🔽pa ma yin /
analyzed: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal 'das @82a *// pa ma yin /
translated: Aging and death and suffering are not past.

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: They are not future.

original: da ltar gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar gyi ma yin no //
translated: They are not present.

original: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal nyid rga shi dang / sdug bsngal dang lhan cig pa ma yin /
analyzed: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal nyid rga shi dang / sdug bsngal dang lhan cig pa ma yin /
translated: Aging and death and the nature of suffering are not together with aging and death and suffering.

original: so so ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: so so ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: They are not separate.

original: phyin ci log dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang ldan pa /
translated: They are endowed with error.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa /
translated: They are a composite of many causes and conditions.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis tshogs pa las skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / sdug bsngal ba zhes brjod do //🔽rga shi dang / sdug bsngal la gnas med /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis tshogs pa las skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / sdug bsngal ba zhes brjod do // rga shi dang / sdug bsngal la gnas med /
translated: Due to the condition of arising from the assembly of the twelve links of dependent origination, aging and death and suffering are spoken of.🔽Aging and death and suffering have no abode.

original: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal la nges pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal la nges pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med do //
translated: The ascertained characteristics of aging and death and suffering are not observed.

original: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal la 'das pa'i mtha' dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' dang / da ltar gyi mtha' dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rga shi dang / sdug bsngal la 'das pa'i mtha' dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' dang / da ltar gyi mtha' dmigs su med do //
translated: The limits of aging and death, and of suffering, cannot be observed in the past, the future, or the present.

original: mkhas pa dag ni rga shi dang / sdug bsngal la yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni rga shi dang / sdug bsngal la yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: The wise understand aging and death, and suffering, to be unreal,

original: ci'ang med pa /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa /
translated: nothing whatsoever,

original: phyin ci log dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang ldan pa /
translated: and endowed with error.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa /🔽ma byas pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa / ma byas pa /
translated: They are understood to be essenceless,

original: ma byung ba /
analyzed: ma byung ba /
translated: uncreated,🔽unoriginated,

original: ma skyes par yongs su rtogs so //
analyzed: ma skyes par yongs su rtogs so //
translated: and unborn.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis kyis chos la rtog pa'i tshe rten cing 'brel te byung ba'i chos la 'das pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis kyis chos la rtog pa'i tshe rten cing 'brel te byung ba'i chos la 'das pa'am /
translated: When one thus contemplates phenomena in terms of the twelve links of dependent origination, one does not see any phenomena that arise dependently in the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'am /
translated: the future,

original: da ltar gyir ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: da ltar gyir ma mthong ngo //
translated: or the present.

original: rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid mi mthong ste /
translated: One does not see any characteristics of phenomena that arise dependently.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la rkyen med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon par 'du byas pa med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / @82b byas pa'i dngos po med pa dang / thog ma nas chos thams cad ci'ang med par shes shing rtogs so //🔽de ltar rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis khong du chud cing rtogs pas rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis la byas pa'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la rkyen med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon par 'du byas pa med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / @82b byas pa'i dngos po med pa dang / thog ma nas chos thams cad ci'ang med par shes shing rtogs so // de ltar rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis khong du chud cing rtogs pas rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis la byas pa'am /
translated: In dependent origination, there are no conditions, nothing that is not born, no signs, no conditioning, nothing that arises, no entities that are created, and from the beginning all phenomena are understood to be nothing whatsoever.

original: byed pa yod par mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byed pa yod par mi mthong ngo //
translated: In this way, by understanding and realizing the twelve links of dependent origination, one does not see the twelve links of dependent origination as having been created or as creating anything.

original: gal te chos rnams rgyu las byung na rgyu med pa'i phyir chos de'ang med do //
analyzed: gal te chos rnams rgyu las byung na rgyu med pa'i phyir chos de'ang med do //
translated: If phenomena arise from causes, then because there are no causes, those phenomena do not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma rig pa'i don gyi rjes su zhugs pas chos thams cad dmigs su med par rtogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma rig pa'i don gyi rjes su zhugs pas chos thams cad dmigs su med par rtogs so //
translated: Bodhisattvas, who have engaged with the meaning of ignorance, realize that all phenomena are unobservable.

original: de ltar rtog pa de la zhugs na rkyen med pa nyid rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis yin te de la skye ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa de la zhugs na rkyen med pa nyid rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis yin te de la skye ba med do //
translated: If one enters into this understanding, the twelve links of dependent origination are devoid of conditions, and there is no arising within them.

original: byang chub sems dpas rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis yang dag pa ma yin pa las skyes par rtogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis yang dag pa ma yin pa las skyes par rtogs so //
translated: Bodhisattvas understand that the twelve links of dependent origination arise from what is not real.

original: ma rig pa'i don gyi rjes su rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis rtogs pas chos bya ba med na chos su gdags pa'ang med de /
