analyzed: ma rig pa'i don gyi rjes su rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis rtogs pas chos bya ba med na chos su gdags pa'ang med de /
translated: If one understands the meaning of ignorance, one will understand the twelve links of dependent origination. If there is no dharma, there is also no designation of dharma.

original: de bas na ma rig pa'i don gyi rjes su rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis khong du chud cing rtogs so //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa'i don gyi rjes su rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis khong du chud cing rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, one should understand and realize the twelve links of dependent origination in accordance with the meaning of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa ni ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni ma skyes pa /
translated: Ignorance is unborn,

original: ma byas pa /
analyzed: ma byas pa /
translated: uncreated,

original: ma byung ba /🔽ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: ma byung ba / ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: non-arisen,🔽without intrinsic nature,

original: nges pa'i chos med pa /
analyzed: nges pa'i chos med pa /
translated: without fixed characteristics,

original: rgyu med pa /
analyzed: rgyu med pa /
translated: without cause,

original: ci'ang med pa ste /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa ste /
translated: and utterly nonexistent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe rig pa dang / ma rig pa gnyis su rnam par mi 'byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe rig pa dang / ma rig pa gnyis su rnam par mi 'byed de /
translated: At that time, bodhisattvas do not distinguish between knowledge and ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid de rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid de rig pa nyid do //
translated: The true characteristics of ignorance are awareness itself.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu las chos thams cad ci'ang med pa dang / @83a *//
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu las chos thams cad ci'ang med pa dang / @83a *//
translated: From the causes of ignorance, all dharmas are nothing whatsoever,

original: chos thams cad rkyen med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad rkyen med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: all dharmas are without conditions, and there is no conceptualization.

original: de bas na ma rig pa'i don gyi rjes su rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis rtogs so //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa'i don gyi rjes su rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, following the meaning of ignorance, one realizes the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi thabs dang / shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi thabs dang / shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas’ method and wisdom are called the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang de ltar rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis lhan cig pa dang / so so ba rtogs na de ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i shes rab legs par thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang de ltar rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis lhan cig pa dang / so so ba rtogs na de ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i shes rab legs par thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If a bodhisattva realizes the twelve links of dependent origination simultaneously and individually in this way, it is said that the bodhisattva has attained the wisdom of non-arising.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: skye ba dang / 'gog par rtogs na ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis la mkhas pa ma yin gyi gang rkyen mang po las 'du ba dang / bral bar shes pa de ni mi skye ba'i shes rab thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gog par rtogs na ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis la mkhas pa ma yin gyi gang rkyen mang po las 'du ba dang / bral bar shes pa de ni mi skye ba'i shes rab thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If one understands arising and cessation, then one is not skilled in the twelve links of dependent origination. If one understands the coming together and separation of many conditions, then this is called attaining the wisdom of nonarising.

original: gang mi skye ba'i shes rab thob pa de ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang mi skye ba'i shes rab thob pa de ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Attaining the wisdom of nonarising is called understanding the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams mi skye ba'i shes rab rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams mi skye ba'i shes rab rtogs pa'am /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to attain the wisdom of nonarising

original: reg pa 'dod na de ltar rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi shes rab la nan tan du bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa 'dod na de ltar rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi shes rab la nan tan du bya'o //
translated: should practice the wisdom of the twelve links of dependent origination in this way.

original: des na rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs shing rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs shing rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they will understand and realize the characteristic of nonarising of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang mi skye ba @83b nyid rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis su shes na rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi sbyor ba la thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang mi skye ba @83b nyid rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis su shes na rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis kyi sbyor ba la thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If bodhisattva-mahāsattvas understand the twelve links of dependent origination as non-arising, they will attain the practice of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: de ltar mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid du khams gsum shes shing mthong ba des ni myur du mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid du khams gsum shes shing mthong ba des ni myur du mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By knowing and seeing the three realms as having the characteristic of non-arising in this way, they will quickly attain the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de da ltar gyi bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di nyid las 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa 'thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de ring por mi thogs par lung ston pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de da ltar gyi bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di nyid las 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa 'thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de ring por mi thogs par lung ston pa dang /
translated: That bodhisattva will receive a prophecy from this very present Buddha, and will attain the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this very life. That bodhisattva will not be long before receiving a prophecy,

original: mthar gyis lung ston par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar gyis lung ston par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and will eventually receive a prophecy.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: de ltar shin tu dge ba lung bstan pa thob pas rab tu bde ba'i sems su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu dge ba lung bstan pa thob pas rab tu bde ba'i sems su 'gyur te /
translated: in this way, by attaining the prophecy of utmost virtue, they will have a mind of great bliss.

original: chos thams cad la gtad cing 'jug pa'i sbyor ba las shes rab kyi snang ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la gtad cing 'jug pa'i sbyor ba las shes rab kyi snang ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By applying oneself to the engagement of all phenomena, one will attain the illumination of insight.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis la ma skyes pa nyid du rtogs pas da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis la ma skyes pa nyid du rtogs pas da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, by realizing the twelve links of dependent origination as unborn, one will serve the buddhas of the present.

original: gang zag de bdud ma rungs pa rnams kyis spa mi 'gong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zag de bdud ma rungs pa rnams kyis spa mi 'gong bar 'gyur /
translated: Such a person will not be intimidated by the evil māras.

original: des skye zhing 'khor ba'i rgyun las brgal te skam sar phyin par 'gyur /
analyzed: des skye zhing 'khor ba'i rgyun las brgal te skam sar phyin par 'gyur /
translated: They will cross over the stream of birth and saṃsāra and reach dry land.

original: de ma rig pa'i 'dam rdzab las thar bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ma rig pa'i 'dam rdzab las thar bar 'gyur /
translated: They will be liberated from the swamp of ignorance.

original: des rab tu bde ba'i gnas su phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rab tu bde ba'i gnas su phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will reach a place of great happiness.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapālas,

original: gang zhig da ltar bzhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: gang zhig da ltar bzhugs kyang rung /
translated: whether they are present

original: mya ngan las 'das kyang rung /🔽rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba @84a *//
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das kyang rung / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba @84a *//
translated: or have passed into nirvāṇa,🔽the twelve links of dependent origination

original: bcu gnyis kyi sbyor ba la gal te nyan nam /
analyzed: bcu gnyis kyi sbyor ba la gal te nyan nam /
translated: are to be listened to,

original: dad dam / klog gam /
analyzed: dad dam / klog gam /
translated: trusted, read,

original: 'don tam / rnal 'byor du byed na des ni ring po mi thogs par ma skyes pa'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par ngas lung ston to //
analyzed: 'don tam / rnal 'byor du byed na des ni ring po mi thogs par ma skyes pa'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par ngas lung ston to //
translated: If they recite it or practice it, I prophesy that they will soon attain the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: des ring po mi thogs par da ltar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur bar ngas bstan to //
analyzed: des ring po mi thogs par da ltar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur bar ngas bstan to //
translated: I prophesy that they will soon receive the prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment from the tathāgatas who are presently dwelling.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis shes par bya ba'i le'u ste lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis shes par bya ba'i le'u ste lnga pa'o ////
translated: This is the fifth chapter, on understanding the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: how are bodhisattva mahāsattvas skilled in the foundations of mindfulness?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la rnam par 'byed cing rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la rnam par 'byed cing rtog go /
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas discern and contemplate the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su rtog pa dang / tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su rtog pa dang / sems la sems kyi rjes su rtog pa dang; chos la chos kyi rjes su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su rtog pa dang / tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su rtog pa dang / sems la sems kyi rjes su rtog pa dang; chos la chos kyi rjes su rtog pa'o //
translated: contemplating dharmas in dharmas.

original: de la ji ltar na lus la lus kyi rjes su rtog pa nas /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na lus la lus kyi rjes su rtog pa nas /
translated: “What is meant by contemplating the body in the body,

original: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos la tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi bar du rjes su rtog pa zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos la tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi bar du rjes su rtog pa zhe na /
translated: and so on up to contemplating feelings, mind, and dharmas in feelings, mind, and dharmas?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams lus la rnal 'byor du spyod cing lus kyi rjes su rtog pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba @84b bzhin du lus kyi mtshan nyid la rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams lus la rnal 'byor du spyod cing lus kyi rjes su rtog pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba @84b bzhin du lus kyi mtshan nyid la rtog go /
translated: when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice yoga in the body and contemplate the body, they contemplate the characteristics of the body as they truly are.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: lus 'di ni mi rtag pa /
analyzed: lus 'di ni mi rtag pa /
translated: This body is impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba /
translated: suffering,

original: nad lta bu /
analyzed: nad lta bu /
translated: like a disease,

original: shu ba lta bu /
analyzed: shu ba lta bu /
translated: like a boil,

original: sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba /
translated: afflicted by suffering,

original: nyams pa dang / 'pho ba dang; 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyams pa dang / 'pho ba dang; 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: and characterized by decay, change, and destruction.

original: lus 'di ni shin tu mi gtsang ba ste mi sdug pa /
analyzed: lus 'di ni shin tu mi gtsang ba ste mi sdug pa /
translated: This body is extremely impure and ugly.

original: mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang ba /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang ba /
translated: It is filled with all kinds of impurities.

original: bu ga dgu nas mi gtsang ba rtag tu zag pa'o //
analyzed: bu ga dgu nas mi gtsang ba rtag tu zag pa'o //
translated: From the nine orifices, impurities always flow out.

original: lus 'di ni shin tu mnam pa ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni shin tu mnam pa ste /
translated: This body is extremely foul-smelling.

original: ngan skyugs kyi rkyal ba 'gro shes pa dang 'dra'o //🔽de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus 'di la brtags na lus 'di la spu nyag ma tsam gyi gtsang ba'am /
analyzed: ngan skyugs kyi rkyal ba 'gro shes pa dang 'dra'o // de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus 'di la brtags na lus 'di la spu nyag ma tsam gyi gtsang ba'am /
translated: It is like a bag of excrement that can move around.

original: yid du 'ong ba mi rnyed do //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba mi rnyed do //
translated: If you examine this body in this way, as it really is, you will not find even a single hair’s worth of purity or anything pleasant in this body.

original: lus 'di ni rus pa dang / rgyus pa dang / pags pa dang / shas yongs su dkris shing glags nas sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang / rkyen dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las byung ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni rus pa dang / rgyus pa dang / pags pa dang / shas yongs su dkris shing glags nas sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang / rkyen dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las byung ste /
translated: This body is a collection of bones, sinews, skin, and flesh, and it is the result of the ripening of causes and conditions of past actions.

original: kun 'byung dang / len pas yongs su bcings par shes so //
analyzed: kun 'byung dang / len pas yongs su bcings par shes so //
translated: It is bound by origination and grasping.

original: de la kun 'byung ni gang /
analyzed: de la kun 'byung ni gang /
translated: What is origination?

original: len pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: len pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is grasping?

original: sngon gyi rgyu dang / rkyen las lus 'di byung bas na len pa zhes brtags so //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu dang / rkyen las lus 'di byung bas na len pa zhes brtags so //
translated: Since this body arises from past causes and conditions, it is called appropriation.

original: da ltar gyi tshe 'di la lus bkrus nas kha zas dang / gos dang / khri stan dang / sman gyis gsos pa ni kun 'byung zhes bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi tshe 'di la lus bkrus nas kha zas dang / gos dang / khri stan dang / sman gyis gsos pa ni kun 'byung zhes bya ste /
translated: The present life, in which the body is washed, nourished with food, clothed, provided with bedding, and treated with medicine, is called the origin.

original: de ltar da ltar gyi rgyu dang / rkyen ni kun 'byung zhes bya /
analyzed: de ltar da ltar gyi rgyu dang / rkyen ni kun 'byung zhes bya /
translated: Thus, the present causes and conditions are called the origin.

original: sngon gyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i mthus rnam par bcings nas bya ba kun byed pa ni len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i mthus rnam par bcings nas bya ba kun byed pa ni len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By the power of the ripening of past results, it is bound and performs all actions, which is called appropriation.

original: yang lus 'di @85a *//
analyzed: yang lus 'di @85a *//
translated: Moreover, this body

original: ni chen po bzhi las byas te nges par yang dag par mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: ni chen po bzhi las byas te nges par yang dag par mtshan nyid med de /
translated: is made from the four great elements, and is definitely without true characteristics.

original: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa rnams la lus zhes btags so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa rnams la lus zhes btags so //
translated: It is designated as a body among the aggregates of form.

original: ci'i phyir lus zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called a body?

original: bya ba byed nus pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed nus pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is able to perform actions, it is called a body.

original: rten pa'i gnas la zhen cing chags pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rten pa'i gnas la zhen cing chags pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it clings to and is attached to the basis of support, it is called a body.

original: yid kyi rjes su kun byed pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rjes su kun byed pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the body because it is the basis of all mental activity.

original: rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i phyir lus zhes bya'o /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i phyir lus zhes bya'o /
translated: It is called the body because it arises from conceptualization.

original: sgyu ma 'dus pa las byas pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma 'dus pa las byas pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the body because it is created from the combination of illusions.

original: las dang 'dus pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las dang 'dus pa'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the body because it is the combination of karma.

original: lus 'di ni ring po mi thogs par mthar 'gyur zhing 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni ring po mi thogs par mthar 'gyur zhing 'pho ba ste /
translated: This body will not last long, but will eventually change and pass away.

original: mi rtag pa nges pa med par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nges pa med par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: It has the characteristics of impermanence and uncertainty.

original: lus 'di ni lus kyi nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: lus 'di ni lus kyi nang na mi gnas /
translated: This body does not exist inside the body.

original: lus kyi phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: lus kyi phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: It does not exist outside the body.

original: de gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
translated: It does not exist in between those two.

original: lus 'di ni lus su mi shes pa lus su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: lus 'di ni lus su mi shes pa lus su mi mthong ngo //
translated: This body does not know the body; it does not see the body.

original: lus 'di ni byed pa med pa /
analyzed: lus 'di ni byed pa med pa /
translated: This body is without action.

original: g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa /
translated: It is without movement.

original: smon cing re ba med; sems med de /
analyzed: smon cing re ba med; sems med de /
translated: It is without aspiration or hope; it is without mind.

original: rdo dang / shing dang tha mi dad do //
analyzed: rdo dang / shing dang tha mi dad do //
translated: It is not different from stone or wood.

original: lus 'di la lus kyi mtshan nyid du nges pa med do //
analyzed: lus 'di la lus kyi mtshan nyid du nges pa med do //
translated: This body has no definite characteristics of a body.

original: de ltar yang dag par lus la rnam par 'byed cing brtags na byas pa med /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par lus la rnam par 'byed cing brtags na byas pa med /
translated: Thus, when the body is properly analyzed and examined, it is not a creator.

original: byed pa med /
analyzed: byed pa med /
translated: It is not an agent.

original: lus 'di la snga ma'i mtha' med /🔽phyi ma'i mtha' med /
analyzed: lus 'di la snga ma'i mtha' med / phyi ma'i mtha' med /
translated: This body has no beginning.🔽It has no end.

original: bar gyi mtha' med do //🔽lus 'di la rtag pa /
analyzed: bar gyi mtha' med do // lus 'di la rtag pa /
translated: It has no middle.🔽This body has no single entity that is permanent,

original: brtan pa / sra ba'i @85b mtshan gcig kyang med /
analyzed: brtan pa / sra ba'i @85b mtshan gcig kyang med /
translated: stable, or solid.

original: ji ltar chu'i dbu ba gzung zhing bcad du mi bzod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chu'i dbu ba gzung zhing bcad du mi bzod pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a water bubble that cannot be grasped or pierced.

original: lus 'di ni srin bu brgyad khri gnas pa'i khyim mo //
analyzed: lus 'di ni srin bu brgyad khri gnas pa'i khyim mo //
translated: This body is a house for eighty-four thousand species of worms.

original: lus 'di ni las rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni las rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: This body is harmed by various kinds of actions.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi phyir lus 'di sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi phyir lus 'di sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: This body is suffering because of three kinds of suffering:

original: mgon med pas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal ba'i yid sdug bsngal bas rnam par 'tshe bas na sdug bsngal thams cad kyis sdug bsngal ba mang po'i snod do //
analyzed: mgon med pas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal ba'i yid sdug bsngal bas rnam par 'tshe bas na sdug bsngal thams cad kyis sdug bsngal ba mang po'i snod do //
translated: the suffering of conditioned existence, the suffering of change, and the suffering of pain, because it is unprotected. It is a vessel for all suffering, because it is harmed by the suffering of pain.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus la lus kyi rjes su rtogs nas kyang 'di snyam du lus 'di ni bdag ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus la lus kyi rjes su rtogs nas kyang 'di snyam du lus 'di ni bdag ma yin /
translated: “Having thus correctly contemplated the body, they think, ‘This body is not a self,

original: gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin /
translated: nor is it something that belongs to a self.

original: dbang med pa /
analyzed: dbang med pa /
translated: It is powerless,

original: 'dir rang nyams byar med pa /
analyzed: 'dir rang nyams byar med pa /
translated: and it is not something that can be controlled.

original: byas pa'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: byas pa'o snyam du sems so //
translated: It is a product.’

original: lus 'di ni dngos po med pa nges pa'i chos su dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni dngos po med pa nges pa'i chos su dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: “ ‘This body is not a real thing, and it cannot be observed as a real thing.

original: lus 'di ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: This body is empty by nature, and it has no defining characteristics.

original: lus 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa las byung ba 'khrul 'khor las byas pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa las byung ba 'khrul 'khor las byas pa lta bu ste /
translated: This body is not real; it is a product of unreal imagination, like a machine.

original: sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang / rkyen las byung bas na lus 'di la ni bdag dang / bdag gi zhes 'du shes bskyed pa'i mi rigs te /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang / rkyen las byung bas na lus 'di la ni bdag dang / bdag gi zhes 'du shes bskyed pa'i mi rigs te /
translated: Since this body has arisen from the causes and conditions of previous actions, it is not right to think of it as a self or as something that belongs to a self.

original: bdag cag kyang lus dang / srog la mi blta'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang lus dang / srog la mi blta'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: We should not be concerned with our bodies or our lives.’🔽“

original: byang chub sems dpas de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rtog pa'i tshe lus 'di dang lhan cig pa'am /🔽@86a *// so so bar mi dmigs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rtog pa'i tshe lus 'di dang lhan cig pa'am / @86a *// so so bar mi dmigs te /
translated: When the bodhisattva thus correctly investigates, he does not apprehend this body as either together with or separate from those elements.

original: gzhan nas 'ongs pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan nas 'ongs pa 'am /
translated: He does not see it as a place that comes from somewhere else or goes somewhere else,

original: gud du 'gro ba'i gnas yod par ram /🔽rten pa'i gnas yod par mi blta'o //
analyzed: gud du 'gro ba'i gnas yod par ram / rten pa'i gnas yod par mi blta'o //
translated: or as a place that is supported.

original: lus 'di la 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: lus 'di la 'das pa 'am /
translated: He does not conceptualize this body as past,

original: ma 'ongs pa 'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'am /
translated: future, or present.

original: da ltar gnas par rnam par mi rtog pas lus dang / srog la mi gnas /🔽lus la bdag gam /
analyzed: da ltar gnas par rnam par mi rtog pas lus dang / srog la mi gnas / lus la bdag gam /
translated: Thus, he does not cling to life or body,

original: bdag gi bar mi chags te /
analyzed: bdag gi bar mi chags te /
translated: nor does he cling to the body as “I” or “mine.”

original: lus su 'dzin pa yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: lus su 'dzin pa yongs su spong ngo //
translated: He abandons the grasping of the body.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des de ltar lus 'di la stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des de ltar lus 'di la stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa /
translated: That bodhisattva thus thoroughly investigates this body as empty,

original: bdag gi ba med par yongs su rtogs te /
analyzed: bdag gi ba med par yongs su rtogs te /
translated: without a self, and without a “mine.”

original: lus 'di la bdag dang / bdag gi bar dmigs su med pas na lus kyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: lus 'di la bdag dang / bdag gi bar dmigs su med pas na lus kyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs so //
translated: Since a self and “mine” are not apprehended in this body, he does not apprehend the characteristics of the body.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des de ltar lus kyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs pas na lus su 'jug pa la re ba med de /🔽lus bskyed pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des de ltar lus kyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs pas na lus su 'jug pa la re ba med de / lus bskyed pa 'am /
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not apprehend the body in this way, he does not hope for the body to engage.

original: 'byung ba'i lam med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i lam med do //
translated: There is no path for the body to be generated or to arise.

original: de 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is engagement?

original: lus 'di la byas pa med /
analyzed: lus 'di la byas pa med /
translated: This body is not made;

original: byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba med pa'o //
translated: it does not arise.

original: lus 'di ni ma byas pa /
analyzed: lus 'di ni ma byas pa /
translated: This body is not made;

original: ma byung ba'i mtshan nyid pas na rgyu dang / rkyen mang po las skyes so //
analyzed: ma byung ba'i mtshan nyid pas na rgyu dang / rkyen mang po las skyes so //
translated: it is characterized by non-arising, and so it arises from many causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa las lus su gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa las lus su gyur te /
translated: The body comes into being from the aggregation of causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: Causes and conditions are not real;

original: ci'ang med pa; phyin ci log dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa; phyin ci log dang ldan pa /
translated: they are nothing whatsoever, and they are associated with error.

original: stong  pa nyid /
analyzed: stong  pa nyid /
translated: They are emptiness;

original: snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: snying po med pa ste /
translated: they are insubstantial.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen de las lus 'di skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen de las lus 'di skyes par gyur to //
translated: This body arises from those causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen nyid skye ba med pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen nyid skye ba med pa /
translated: Causes and conditions are non-arising;🔽they are signless.

original: mtshan ma med pas @86b na de ltar lus la rtog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas @86b na de ltar lus la rtog pa'i tshe /
translated: When one thus contemplates the body,

original: lus 'di  ni  skyes pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus 'di  ni  skyes pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: this body engages with the characteristic of arising.

original: de ltar zhugs nas lus la mtshan nyid med par rtog go /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs nas lus la mtshan nyid med par rtog go /
translated: Having engaged in this way, one will realize that the body has no characteristics.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus la mtshan nyid med par rtogs pas na lus 'di la mtshan ma med par shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus la mtshan nyid med par rtogs pas na lus 'di la mtshan ma med par shes so //
translated: By realizing that the body has no characteristics as they truly are, one will understand that this body is without characteristics.

original: mtshan mar dmigs su med pas na skye ba med par shes so //
analyzed: mtshan mar dmigs su med pas na skye ba med par shes so //
translated: Since characteristics cannot be observed, one will understand that it is unborn.

original: lus 'di ni 'das pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: lus 'di ni 'das pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: This body cannot be observed as a characteristic of the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan ma 'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan ma 'am /
translated: a characteristic of the future,

original: da ltar gyi mtshan mar dmigs su med do //
analyzed: da ltar gyi mtshan mar dmigs su med do //
translated: or a characteristic of the present.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lus 'di la ngo bo nyid du nges pa'i chos su dmigs su med de /
analyzed: lus 'di la ngo bo nyid du nges pa'i chos su dmigs su med de /
translated: Because this body cannot be observed as a phenomenon that is ascertained to have an essence.

original: lus 'di ni bdag dang / gzhan du dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di ni bdag dang / gzhan du dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This body cannot be observed as self or other.

original: de ltar yongs su rtog pa na lus 'di gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la gang du mi 'gro bar shes te /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su rtog pa na lus 'di gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la gang du mi 'gro bar shes te /
translated: When one thoroughly investigates in this way, one will understand that this body does not come from anywhere and does not go anywhere.

original: lus 'di ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gag pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus 'di ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gag pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: This body will enter the path of non-arising and non-ceasing.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su 'jug pa la lus kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la rtog pa ni lus su zhen cing chags pa yongs su sel zhing chod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su 'jug pa la lus kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la rtog pa ni lus su zhen cing chags pa yongs su sel zhing chod par 'gyur te /
translated: “Great bodhisattva beings who thus engage with the body in relation to the body, who contemplate the correct characteristics of engaging with the body, will eliminate and sever attachment and clinging to the body.

original: dran pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus la de ma thag tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus la de ma thag tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be mindful of the body as it is, and will abide in that very moment.

original: de dag ni lus la lus kyi rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni lus la lus kyi rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‘yogis who contemplate the body in relation to the body.’

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /🔽de la ji ltar na byang chub sems @87a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin / de la ji ltar na byang chub sems @87a *//
translated: Lokadhara,

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhe na /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhe na /
translated: how do great bodhisattva beings practice yoga by contemplating feelings in relation to feelings?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ste /
translated: Great bodhisattva beings experience feelings of suffering, feelings of pleasure, and feelings that are neither suffering nor pleasure.

original: tshor ba gsum po la rtog pa na gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la; gang du'ang mi 'gro bar rtogs te /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum po la rtog pa na gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la; gang du'ang mi 'gro bar rtogs te /
translated: When he investigates the three kinds of feelings, he understands that they do not come from anywhere and do not go to anywhere.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen dang / sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i gzugs byas par shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen dang / sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i gzugs byas par shes so //
translated: He understands that they are created by unreal conditions, by the ripening of past karma, and by the inversion of the mind.

original: tshor ba la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i log par rnam par rtog pa las byung bar shes so //
analyzed: tshor ba la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i log par rnam par rtog pa las byung bar shes so //
translated: He understands that feelings arise from unreal, inverted conceptualization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshor ba rnams la rtog pa na 'das pa'i tshor ba la mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshor ba rnams la rtog pa na 'das pa'i tshor ba la mi dmigs /
translated: “When bodhisattvas investigate feelings in this way, they do not focus on past feelings,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba la mi dmigs /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba la mi dmigs /
translated: they do not focus on future feelings,

original: da ltar gyi tshor ba la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi tshor ba la mi dmigs so //
translated: and they do not focus on present feelings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa'i tshor ba rnams la stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa'i tshor ba rnams la stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa /
translated: “Bodhisattvas should view past feelings as empty and selfless,

original: bdag gi ba med /
analyzed: bdag gi ba med /
translated: as not having a self or anything pertaining to a self,

original: mi rtag pa /
analyzed: mi rtag pa /
translated: as impermanent,

original: mi brtan pa /
analyzed: mi brtan pa /
translated: as unstable,

original: snying po med pa /
analyzed: snying po med pa /
translated: as having no core,

original: mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba /
translated: as not changing,

original: mtshan nyid med par blta'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par blta'o //
translated: and as having no characteristics.

original: 'das pa'i tshor ba la'ang stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang / zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i tshor ba la'ang stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang / zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs so //
translated: He understands that past feelings have the characteristic of emptiness, the characteristic of peace, and the characteristic of signlessness.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba rnams la'ang stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba rnams la'ang stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa /
translated: He views future feelings as empty, selfless,

original: bdag @87b gi ba med pa /
analyzed: bdag @87b gi ba med pa /
translated: without a being,

original: mi rtag pa /
analyzed: mi rtag pa /
translated: impermanent,

original: mi brtan pa /🔽snying po med pa /
analyzed: mi brtan pa / snying po med pa /
translated: unstable,🔽without substance,

original: mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba /
translated: without a life-force,

original: med par blta'o //
analyzed: med par blta'o //
translated: and nonexistent.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba rnams la'ang stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang / zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang; mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid du rtog go /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba rnams la'ang stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang / zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang; mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid du rtog go /
translated: He understands that future feelings have the characteristic of emptiness, the characteristic of peace, and the characteristic of signlessness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar rtog pa na 'di snyam du tshor ba ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar rtog pa na 'di snyam du tshor ba ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: “When bodhisattvas contemplate in this way, they think, ‘Feelings have no definitive characteristic.

original: dngos po med pa /
analyzed: dngos po med pa /
translated: They are unreal.

original: gcig tu nges pa'i chos med de /
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa'i chos med de /
translated: They are not a single, definite phenomenon.

original: mi 'dra ba las yang dang / yang skye zhing 'gog go snyam du sems so //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba las yang dang / yang skye zhing 'gog go snyam du sems so //
translated: They arise and cease again and again from dissimilar causes.’

original: tshor ba la gnas pa'i dus med do snyam du sems pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang 'di snyam du tshor ba ni byas pa med /
analyzed: tshor ba la gnas pa'i dus med do snyam du sems pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang 'di snyam du tshor ba ni byas pa med /
translated: When one thinks that there is no time for the abiding of sensation, then the bodhisattva thinks, ‘Sensation is not created,

original: byed pa med de /
analyzed: byed pa med de /
translated: it is not a creator.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i sems las tshor ba rnam pa gsum skyed de /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i sems las tshor ba rnam pa gsum skyed de /
translated: The three kinds of sensation arise from the deluded mind of a foolish, ordinary being.

original: de'ang sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang / da ltar gyi rkyen 'dus pa las tshor ba yod par gyur to //
analyzed: de'ang sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang / da ltar gyi rkyen 'dus pa las tshor ba yod par gyur to //
translated: Moreover, sensation comes into being from the causes of past karma and the present convergence of conditions.

original: tshor ba ni kun kyang stong pa /
analyzed: tshor ba ni kun kyang stong pa /
translated: Sensation is all empty,

original: mi brtan pa /
analyzed: mi brtan pa /
translated: unstable,

original: snying po med pa /
analyzed: snying po med pa /
translated: without essence,🔽and not the nature of reality. It is like an empty house.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid de khang pa stong pa dang mtshungs so; ;de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i tshe tshor ba mang po'i rgyu las sems gcig tu gnas te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid de khang pa stong pa dang mtshungs so; ;de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i tshe tshor ba mang po'i rgyu las sems gcig tu gnas te /
translated: When one thoroughly contemplates in this way, the mind abides in one place from among the many causes of sensation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe tshor ba rnams la 'dus nas 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid chud cing rtog te tshor ba rnams la 'dus pa yang ma yin so so ba'ang ma yin par blta'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe tshor ba rnams la 'dus nas 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid chud cing rtog te tshor ba rnams la 'dus pa yang ma yin so so ba'ang ma yin par blta'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, at that time, having investigated and understood the characteristics of the convergence and cessation of feelings, sees that feelings are neither convergent nor divergent.

original: gzhan yang / tshor ba'i nang na tshor ba mi mthong ste /🔽'di snyam du tshor ba rnams @88a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / tshor ba'i nang na tshor ba mi mthong ste / 'di snyam du tshor ba rnams @88a *//
translated: Moreover, he does not see feelings in feelings.

original: stong pa nyid do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid do snyam du sems so //
translated: He thinks, “Feelings are empty.”

original: rang bzhin stong pas tshor ba'i rnams la ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pas tshor ba'i rnams la ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Because of the emptiness of intrinsic nature, he understands that feelings have the characteristic of non-arising.

original: tshor ba rnams ma skyes pa mi 'gog pas grub pa'i mtshan nyid med par rtogs so //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams ma skyes pa mi 'gog pas grub pa'i mtshan nyid med par rtogs so //
translated: Because feelings that have not arisen are not stopped, he understands that they have no characteristic of accomplishment.

original: de ltar tshor ba rnams yid la byed par chags pa med do //🔽yang dag pa ji ltar /
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba rnams yid la byed par chags pa med do // yang dag pa ji ltar /
translated: Thus, he is not attached to the mental activity of feelings.

original: bzhin du tshor ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid shes shing mthong ngo //
analyzed: bzhin du tshor ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid shes shing mthong ngo //
translated: He correctly sees and understands the characteristics of feelings just as they are.

original: tshor ba rnams dang bral te tshor ba rnams la mi gnas pas tshor ba rnams sems btang snyoms par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams dang bral te tshor ba rnams la mi gnas pas tshor ba rnams sems btang snyoms par 'gyur te /
translated: Free from feelings, not dwelling on feelings, feelings become equanimous for them.

original: des na btang snyoms kyi ting nge 'dzin yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na btang snyoms kyi ting nge 'dzin yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus they attain the meditative absorption of equanimity.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su rtog pa gang la rnal 'byor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su rtog pa gang la rnal 'byor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: this is how bodhisattva great beings are called “practitioners” with regard to the investigation of feelings.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems la sems kyi rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems la sems kyi rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhe na /
translated: how are bodhisattva great beings “practitioners” with regard to the investigation of the mind?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems la skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems la skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog go /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings investigate the mind in terms of its characteristics of arising, ceasing, abiding, and changing.

original: de ltar yongs su rtog pa na 'di snyam du sems 'di ni gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su rtog pa na 'di snyam du sems 'di ni gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la /
translated: When they investigate in this way, they think, “This mind does not come from anywhere,

original: gang du'ang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: gang du'ang mi 'gro ste /
translated: nor does it go anywhere.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / rkyen las skyes pas dngos po med de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / rkyen las skyes pas dngos po med de /
translated: Consciousness arises from conditions, and so is unreal.

original: des pa'i chos su dmigs su med do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: des pa'i chos su dmigs su med do snyam du sems so //
translated: It is not perceived as a real phenomenon.”

original: sems 'di @88b ni 'ongs pa'ang med /
analyzed: sems 'di @88b ni 'ongs pa'ang med /
translated: “This mind does not come from anywhere,

original: song ba'ang med /
analyzed: song ba'ang med /
translated: nor does it go anywhere.

original: gnas pa'am / 'phe ba'ang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: gnas pa'am / 'phe ba'ang dmigs su med do //
translated: It is not perceived as abiding or arising.

original: sems 'di ni 'das pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sems 'di ni 'das pa'ang ma yin /
translated: This mind is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi ma yin te /
translated: nor is it future or present.

original: sems 'di ni rnam par shes pa dang / rkyen dang / rnam par rtog pa las skyes so //
analyzed: sems 'di ni rnam par shes pa dang / rkyen dang / rnam par rtog pa las skyes so //
translated: This mind arises from consciousness, conditions, and thoughts.

original: sems ni nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: sems ni nang na mi gnas /
translated: The mind does not dwell within,

original: phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: nor does it dwell without.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
translated: It does not dwell in between.

original: sems 'di ni skye zhing 'byung ba'i mtshan ma gcig tsam yang med pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'di ni skye zhing 'byung ba'i mtshan ma gcig tsam yang med pa'o //
translated: This mind has not even a single mark of arising or appearing.

original: sems 'di ni ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: sems 'di ni ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: This mind is without essence,

original: nges pa med pa /🔽skyed pa med pa /
analyzed: nges pa med pa / skyed pa med pa /
translated: without certainty,🔽without arising,

original: skyes pa med pa ste /🔽las sna tshogs 'byung ba'i phyir sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa med pa ste / las sna tshogs 'byung ba'i phyir sems zhes bya'o //
translated: and without birth.🔽It is called “mind” because various actions arise.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen sna tshogs las sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen sna tshogs las sems zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “mind” because of the various conditions of consciousness.

original: skad cig skad cig gis skye zhing 'gog pa /
analyzed: skad cig skad cig gis skye zhing 'gog pa /
translated: It arises and ceases from moment to moment.

original: gcig gis bsags pa rgyun mi chad pas sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gcig gis bsags pa rgyun mi chad pas sems zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called mind because it is a continuum of accumulations of moments.

original: de ni so so'i skye bo dag sems kyis mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni so so'i skye bo dag sems kyis mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is so that ordinary beings may understand and realize the characteristic of the non-apprehension of mind.

original: sems la sems kyi mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: sems la sems kyi mtshan nyid med do //
translated: Mind has no characteristic of mind.

original: sems 'di ni thog ma nas ma skyes pa /
analyzed: sems 'di ni thog ma nas ma skyes pa /
translated: This mind is originally unborn,

original: ma byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: ma byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: unoriginated, and pure by nature.

original: glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par rtog kyang sems kyis sems mi shes sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par rtog kyang sems kyis sems mi shes sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo //
translated: Although it is defiled by adventitious afflictions and conceptualized, mind does not know mind, and mind does not see mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems 'di ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems 'di ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: This mind is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid pas na ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid pas na ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Because of emptiness, it is essenceless.

original: sems 'di ni nges bya'i chos can ma yin te /🔽nges pa'i @89a *//
analyzed: sems 'di ni nges bya'i chos can ma yin te / nges pa'i @89a *//
translated: This mind is not a phenomenon to be ascertained,

original: chos su dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos su dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a phenomenon to be ascertained cannot be apprehended.

original: sems 'di ni gcig dang / tha dad pa'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems 'di ni gcig dang / tha dad pa'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this mind is not a phenomenon that is the same or different.

original: sems 'di ni snga ma'i mtha' yang dmigs su med la phyi ma'i mtha' yang dmigs su med de /🔽bar gyi mtha' yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: sems 'di ni snga ma'i mtha' yang dmigs su med la phyi ma'i mtha' yang dmigs su med de / bar gyi mtha' yang dmigs su med do //
translated: This mind is not observed in the past, is not observed in the future, and is not observed in the present.🔽This mind is not observed in the middle, is not observed at the end, and is not observed in the middle or at the end.

original: sems 'di ni gzugs med de /
analyzed: sems 'di ni gzugs med de /
translated: This mind is formless.

original: mthong bar mi nus bas sems nyid kyis sems mi mthong la rang bzhin mi shes te /
analyzed: mthong bar mi nus bas sems nyid kyis sems mi mthong la rang bzhin mi shes te /
translated: Since it cannot be seen, the mind itself does not see the mind, and it does not know its own nature.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo phyin ci log dang ldan pa dag yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen dang / rnam par shes pas dmigs pa'i phyir 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo phyin ci log dang ldan pa dag yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen dang / rnam par shes pas dmigs pa'i phyir 'byung ngo //
translated: Childish ordinary beings who are mistaken arise due to the conditions of what is not real and the observation of consciousness.

original: sems 'di ni stong pa nyid de bdag med pa /
analyzed: sems 'di ni stong pa nyid de bdag med pa /
translated: This mind is emptiness, selfless,

original: bdag gi ba med pa /
analyzed: bdag gi ba med pa /
translated: without a self,

original: mi rtag pa /
analyzed: mi rtag pa /
translated: impermanent,

original: mi brtan pa /
analyzed: mi brtan pa /
translated: unstable,

original: snying po med pa /
analyzed: snying po med pa /
translated: without a core,

original: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa'o //
translated: and not a phenomenon that changes.

original: de ltar sems shing yid la byed pa na sems kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems shing yid la byed pa na sems kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'thob ste /
translated: When one thinks and attends in that way, one attains the application of mindfulness to the mind.

original: gang zag de de'i tshe na sems sam /
analyzed: gang zag de de'i tshe na sems sam /
translated: At that time, that person does not observe the mind,

original: sems ma yin par rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: sems ma yin par rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: They do not conceptualize the mind as not being a non-mind.

original: sems la ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du legs par shes pas sems ma skyes pa nyid du'ang rtogs so //
analyzed: sems la ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du legs par shes pas sems ma skyes pa nyid du'ang rtogs so //
translated: Since they understand the mind as having the characteristic of non-arising, they realize the mind to be non-arisen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems la nges pa'i rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: sems la nges pa'i rang bzhin med de /
translated: The mind has no fixed nature.

original: nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has no fixed characteristic.

original: mkhas pa dag ni de ltar sems la ma skyes pa dang / mtshan nyid med par chud cing rtogs so //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni de ltar sems la ma skyes pa dang / mtshan nyid med par chud cing rtogs so //
translated: The wise ones thus understand and realize the mind to be non-arisen and without characteristics.

original: de'i tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi 'dus pa dang / 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid @89b rtogs te /🔽de ltar rtogs pa na sems pa la kun 'byung ngam /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi 'dus pa dang / 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid @89b rtogs te / de ltar rtogs pa na sems pa la kun 'byung ngam /
translated: At that time, they realize the mind’s true nature, the characteristic of cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ma rnyed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ma rnyed do //
translated: When they realize this, they do not find the characteristic of origination or cessation in the mind.

original: sems la 'gog pa 'am /
analyzed: sems la 'gog pa 'am /
translated: They do not conceptualize the mind as being something that ceases or does not cease.

original: mi 'gog par rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gog par rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They attain the characteristic of the purity of the suchness of the mind, which is free from conceptualization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar sems rnam par dag pas na glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar sems rnam par dag pas na glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Bodhisattvas, in this way, with pure minds, are not afflicted by adventitious afflictions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag gi sems rnam par dag pa nyid du shes shing mthong bas sems can dag gi sems kyang rnam par dag par shes te snyam du sems so; ;sems dri ma yod pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag gi sems rnam par dag pa nyid du shes shing mthong bas sems can dag gi sems kyang rnam par dag par shes te snyam du sems so; ;sems dri ma yod pas na /
translated: Bodhisattvas know and see that their own minds are pure and think that the minds of sentient beings are also pure.🔽If the mind has impurities,

original: sems rnam par dag pas na sems can yang rnam par dag pa'o snyam sems shing yid la byed pa na sems la dri ma'o mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pas na sems can yang rnam par dag pa'o snyam sems shing yid la byed pa na sems la dri ma'o mtshan nyid dam /
translated: because the mind is pure, sentient beings are also pure.🔽When they think and attend to this, they do not apprehend the characteristics of impurities in the mind

original: sems la rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems la rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du mi dmigs te /
translated: or the characteristics of purity in the mind.

original: sems nyid rtag tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du shes so //
analyzed: sems nyid rtag tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du shes so //
translated: They know that the mind itself is always characterized by purity.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos la chos kyi rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos la chos kyi rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhe na /
translated: if bodhisattva-mahāsattvas are yogis who contemplate phenomena according to phenomena,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad la nang ngam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad la nang ngam /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not conceive of any phenomena as existing internally,

original: phyi rol lam /🔽gnyis ka'i bar na yod par mi rtog go; gzhan yang /
analyzed: phyi rol lam / gnyis ka'i bar na yod par mi rtog go; gzhan yang /
translated: externally,🔽or in between.🔽Moreover,

original: chos la 'das pa'am /
analyzed: chos la 'das pa'am /
translated: they do not observe any phenomena as past,

original: ma 'ongs pa 'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'am /
translated: future, or present.

original: da ltar gyi rmi dmigs te chos thams cad rkyen mang po las skyes te /🔽phyin ci log las byung ba'i nges pa'i mtshan @90a *//
analyzed: da ltar gyi rmi dmigs te chos thams cad rkyen mang po las skyes te / phyin ci log las byung ba'i nges pa'i mtshan @90a *//
translated: All phenomena arise from many conditions

original: nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: nyid med pa'o //
translated: and are devoid of the defining characteristics that arise from error.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is how it is:🔽All phenomena are said to be the faculties of individuals, and the essence of phenomena is said to be the absence of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad gang zag dbang po zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad la chos zhes bya ba med de; chos rnams ni chos rnams kyi nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: chos thams cad gang zag dbang po zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad la chos zhes bya ba med de; chos rnams ni chos rnams kyi nang na mi gnas /
translated: Phenomena do not exist within phenomena,

original: chos rnams kyi phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: phenomena do not exist outside of phenomena,

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
translated: and phenomena do not exist in between.

original: chos ni chos dang lhan cig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: chos ni chos dang lhan cig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Phenomena are neither in union with phenomena

original: so so ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: so so ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: nor separate from them.

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are devoid of the defining characteristic of insubstantiality.

original: chos thams cad yod pa ma yin pas na g-yo ba med /
analyzed: chos thams cad yod pa ma yin pas na g-yo ba med /
translated: Since all phenomena do not exist, they are unmoving.

original: byas pa med do //
analyzed: byas pa med do //
translated: They are not produced.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bu ste ci'ang med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bu ste ci'ang med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are like space, utterly nonexistent.

original: chos thams cad ni slu ba'i chos can /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni slu ba'i chos can /
translated: All phenomena are deceptive phenomena.

original: sgyu ma lta bu /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu /
translated: They are like illusions.

original: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristics of illusions cannot be apprehended.

original: chos thams cad rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are pure.

original: ces kyang ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces kyang ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not sullied.

original: chos thams cad ni mi len pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mi len pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: All phenomena are characterized by non-appropriation.

original: len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not appropriated.

original: chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like dreams.

original: rmi lam nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dreams themselves do not exist.

original: chos thams cad ni gzugs med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzugs med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are formless.

original: gzugs ci'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ci'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Form does not exist at all.

original: chos thams cad gzugs brnyan lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad gzugs brnyan lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like reflections.

original: gzugs brnyan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Reflections themselves do not exist.

original: chos thams cad ni ming med /🔽mtshan ma med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ming med / mtshan ma med de /
translated: All phenomena are nameless.🔽They are signless.

original: ming dang / mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang / mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not names or signs.

original: chos thams cad ni brag ca lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni brag ca lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like echoes,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa @90b las byung bas ci'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa @90b las byung bas ci'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are unreal and do not exist.

original: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are without essence,

original: rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their nature is not perceived.

original: chos thams cad ni smig rgyu lta bus te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni smig rgyu lta bus te /
translated: All phenomena are like mirages,

original: ci'ang med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'ang med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are known to be nothing at all.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos thams cad la yongs su rtog na chos thams cad la mtshan nyid gcig pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos thams cad la yongs su rtog na chos thams cad la mtshan nyid gcig pa 'am /
translated: “ When bodhisattvas investigate in this way, they do not see any phenomena as having a single characteristic

original: mtshan nyid tha dad par mi mthong /🔽chos dang / chos lhan cig pa'am /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad par mi mthong / chos dang / chos lhan cig pa'am /
translated: or as having different characteristics.🔽They do not see phenomena as being together with phenomena

original: so so bar mi mthong /
analyzed: so so bar mi mthong /
translated: or as being separate from them.

original: chos la chos gnas par yang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos la chos gnas par yang mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see phenomena as being based on phenomena.

original: der rtog na chos thams cad gzhan nas 'ongs par yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: der rtog na chos thams cad gzhan nas 'ongs par yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: When they investigate in this way, they do not see any phenomena as coming from anywhere else.

original: chos thams cad la gnas pa'i gnas yod par yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la gnas pa'i gnas yod par yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see any basis for the existence of phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: chos thams cad la gnas med /
analyzed: chos thams cad la gnas med /
translated: Because phenomena have no basis.

original: rten med / byung ba med de /
analyzed: rten med / byung ba med de /
translated: They have no support and no origination.

original: chos thams cad gnas med pa ni rten pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad gnas med pa ni rten pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All phenomena are without support because there is no place to support them.

original: dmigs pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are without a place of observation.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: chos thams cad la bye brag med pa ni chos thams cad bye brag tu dbye ba'i mtshan ma med de /🔽rkyen mang po las skyes pas phyin ci log tu bya ba yod kyang chos thams cad ni yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: chos thams cad la bye brag med pa ni chos thams cad bye brag tu dbye ba'i mtshan ma med de / rkyen mang po las skyes pas phyin ci log tu bya ba yod kyang chos thams cad ni yul na mi gnas /
translated: all phenomena are undifferentiated because there are no characteristics that differentiate them.

original: phyogs na mi gnas so //🔽mkhas pa dag ni chos thams cad la mtshan nyid gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas so // mkhas pa dag ni chos thams cad la mtshan nyid gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Although they are produced from many conditions and are subject to error, all phenomena do not abide in a place or a direction.

original: mtshan nyid gnyis su yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gnyis su yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The wise observe that all phenomena are neither of a single characteristic nor of two characteristics,

original: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du'ang ma yin par dmigs so //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du'ang ma yin par dmigs so //
translated: nor are they of different characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: chos thams @91a *//
analyzed: chos thams @91a *//
translated: all phenomena

original: cad ni ma skyes pa /
analyzed: cad ni ma skyes pa /
translated: are unborn,

original: ma byung ba /
analyzed: ma byung ba /
translated: unoriginated,

original: byas pa med pa ste /🔽chos thams cad ni rang bzhin dang bral ba /
analyzed: byas pa med pa ste / chos thams cad ni rang bzhin dang bral ba /
translated: and uncreated.🔽All phenomena are devoid of intrinsic nature

original: ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: and are essenceless.

original: rang bzhin las 'das pa'i phyir ro; ;chos thams cad gnas med pa ni phyin pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin las 'das pa'i phyir ro; ;chos thams cad gnas med pa ni phyin pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All phenomena are without location because they have no location to go to.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la shin tu rtogs pa na chos thams cad la bdag med gang zag med par legs par chung cing rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la shin tu rtogs pa na chos thams cad la bdag med gang zag med par legs par chung cing rtogs so //
translated: Thus, when one realizes all phenomena in this way, one will understand and realize that all phenomena are devoid of self and person.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: One will realize that all phenomena are empty by nature.🔽By realizing that all phenomena are empty, one will realize that all phenomena are signless.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas na chos thams cad mtshan ma med par rtogs so; ;mtshan ma med par blta bas chos thams cad la smon pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas na chos thams cad mtshan ma med par rtogs so; ;mtshan ma med par blta bas chos thams cad la smon pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: By viewing them as signless, one will not form wishes for any phenomena.

original: de'i tshe chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du rtogs pas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du rtogs pas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: At that time, by realizing that all phenomena are unborn, one will think as follows:

original: 'di la yang dag par chos gang yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'di la yang dag par chos gang yang skye ba'am /
translated: ‘Here, there are no phenomena whatsoever that arise

original: 'gog pa med par sems so //
analyzed: 'gog pa med par sems so //
translated: or cease.’

original: de ltar rtog pa'i tshe sems rtse gcig tu gnas pas na de nyid kyis na chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du khong du chud cing chos thams cad kyi kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa zad pa'ang mthong zhing shes so //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa'i tshe sems rtse gcig tu gnas pas na de nyid kyis na chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du khong du chud cing chos thams cad kyi kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa zad pa'ang mthong zhing shes so //
translated: When they contemplate in this way, their minds abide in one-pointed concentration. Therefore, they understand that all phenomena are unborn, and they see and know the cessation of the arising of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma dang bral /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma dang bral /
translated: All phenomena are free from characteristics.

original: rang bzhin dang bral bar yang rtogs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bral bar yang rtogs so //
translated: They also realize that they are free from intrinsic nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: chos thams cad la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pas na chos thams cad mtshan ma med cing mtshan ma dang bral bar khong du chud @91b do; ;'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: chos thams cad la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pas na chos thams cad mtshan ma med cing mtshan ma dang bral bar khong du chud @91b do; ;'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: because all phenomena are without definitive characteristics, they understand that all phenomena are without characteristics and free from characteristics.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos la chos kyi rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos la chos kyi rjes su rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Lokadhara, this is why bodhisattva great beings are called practitioners who contemplate phenomena in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ltar rtogs pa ni chos la dmigs pa med /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa ni chos la dmigs pa med /
translated: Those who realize this do not objectify phenomena.

original: len pa med de /
analyzed: len pa med de /
translated: They do not grasp at them.

original: chos la skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: chos la skyed par mi byed /
translated: They do not cause phenomena to arise.

original: gnas par mi byed /
analyzed: gnas par mi byed /
translated: They do not cause them to abide.

original: 'gog par mi byed par nan tan byed de /
analyzed: 'gog par mi byed par nan tan byed de /
translated: They do not stop it, but rather practice it.

original: des chos thams cad kyi mi 'gog pa zang pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rab tu zhi pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: des chos thams cad kyi mi 'gog pa zang pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rab tu zhi pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mthong ngo //
translated: They see the non-stopping of all dharmas as the characteristic of emptiness and the characteristic of complete peace.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la shin tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la shin tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: these are called the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas’ thorough understanding of the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: ci'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the establishments of mindfulness?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad gzhig pa'i gnas med /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad gzhig pa'i gnas med /
translated: The so-called establishments of mindfulness are the absence of a basis for the destruction of all dharmas,

original: 'byung ba med /
analyzed: 'byung ba med /
translated: the absence of arising,

original: gnas pa'i gnas med par de ltar 'jug na chos thams cad la dran pa mi nyams te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i gnas med par de ltar 'jug na chos thams cad la dran pa mi nyams te /
translated: and the absence of a basis for abiding. If one engages in this way, mindfulness of all dharmas will not decline,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and this is called the establishment of mindfulness.

original: gzhan yang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i chos thams cad ni mi gnas pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mi len par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong ba'i don ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i chos thams cad ni mi gnas pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mi len par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong ba'i don ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: all phenomena of the applications of mindfulness are non-abiding, unborn, and ungrasped. To know and see the meaning of this just as it is is called the application of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste drug go ////
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste drug go ////
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter on the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /🔽de la j ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dbang po rnams la mkhas @92a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin / de la j ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dbang po rnams la mkhas @92a *//
translated: Lokadhara,

original: pa zhe na /
analyzed: pa zhe na /
translated: how are bodhisattva mahāsattvas skilled in the faculties?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga la yang dag par rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga la yang dag par rtog go /
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas accurately understand the five supramundane faculties.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of faith, the faculty of diligence, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dbang po lnga bo la rnal 'byor du spyod pa na chos thams cad rten cing 'brel te byung ba las skyes shing phyin ci log las byung ba dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen las 'dus pas me mgal bskor ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dbang po lnga bo la rnal 'byor du spyod pa na chos thams cad rten cing 'brel te byung ba las skyes shing phyin ci log las byung ba dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen las 'dus pas me mgal bskor ba lta bu'am /
translated: When bodhisattvas practice yoga with regard to the five faculties, they gain confidence that all phenomena arise from dependent origination, that they arise from error, and that they are assembled from unreal conditions, like a whirling firebrand or

original: rmi lam gyi rang bzhin lta bur yid ches so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi rang bzhin lta bur yid ches so //
translated: like the nature of a dream.🔽They gain confidence that all phenomena are impermanent,🔽suffering, impure, without self, painful,

original: chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zug rdul bu dang / shu ba lta bu ste snying po med pa /
