analyzed: chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zug rdul bu dang / shu ba lta bu ste snying po med pa /
translated: and like a tumor, without essence.

original: mi brtan pa /
analyzed: mi brtan pa /
translated: They are unstable,

original: 'gyur zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du yid ches so //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du yid ches so //
translated: and have the characteristic of changing and disintegrating.

original: gzhan yang / chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pas ci'ang med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pas ci'ang med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, they gain confidence that all phenomena are unreal and nonexistent,

original: khu tshur stong pa'am /
analyzed: khu tshur stong pa'am /
translated: like an empty fist or

original: kha dog sdug gu sna tshogs kyis byis pa chung du brid pa lta bur rnam par brtags pa las byung ba ltos pa las yod pa tsam du zad pas dngos por nges pa'i chos su gcig tsam yang med par yid ches so //
analyzed: kha dog sdug gu sna tshogs kyis byis pa chung du brid pa lta bur rnam par brtags pa las byung ba ltos pa las yod pa tsam du zad pas dngos por nges pa'i chos su gcig tsam yang med par yid ches so //
translated: They are like a child’s drawing, which is only there because of the way it is perceived. They are nothing more than mere imputations. They are not even one thing that can be ascertained as a real entity.

original: gzhan yang / chos thams cad ni 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos thams cad ni 'das pa ma yin /
translated: “Moreover, one should have confidence that all phenomena are not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: not future,

original: da ltar gyi ma yin par yid ches @92b so; ;chos thams cad gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la gang yang mi 'gro bar yid ches so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi ma yin par yid ches @92b so; ;chos thams cad gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la gang yang mi 'gro bar yid ches so //
translated: and not present. One should have confidence that all phenomena do not come from anywhere and do not go anywhere.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid /
translated: “One should have confidence that all phenomena are emptiness,

original: mchen ma med pa /
analyzed: mchen ma med pa /
translated: signlessness,

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas par yid ches so; ;chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma byung ba dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bral bar yang yid ches so //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas par yid ches so; ;chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma byung ba dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bral bar yang yid ches so //
translated: and wishlessness. One should have confidence that all phenomena are unborn, unarisen, unmanifest, and free from signs.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa rnam par dag pa la yid ches so //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa rnam par dag pa la yid ches so //
translated: He believes in the purity of morality, the purity of meditation, the purity of wisdom, and the purity of the teaching of the wisdom of liberation.

original: byang chub sems dpas da ltar dad pa'i dbang po lhun gyis grub nas phyir mi ldog par gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas da ltar dad pa'i dbang po lhun gyis grub nas phyir mi ldog par gyur te /
translated: “The bodhisattva now spontaneously achieves the faculty of faith and becomes irreversible.

original: dad pas thog mar 'gro'o //
analyzed: dad pas thog mar 'gro'o //
translated: Faith is the forerunner.

original: de bas na khrims la bde bar gnas pas dad pa mi nyams mi ldog ste /
analyzed: de bas na khrims la bde bar gnas pas dad pa mi nyams mi ldog ste /
translated: Therefore, by abiding in happiness in the precepts, faith is not lost or reversed.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos lhun gyis grub pas mi g-yo ba'i dad pa la gnas te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos lhun gyis grub pas mi g-yo ba'i dad pa la gnas te /
translated: Abiding in unwavering faith, the irreversible Dharma is spontaneously achieved.

original: las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i rjes su dad pa yongs su smin par byed cing ngan par lta ba thams cad yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i rjes su dad pa yongs su smin par byed cing ngan par lta ba thams cad yongs su gcod do //
translated: Faith in the ripening of the fruits of karma brings about maturity and cuts off all bad views.

original: chos mi spong zhing ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das las gzhan yang mi tshol te /
analyzed: chos mi spong zhing ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das las gzhan yang mi tshol te /
translated: One does not abandon the Dharma and does not seek anything else from the Buddha, the World-Honored One, the teacher.

original: rtag tu chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i rjes su 'jug go /
analyzed: rtag tu chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i rjes su 'jug go /
translated: They always follow the truth of all phenomena.

original: dge 'dun gyi spyod pa'i yang dag pa'i lam la 'jug go /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi spyod pa'i yang dag pa'i lam la 'jug go /
translated: They enter the true path of the Saṅgha’s conduct.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gnas shing bzod pa lhun gyis grub pas de ltar mi g-yo mi 'gyur ba'i dad pa dang / dad pa @93a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gnas shing bzod pa lhun gyis grub pas de ltar mi g-yo mi 'gyur ba'i dad pa dang / dad pa @93a *//
translated: Abiding in pure discipline and spontaneously attaining patience, they have such unshakable and unchanging faith,

original: khyad par du gyur pas dad pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pas dad pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and because of their special faith, they are said to possess the faculty of faith.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la yang dag par rtog pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po lhun gyis grub pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la shin tu mkhas pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la yang dag par rtog pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po lhun gyis grub pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la shin tu mkhas pa zhe na /
translated: how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas correctly understand the faculty of diligence, spontaneously attain the faculty of diligence, and become highly skilled in the faculty of diligence?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams brtson 'grus spyod pa mi gtong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams brtson 'grus spyod pa mi gtong /
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas never abandon the practice of diligence.

original: rgyun mi gcod par sgrib pa lnga bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus spyod do //
analyzed: rgyun mi gcod par sgrib pa lnga bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus spyod do //
translated: In order to clear away the five hindrances, they practice diligence without interruption.

original: 'di ltar zab mo'i chos nyan pa'i phyir brtson 'grus spyod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar zab mo'i chos nyan pa'i phyir brtson 'grus spyod do //
translated: In this way, they exert diligence in order to listen to the profound Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos tshol ba la rgyun mi chad pas brtson 'grus rtsom pa las phyir mi ldog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos tshol ba la rgyun mi chad pas brtson 'grus rtsom pa las phyir mi ldog go /
translated: Bodhisattvas are undeterred by the exertion of diligence in their uninterrupted search for the Dharma.

original: sgrib pa'i chos yongs su gcod pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa la zhum pa med do //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i chos yongs su gcod pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa la zhum pa med do //
translated: They are not discouraged by the exertion of diligence in order to eliminate the obscuring phenomena.

original: gzhan yang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / 'jig pa'i chos yongs su spong ba'i phyir brtson 'grus spyod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / 'jig pa'i chos yongs su spong ba'i phyir brtson 'grus spyod do //
translated: Moreover, they exert diligence in order to abandon the various negative and nonvirtuous phenomena and the phenomena of destruction.

original: gzhan yang / dge ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs spel zhing bskyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus spyod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs spel zhing bskyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus spyod do //
translated: Moreover, they exert diligence in order to increase and generate the various virtuous phenomena.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpas gdon mi za bar brtson 'grus lhun gyis grub kyang brtson 'grus la mi chags te mnyam pa'i brtson 'grus la 'jug go /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpas gdon mi za bar brtson 'grus lhun gyis grub kyang brtson 'grus la mi chags te mnyam pa'i brtson 'grus la 'jug go /
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas are spontaneously diligent without a doubt, but they are not attached to diligence and engage in equal diligence.

original: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus lhun gyis grub pas gang zag de yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i chos @93b thams cad khong du chud ci rtogs nas brtson 'grus rab tu spyod do //
analyzed: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus lhun gyis grub pas gang zag de yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i chos @93b thams cad khong du chud ci rtogs nas brtson 'grus rab tu spyod do //
translated: Thus, with spontaneous, irreversible diligence, such people will understand and realize all the teachings of right practice and will then engage in diligence.

original: brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams pas gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams pas gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog ste /
translated: By engaging in diligence, they will not rely on others.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa las shes rab kyi snang ba thob cing phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa las shes rab kyi snang ba thob cing phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: Through engaging in diligence, they will attain the illumination of insight and spontaneously achieve the characteristics of irreversibility.

original: de ltar brtson 'grus las phyir mi ldog pa dang / brtson 'grus khyad par can du gyur pas brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus las phyir mi ldog pa dang / brtson 'grus khyad par can du gyur pas brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because of their irreversible diligence and their special diligence, they are said to possess the faculty of diligence.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa'i dbang po thob cing dran pa'i dbang po la shin tu rnal 'byor can du gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa'i dbang po thob cing dran pa'i dbang po la shin tu rnal 'byor can du gyur pa zhe na /
translated: how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas attain the faculty of mindfulness and become skilled in the faculty of mindfulness?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa rtse gcig tu sdud cing sbyin pa byin pa la 'jam pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan par mthar phyin par rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po srung pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa rtse gcig tu sdud cing sbyin pa byin pa la 'jam pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan par mthar phyin par rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po srung pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang /
translated: and they guard the aggregate of pure conduct that is endowed with celibacy and perfected in purity, and they guard the aggregate of meditative stabilization,

original: shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa'i phung po shin tu srung ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa'i phung po shin tu srung ngo //
translated: the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the wisdom of liberation.

original: rtag tu lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las la sems shing dran par byed /
analyzed: rtag tu lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las la sems shing dran par byed /
translated: They always reflect on and are mindful of the actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: rtag tu mthar phyin pa'i dngos po la sems shing dran par byed /
analyzed: rtag tu mthar phyin pa'i dngos po la sems shing dran par byed /
translated: They always reflect on and are mindful of the perfected thing.

original: chos thams cad skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid gyi thabs la sems shing dran par byed /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid gyi thabs la sems shing dran par byed /
translated: They reflect on and are mindful of the method of the characteristics of the arising, cessation, abiding, and transference of all phenomena.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog @94a *//
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog @94a *//
translated: They reflect on and are mindful of suffering, its origin, its cessation,🔽and the path.

original: pa dang / lam gyi bden pa mthong ba dang / shes par bya ba la sems shing dran par byed /
analyzed: pa dang / lam gyi bden pa mthong ba dang / shes par bya ba la sems shing dran par byed /
translated: They reflect and are mindful of the truth of the path,

original: dbang po rnams dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / lam dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par grol ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba la sems shing dran par byed /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / lam dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par grol ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba la sems shing dran par byed /
translated: and they reflect and are mindful of the application of the faculties, powers, aspects of awakening, path, samādhi, liberation, and meditative absorption.

original: chos thams cad mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma byung ba dang / brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid du sems shing dran par byed /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma byung ba dang / brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid du sems shing dran par byed /
translated: They reflect and are mindful of all phenomena as unborn, unceasing, unconditioned, unarisen, and inexpressible.

original: rtag tu ma skyes pa'i shes rab 'thob par bya ba la sems shing dran par byed /
analyzed: rtag tu ma skyes pa'i shes rab 'thob par bya ba la sems shing dran par byed /
translated: They reflect and are mindful of always attaining the wisdom of non-arising.

original: bzod pa'i ye shes dang / spong ba'i ye shes dang / 'gog pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs par 'dod pa la sems shing dran par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa'i ye shes dang / spong ba'i ye shes dang / 'gog pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs par 'dod pa la sems shing dran par byed /
translated: They reflect and are mindful of the wish to perfect the wisdom of acceptance, the wisdom of elimination, and the wisdom of cessation.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'dod pa la dran par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'dod pa la dran par byed /
translated: They reflect and are mindful of the wish to perfect all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis sems la glags mi rnyed par sems shing dran par byed; rtag tu thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dran par bya ba la sems shing dran par byed de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis sems la glags mi rnyed par sems shing dran par byed; rtag tu thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dran par bya ba la sems shing dran par byed de /
translated: They think and remember that the dharmas of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not find an opportunity in the mind. They think and remember that they should always be mindful of unobstructed wisdom.

original: yang dag par sems pa na lus kyi chos de dag rig pas dran pa de las mi ldog mi nyams so //
analyzed: yang dag par sems pa na lus kyi chos de dag rig pas dran pa de las mi ldog mi nyams so //
translated: When they are correctly thinking, they are aware of those dharmas of the body, and so that mindfulness does not turn back or deteriorate.

original: de ltar rtog pa las gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog na gang zag des de lta bu'i snying po yod pa'i dran pa khyad par can du gyur pas dran pa'i dbang po dbang ldan pa @94b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa las gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog na gang zag des de lta bu'i snying po yod pa'i dran pa khyad par can du gyur pas dran pa'i dbang po dbang ldan pa @94b zhes bya'o //
translated: If they do not rely on others for their understanding in this way, then because they have such a special mindfulness that has the essence, those individuals are said to be powerful with the faculty of mindfulness.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po thob cing ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba thob pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po thob cing ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba thob pa zhe na /
translated: how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas obtain the faculty of samādhi and the application of samādhi?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i sa la gnas pa na rtag tu ting nge 'dzin spyod kyang ting nge 'dzin la mi gnas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i sa la gnas pa na rtag tu ting nge 'dzin spyod kyang ting nge 'dzin la mi gnas /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings abide on the noble grounds, they always practice meditative concentration but do not abide in meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin la mi chags te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la mi chags te /
translated: They are not attached to meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid la shin tu 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba la shin tu thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin shin tu bskyed pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin spyod pas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgo la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid la shin tu 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba la shin tu thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin shin tu bskyed pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin spyod pas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgo la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
translated: They are skilled in the characteristics of meditative concentration, they have attained the application of meditative concentration, they have generated meditative concentration, and they are skilled in the gateway of all meditative concentrations through practicing non-apprehending meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin du 'jug pa la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la mi rten pa dang / dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du 'jug pa la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la mi rten pa dang / dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
translated: They are skilled in entering meditative concentration, skilled in abiding in meditative concentration, skilled in rising from meditative concentration, they do not rely on meditative concentration, they are skilled in the characteristics of objects,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid dmigs pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid dmigs pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: and they are skilled in observing the characteristics of suchness.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ro la'ang mkhas te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ro la'ang mkhas te /
translated: They are also skilled in the taste of all samādhis.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang du gyur pas gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang du gyur pas gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since they have mastery over samādhi, they are not dependent on others and are not swayed by samādhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin las dbang dang mthu'ang thob bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las dbang dang mthu'ang thob bo //
translated: They have attained mastery and power over samādhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin las dka' ba cung zad kyang med par 'dod pa bzhin du gang zag des de ltar ting nge 'dzin khyad par can du gyur pas na /🔽ting nge 'dzin gyi @95a *//
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las dka' ba cung zad kyang med par 'dod pa bzhin du gang zag des de ltar ting nge 'dzin khyad par can du gyur pas na / ting nge 'dzin gyi @95a *//
translated: Without the slightest difficulty in samādhi, they attain whatever they wish. Since the samādhi of those individuals becomes special in this way,🔽they attain the faculty of samādhi

original: dbang po thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po sbyor ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po sbyor ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and attain the application of the faculty of samādhi.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapāla,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi dbang po dang ldan pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang po sbyor ba thob pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi dbang po dang ldan pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang po sbyor ba thob pa zhe na /
translated: how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas attain the faculty of wisdom and attain the application of the faculty of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi dbang po khong du chud cing rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi dbang po khong du chud cing rtogs pa ni /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who comprehend and realize the faculty of wisdom

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are like this.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal rnams 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal rnams 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Suffering will cease in accordance with reality.

original: gang zag des de ltar shes rab kyi gnas dang / shes rab kyi las khong du chud cing rtogs pas rtog pa las dpen te /
analyzed: gang zag des de ltar shes rab kyi gnas dang / shes rab kyi las khong du chud cing rtogs pas rtog pa las dpen te /
translated: That person, by comprehending and realizing the basis of wisdom and the function of wisdom, is secluded from conceptualization.

original: rtog pa btang snyoms su gyur pas mya ngan las 'da' ba la rjes su gzhol ba'i shes rab yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa btang snyoms su gyur pas mya ngan las 'da' ba la rjes su gzhol ba'i shes rab yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By letting go of conceptualization, the wisdom that is directed towards nirvāṇa will be perfected.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po lhun gyis grub pas khams gsum 'di dag ni kun gcig tu 'bar bar shes so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po lhun gyis grub pas khams gsum 'di dag ni kun gcig tu 'bar bar shes so //
translated: By the spontaneous faculty of wisdom, these three realms are known to be completely burning.

original: khams gsum 'di dag ni thams cad kyang sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: khams gsum 'di dag ni thams cad kyang sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: These three realms are all suffering.

original: shes rab de lta bus na khams gsum na mi gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab de lta bus na khams gsum na mi gnas so //
translated: By such wisdom, one does not abide in the three realms.

original: gang zag des de ltar khams gsum 'di dag ni thams cad kyang stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang zag des de ltar khams gsum 'di dag ni thams cad kyang stong pa nyid de /
translated: That person, by knowing that these three realms are all emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa /🔽ma skyes pa /
analyzed: smon pa med pa / ma skyes pa /
translated: wishlessness,🔽non-arising,

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa /
translated: non-production,

original: ma byung ba /
analyzed: ma byung ba /
translated: non-occurrence,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos kyi lam las 'das pa /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos kyi lam las 'das pa /
translated: and transcending the path of conditioned phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs @95b bar rtog pas mgo'i thod la me 'bar ba bzhin du brtson 'grus shin tu rtsom mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs @95b bar rtog pas mgo'i thod la me 'bar ba bzhin du brtson 'grus shin tu rtsom mo //
translated: With such thoughts, they apply themselves with diligence as if their hair or clothes were on fire.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab ni gzhig nus pa med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab ni gzhig nus pa med de /
translated: The wisdom of those bodhisattvas cannot be destroyed.

original: shes rab de lta bu khong du chud pas khams gsum las shin tu 'das te khams gsum gyi dngos po mi gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab de lta bu khong du chud pas khams gsum las shin tu 'das te khams gsum gyi dngos po mi gnas so //
translated: By mastering such wisdom, they transcend the three realms and do not abide in the things of the three realms.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bcad de /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bcad de /
translated: They fully understand all conditioned phenomena

original: rnam par chags pa dang / bcings pa'i chos la mi gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par chags pa dang / bcings pa'i chos la mi gnas so //
translated: and do not abide in phenomena that are attached to or bound up.

original: 'dod pa'i rnam pa lnga la sems kyis skyo zhing gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams la mi gnas pas shes rab khyad par can dang ldan zhing rgya mtsho chen po ltar yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam pa lnga la sems kyis skyo zhing gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams la mi gnas pas shes rab khyad par can dang ldan zhing rgya mtsho chen po ltar yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan no //
translated: Since they are not attached to the five desires and do not dwell in the realms of form or non-form, they possess extraordinary wisdom and are endowed with immeasurable qualities, like the great ocean.

original: shes rab des na chos thams cad kyi sbyong ba la thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab des na chos thams cad kyi sbyong ba la thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through this wisdom, they become unobstructed in purifying all phenomena.

original: gang zag des de ltar shes rab kyis khams gsum khong du chud cing rtogs pas khams gsum la sems mi chags te /
analyzed: gang zag des de ltar shes rab kyis khams gsum khong du chud cing rtogs pas khams gsum la sems mi chags te /
translated: Since this person thus comprehends and realizes the three realms through wisdom, their mind is not attached to the three realms.

original: shes rab khyad par can du gyur pas shes rab kyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi sbyor ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab khyad par can du gyur pas shes rab kyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi sbyor ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because their wisdom becomes extraordinary, it is called the faculty of wisdom and the attainment of the application of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: ci'i phyir dbang po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: why is it called a faculty?

original: mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /🔽mi g-yo ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya / mi g-yo ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
translated: It is called a faculty because it is supreme.🔽It is called a faculty because it is unwavering.

original: mi shigs pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
analyzed: mi shigs pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
translated: It is called a faculty because it is indestructible.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, it is called an organ.

original: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
translated: Because it is not dependent on others, it is called an organ.

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
translated: Because it is not robbed, it is called an organ.

original: yang @96a *// dag pa'i chos la gzhol ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
analyzed: yang @96a *// dag pa'i chos la gzhol ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
translated: Because it is devoted to the true Dharma, it is called an organ.

original: mi chags pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
analyzed: mi chags pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya /
translated: Because it is not attached, it is called an organ.

original: ma bral ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma bral ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is not separated, it is called an organ.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Moreover, Lokapala,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can rnams kyis dbang po la shin tu mkhas pa'i dbang po rnams kyi khyad par slob pa la'ang mkhas par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can rnams kyis dbang po la shin tu mkhas pa'i dbang po rnams kyi khyad par slob pa la'ang mkhas par byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva mahasattva teaches the distinctions of the organs to sentient beings who are skilled in the organs.

original: byang chub sems dpas 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems kyi dbang po rnams kyang shes /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems kyi dbang po rnams kyang shes /
translated: The bodhisattva knows the organs of the mind that possess desire,

original: sems can 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang po'ang shes; sems can zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang po'ang shes; sems can zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
translated: knows the organs of sentient beings that are free from desire, knows the organs of sentient beings that possess anger,

original: sems can zhe sdang dang bral ba'i dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can zhe sdang dang bral ba'i dbang po'ang shes /
translated: they know the faculties of beings who are free from hatred;

original: sems can gti mug dang ldan pa'i dbang po'ang shes; sems can gti mug dang bral ba'i dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can gti mug dang ldan pa'i dbang po'ang shes; sems can gti mug dang bral ba'i dbang po'ang shes /
translated: they know the faculties of beings who are endowed with delusion, and they know the faculties of beings who are free from delusion;

original: sems can ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur ba'i dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur ba'i dbang po'ang shes /
translated: they know the faculties of beings who will fall into the lower realms;

original: sems can lhar skye ba dang / mir skye ba'i dbang po'ang shes /🔽sems can des pa'i sems can gyi dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can lhar skye ba dang / mir skye ba'i dbang po'ang shes / sems can des pa'i sems can gyi dbang po'ang shes /
translated: they know the faculties of beings who will be born as gods and humans;🔽they know the faculties of beings who are gentle;

original: sems can gyi dbang po rab dang / sems can gyi dbang po 'bring dang / sems can gyi dbang po tha ma'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang po rab dang / sems can gyi dbang po 'bring dang / sems can gyi dbang po tha ma'ang shes /
translated: they know the faculties of beings who are superior, average, and inferior;

original: sems can gyi dbang po nyams pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po ma nyams pa'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang po nyams pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po ma nyams pa'ang shes /
translated: they know the faculties of beings who are degenerate and those who are not degenerate;

original: sems can brtson pa dang / mi brtson pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can brtson pa dang / mi brtson pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
translated: they know the faculties of beings who are diligent and those who are not diligent;

original: @96b sems can thabs la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mi mkhas pa'ang shes /
analyzed: @96b sems can thabs la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mi mkhas pa'ang shes /
translated: they know the faculties of beings who are skilled in means and those who are not skilled in means;

original: sems can kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / rjes su gzhol ba dang /
analyzed: sems can kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / rjes su gzhol ba dang /
translated: It is with regard to sentient beings who have faults and who do not have faults, who have stains and who do not have stains, who have anger and who do not have anger, who are engaged in following and who are not engaged in following, who are distracted and who are not distracted, who are liberated and who are not liberated, who are subdued and who are not subdued, who are in the formless realm and who are not in the formless realm, who are in the form realm and who are not in the form realm, who are in the desire realm and who are not in the desire realm, who are in the three realms and who are not in the three realms, who are in the three realms and who are not in the three realms, who are in the three realms and who are not in the three realms, who are in the three realms and who are not in the three realms, who are in the three realms and who are not in the three realms, who are in the three realms and who are not in the three realms, who are in the three realms and who are not in the three realms, who are in the three realms and who are not in the three

original: rjes su mi gzhol ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: rjes su mi gzhol ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
translated: He knows the faculties of sentient beings that are with and without offense, that are with and without stain, that are with and without hatred, that are with and without attachment,🔽that are with and without obstruction.

original: sems can gyi 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du byed dang / gzugs yod pa'i khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du byed kyi dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du byed dang / gzugs yod pa'i khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du byed kyi dbang po'ang shes /
translated: He knows the faculties of sentient beings that are in the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba stug pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba srab pa dang / nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba stug pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba srab pa dang / nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
translated: He knows the faculties of sentient beings that are of thick roots of virtue, that are of thin roots of virtue, that are definite, that are indefinite, and that are wrongly definite.

original: sems can ser sna dang bcas pa dang / ser sna med pa dang / rgod pa dang / mi rgod pa dang / slu ba'i chos can dang / mi slu ba'i chos can dang / 'phyar ba dang / mi 'phyar ba dang / khro zhing mi bzod pa dang /
analyzed: sems can ser sna dang bcas pa dang / ser sna med pa dang / rgod pa dang / mi rgod pa dang / slu ba'i chos can dang / mi slu ba'i chos can dang / 'phyar ba dang / mi 'phyar ba dang / khro zhing mi bzod pa dang /
translated: He knows the faculties of beings who are stingy and not stingy, who are agitated and not agitated, who are deceptive and not deceptive, who are arrogant and not arrogant, who are angry and not patient,

original: des shing bzod pa dang / shin tu ser sna dang bcas pa dang / sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
analyzed: des shing bzod pa dang / shin tu ser sna dang bcas pa dang / sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'ang shes /
translated: and who are patient and not angry. He knows the faculties of those who are very stingy and those who are generous.

original: sems can gyi dad pa'i dbang po dang / ma dad pa'i dbang po dang / bsti stang dang bcas pa dang / bsti stang med pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par mdag pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi dad pa'i dbang po dang / ma dad pa'i dbang po dang / bsti stang dang bcas pa dang / bsti stang med pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par mdag pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: He knows the faculties of beings who have faith and who do not have faith, who are respectful and who are not respectful, who have moral discipline and who have broken moral discipline, who are patient and who are angry,

original: le lo dang bcas pa dang / @97a *//
analyzed: le lo dang bcas pa dang / @97a *//
translated: who are diligent and who are lazy,🔽and who are concentrated and who are distracted.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / sems g-yeng ba dang / sems ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab dang / shes rab ldan pa dang / glen pa dang / glen pa med pa dang / nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang /🔽nga rgyal med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lam spyod pa dang / lam ngan pa spyod pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / dran pa dang ldan pa dang / blo dang ldan pa dang / dbang po 'khrugs pa dang / dbang po sdud pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / sems g-yeng ba dang / sems ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab dang / shes rab ldan pa dang / glen pa dang / glen pa med pa dang / nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang / nga rgyal med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lam spyod pa dang / lam ngan pa spyod pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / dran pa dang ldan pa dang / blo dang ldan pa dang / dbang po 'khrugs pa dang / dbang po sdud pa dang /
translated: those with diligence and those without diligence, those with distracted minds and those with minds that are focused in samādhi, those with faulty wisdom and those with wisdom, those who are foolish and those who are not, those with pride and those without pride,🔽those who follow the right path and those who follow the wrong path, those with impaired mindfulness and those with mindfulness, those with intelligence and those with disturbed faculties, those who gather their faculties and those with impaired faculties,

original: dbang po nyams pa dang / dbang po ma nyams pa dang; dbang po ma dag pa dang / dbang po dag pa dang / theg pa chung du'i dbang po dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa dang / dbang po ma nyams pa dang; dbang po ma dag pa dang / dbang po dag pa dang / theg pa chung du'i dbang po dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po dang /
translated: those with unimpaired faculties, those with impure faculties and those with pure faculties, those with faculties of the Hīnayāna, those with pratyekabuddha faculties, those with bodhisattva faculties,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi dbang po'ang shes so //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi dbang po'ang shes so //
translated: and those with unsurpassed bodhi faculties.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des de ltar dbang po'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba las shin tu 'das pas sems can de dag gi dbang po'i khyad par rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des de ltar dbang po'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba las shin tu 'das pas sems can de dag gi dbang po'i khyad par rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, by transcending the distinctions of faculties and applications, is said to be skilled in discerning the distinctions of faculties of those sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyis gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i phyir dbang po'i sbyor ba thob pa zhes bya'o //🔽gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: shes rab kyis gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i phyir dbang po'i sbyor ba thob pa zhes bya'o // gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya /
translated: Because of wisdom, he is said to have attained the application of faculties.🔽He is said to be unassailable.

original: mi shigs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: mi shigs pa zhes bya /
translated: He is said to be indestructible.

original: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya /
translated: He is said to be irreversible.

original: sbyor ba'i stobs thob pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i stobs thob pa zhes bya /
translated: He is said to have attained the power of application.

original: dbang po la 'jug pa zhes bya /
analyzed: dbang po la 'jug pa zhes bya /
translated: He is said to have entered the faculties.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod @97b sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i dbang po thob pa zhes bya /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod @97b sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i dbang po thob pa zhes bya /
translated: He is said to have attained the faculties of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and so forth.

original: dbang po mchog thob pa zhes bya /
analyzed: dbang po mchog thob pa zhes bya /
translated: He is said to have attained the supreme faculties.

original: mi 'jigs mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya /
analyzed: mi 'jigs mi g-yo ba thob pa zhes bya /
translated: He is said to have attained fearlessness and imperturbability.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called the perfection.

original: tshad med pa'i yon tan lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i yon tan lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the spontaneous accomplishment of immeasurable qualities.

original: chos thams cad la mthu dang / dbang myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mthu dang / dbang myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will swiftly attain power and mastery over all phenomena.”

original: dbang po lnga zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bdun no ////
analyzed: dbang po lnga zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bdun no ////
translated: This was the seventh chapter, “The Five Powers,” from the bodhisattva’s great collection on the perfection of wisdom called “The Ornament of the Light of Wisdom.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin ces bya ba'i mdo /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin ces bya ba'i mdo /
translated: The Sūtra on the Retention of the World

original: bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma /
translated: Fourth and Final Part

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: gzhan yang / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i lam la mkhas pa zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i lam la mkhas pa zhe na /
translated: “Moreover, Lokapāla, how are bodhisattva mahāsattvas skilled in the noble path?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i lam la bde bar gnas pa dag gi lam zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i lam la bde bar gnas pa dag gi lam zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is called the path of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who abide in bliss in the noble path?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad de /
translated: The eightfold noble path.

original: de dag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: de dag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: They are right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and right concentration.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad po la spyod pa ni gang 'phags pa'i @98a *//
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad po la spyod pa ni gang 'phags pa'i @98a *//
translated: if you ask what it means for bodhisattva great beings to practice the eightfold noble path,

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad po la sbyor ba thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad po la sbyor ba thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: what does it mean to attain the application of the eightfold noble path?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i lta bar gyur pas yang dag par lta ba la bde bar gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i lta bar gyur pas yang dag par lta ba la bde bar gnas te /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings, through right view, abide in comfort in right view.

original: lta ba thams cad yongs su bcad pa'i phyir lam la nan tan du byed de /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad yongs su bcad pa'i phyir lam la nan tan du byed de /
translated: In order to eliminate all views, they practice the path.

original: lta ba thams cad yongs su bcad pa'i phyir lam la bde bar gnas shing mya ngan las 'das par lta ba dang / sangs rgyas su lta ba'i bar du yang yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad yongs su bcad pa'i phyir lam la bde bar gnas shing mya ngan las 'das par lta ba dang / sangs rgyas su lta ba'i bar du yang yongs su gcod do //
translated: In order to completely cut off all views, they abide in bliss on the path and cut off the view of nirvāṇa, up to the view of buddhahood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: ji tsam du lta bar gyur pa thams cad ni mya ngan las 'da' bar lta ba dang / sangs rgyas su lta ba'i bar du thams cad kyang ngan par lta ba ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du lta bar gyur pa thams cad ni mya ngan las 'da' bar lta ba dang / sangs rgyas su lta ba'i bar du thams cad kyang ngan par lta ba ste /
translated: all views, up to the view of nirvāṇa and the view of buddhahood, are all bad views.

original: lta ba la chags pa thams cad yongs su 'jig cing gzhom pa'i phyir yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba la chags pa thams cad yongs su 'jig cing gzhom pa'i phyir yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they completely destroy and overcome all attachments to views, they are called right views.

original: gzhan yang / lta ba med cing lta bar mi len pa dang / mi sems pa dang / mi chags pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang / mi spyod pa dang / lta ba thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa ni yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / lta ba med cing lta bar mi len pa dang / mi sems pa dang / mi chags pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang / mi spyod pa dang / lta ba thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa ni yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, not having views, not grasping at views, not thinking, not being attached, not observing, not engaging, and being free of concepts regarding all views is called right view.

original: yang dag par lta ba des ci mthong zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba des ci mthong zhe na /
translated: If you ask what is seen through right view,

original: 'jig rten 'di dag thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log tu lta bas yongs su bcings par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dag thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log tu lta bas yongs su bcings par mthong ngo //
translated: He sees that all these worlds are bound by false, inverted views.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i tshe na lta ba thams cad yongs su gcad pa la bde bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i tshe na lta ba thams cad yongs su gcad pa la bde bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When he sees this, he is said to abide in the cutting off of all views.

original: yang dag par lta ba de @98b nyid la'ang mi sems /
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba de @98b nyid la'ang mi sems /
translated: He does not even think about that right view,

original: mi lta / mi chags /
analyzed: mi lta / mi chags /
translated: does not look at it, does not become attached to it,

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: and does not conceptualize it.

original: mya ngan las 'das par lta ba dang / sangs rgyas su lta ba'i bar du med pa ni lta ba thams cad mi skyed pa la nan tan byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par lta ba dang / sangs rgyas su lta ba'i bar du med pa ni lta ba thams cad mi skyed pa la nan tan byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is diligent in not producing any views, up to and including the view of nirvana and the view of the Buddha.

original: de la ji ltar na yang dag par lta bas chos thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mi skye mi 'gog cing mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa gang zhe na; 'di ltar mi rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos thams cad la mi rtog /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na yang dag par lta bas chos thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mi skye mi 'gog cing mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa gang zhe na; 'di ltar mi rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos thams cad la mi rtog /
translated: “How does right view pacify all dharmas, which are by nature neither produced nor stopped, and accord with nirvana? It is like this: He does not conceptualize or discriminate any dharmas, which are nonconceptual and nondiscriminatory.

original: rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog /
translated: He does not conceptualize or discriminate.

original: mngon sum du byed pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not something that is directly perceived.

original: mi mtho / mi dma'/
analyzed: mi mtho / mi dma'/
translated: It is not high or low.

original: mi len / mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: mi len / mi gtong ba ste /
translated: It is not something that is taken up or put down.

original: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the correct view that transcends the world.

original: de la ji ltar na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the correct view that transcends the world?

original: gang 'jig rten du'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten du'ang mi dmigs /
translated: It is not something that is perceived in the world.

original: 'jig rten las 'das par yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das par yang mi dmigs /
translated: It is not something that is perceived as transcending the world.

original: 'jig rten las 'das par yang mi dmigs te rnam par mi rtog pas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das par yang mi dmigs te rnam par mi rtog pas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not something that is perceived as not transcending the world. It is nonconceptual. This is called the correct view that transcends the world.

original: gzhan yang / yang dag par lta ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la ji ltar shes pa dang / mthong ba ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang de bzhin de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / yang dag par lta ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la ji ltar shes pa dang / mthong ba ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang de bzhin de /
translated: “Moreover, the correct view is that just as one knows and sees the world, so too one sees what transcends the world.

original: gang 'jig rten dang / gang 'jig rten las 'das par yang rnam par mi rtog cing rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes thams cad yongs su gcad pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba zhes @99a *//
analyzed: gang 'jig rten dang / gang 'jig rten las 'das par yang rnam par mi rtog cing rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes thams cad yongs su gcad pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba zhes @99a *//
translated: It is called the supramundane right view because it does not conceptualize either the mundane or the supramundane, and because it eliminates all conceptual thoughts.

original: bya'o // gang zhig ngan par yang mi lta la /🔽yang dag par yang mi lta zhing sems kyis rtog pa thams cad yongs su bcad pa ni yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o; ;gzhan yang /
analyzed: bya'o // gang zhig ngan par yang mi lta la / yang dag par yang mi lta zhing sems kyis rtog pa thams cad yongs su bcad pa ni yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o; ;gzhan yang /
translated: It is called right view because it does not see anything as bad,🔽and because it eliminates all conceptual thoughts.

original: yang dag par lta ba ni chos thams cad la khyad par med pa ni yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba ni chos thams cad la khyad par med pa ni yang dag par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, right view is called right view because it is the absence of any distinction in all dharmas.

original: gzhan yang / yang dag par lta ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngan par lta ba'i don shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yang dag par lta ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngan par lta ba'i don shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, right view is the knowledge of the meaning of bad views just as it is.

original: gzhan yang / yang dag par lta ba ni ngan par lta ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / yang dag par lta ba ni ngan par lta ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, right view is the realization of the sameness of all bad views.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag par lta ba la bde bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag par lta ba la bde bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the bodhisattvas’ blissful abiding in right view.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag par lta ba la bde bar gnas nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i rtog pa shes te /🔽de 'di snyam du ji tsam du rtog par gyur pa thams cad log pa yin pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag par lta ba la bde bar gnas nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i rtog pa shes te / de 'di snyam du ji tsam du rtog par gyur pa thams cad log pa yin pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa'am /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings blissfully abide in right view, they will understand right thought as it truly is.

original: sangs rgyas su rtog pa'i bar du thams cad ngan par rtog pa'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su rtog pa'i bar du thams cad ngan par rtog pa'o snyam du sems so //
translated: They will think, ‘All thoughts are false, so to think of nirvāṇa or even to think of buddhahood is a mistaken thought.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rnam par rtog pa yongs su bcad pa ni yang dag par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yongs su bcad pa ni yang dag par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The elimination of conceptualization is called right thought.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni yang dag par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni yang dag par rtog pa'o //
translated: Non-conceptualization is right thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is conceptualization.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ltar rtog pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid mthong zhing shes @99b pas na ngan par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid mthong zhing shes @99b pas na ngan par rtog pa med de /
translated: Since they see and understand the characteristics of all thoughts in this way, they do not have bad thoughts.

original: gang zag de ni 'di'am gzhan zhes rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag de ni 'di'am gzhan zhes rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not think, ‘This is here or there.’

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i rtog pa la gnas pas na yang dag par rtog pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i rtog pa la gnas pas na yang dag par rtog pa'am /
translated: Since they abide in correct thought in this way, they have correct thought.

original: ngan par yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: ngan par yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: They do not think badly either.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas rnam par rtog pa las 'das te yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas rnam par rtog pa las 'das te yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are free from all thoughts in this way, they transcend thought and are called ‘correct thought.’

original: yang dag par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: ‘Correct thought’ means seeing and understanding that all thoughts are incorrect,

original: mi bden pa /
analyzed: mi bden pa /
translated: untrue,

original: phyin ci log las byung bar mthong zhing shes te /
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung bar mthong zhing shes te /
translated: and arise from error.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad la rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad la rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not think about any thoughts.

original: de ltar yang dag par rtog pa las gnas nas yang dag pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par rtog pa las gnas nas yang dag pa'am /
translated: Since they abide in correct thought in this way, they do not observe correct or

original: ngan par rtog pa la mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ngan par rtog pa la mi dmigs te /
translated: bad thoughts.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa /
translated: It transcends conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa yongs su bcad pas na yang dag par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yongs su bcad pas na yang dag par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it completely severs conceptualization, it is called right conceptualization.

original: de ltar de'i tshe na rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis ma bcings te rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam par shes shing mthong ba ni yang dag par rtog pa las gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i tshe na rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis ma bcings te rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam par shes shing mthong ba ni yang dag par rtog pa las gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, not bound by any conceptualization, knowing and seeing the nature of all conceptualizations to be the same is called abiding in right conceptualization.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i ngag la rtsom pa ni ji snyed kyi tshig tu smra ba thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i ngag la rtsom pa ni ji snyed kyi tshig tu smra ba thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: when bodhisattva mahāsattvas begin right speech, they understand that all the words spoken are not true,

original: mi bden pa /
analyzed: mi bden pa /
translated: not real,

original: phyin ci log las byung ba /
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung ba /
translated: arisen from error,

original: log par rnam par brtags pa /
analyzed: log par rnam par brtags pa /
translated: and falsely imagined.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen mang po las byung bar shes nas 'di snyam @100a *//
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen mang po las byung bar shes nas 'di snyam @100a *//
translated: Arising from many causes and conditions, they think,

original: du ji tsam du tshig tu smra ba nyid la dmigs su med de /
analyzed: du ji tsam du tshig tu smra ba nyid la dmigs su med de /
translated: ‘As much as there are words spoken, there is no reference point.

original: tshig thams cad 'gags nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngag gi las thams cad shes pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshig thams cad 'gags nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngag gi las thams cad shes pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
translated: When all words are stopped, and one knows all verbal actions as they really are, this is called right speech.

original: tshig tu smra ba'i ngag de nyid kyang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la gang du'ang mi 'gro ba mthong na yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //🔽de ltar de'i tshe na yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la bde bar gnas pas ji tsam du tshig tu smra ba thams cad yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshig tu smra ba'i ngag de nyid kyang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la gang du'ang mi 'gro ba mthong na yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o // de ltar de'i tshe na yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la bde bar gnas pas ji tsam du tshig tu smra ba thams cad yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
translated: When one sees that the speech of verbal expression does not come from anywhere and does not go anywhere, this is called right speech.🔽Thus, at that time, by abiding in the characteristic of the right, all verbal expressions are called right speech.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i ngag la bde bar gnas na don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngag gi las la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i ngag la bde bar gnas na don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngag gi las la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, if one abides in right speech, it is called abiding in the verbal action of ultimate purity.

original: ngag gi las kyi mtshan nyid shes shing mthong ba dang / tshig tu smra ba'i ngag thams cad khong du chud cing tshig tu smra ba thams cad 'khrul pa med pas de bas na yang dag pa'i ngag la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngag gi las kyi mtshan nyid shes shing mthong ba dang / tshig tu smra ba'i ngag thams cad khong du chud cing tshig tu smra ba thams cad 'khrul pa med pas de bas na yang dag pa'i ngag la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is to understand all speech and to be without error in all speech. Therefore, it is called the correct speech.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams las thams cad la ngan pa log pa'i las su shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams las thams cad la ngan pa log pa'i las su shes so //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas know that all actions are negative and mistaken.

original: las thams cad la yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: las thams cad la yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: They know that all actions are not real,

original: ci'ang med pa /🔽mngon par 'dus ma byas pa /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa /
translated: that they are nothing at all,🔽that they are unconditioned,

original: ma byung bar shes so //
analyzed: ma byung bar shes so //
translated: and that they do not arise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: las thams cad la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: las thams cad la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: Because all actions have no definitive characteristics.

original: las thams cad 'gog pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i las zhes bya'o //🔽yang dag pa'i las zhes bya ba ni las @100b ngan pa'am /
analyzed: las thams cad 'gog pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i las zhes bya'o // yang dag pa'i las zhes bya ba ni las @100b ngan pa'am /
translated: Because all actions are stopped, it is called correct action.

original: las yang dag par rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: las yang dag par rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: Correct action means not conceptualizing good or bad actions.

original: las rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid la zhugs pas log pa'am /
analyzed: las rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid la zhugs pas log pa'am /
translated: Because it is engaged in the sameness of all actions, it is not mistaken,🔽and because it is engaged in the sameness of all actions, it is not correct.

original: yang dag par rnam par mi rtog pas de'i phyir yang dag pa'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rnam par mi rtog pas de'i phyir yang dag pa'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is not conceptualized as real, it is called right action.

original: yang dag pa'i las zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la ma chags pa'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong ba'i don to //🔽yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid la mnyam pa nyid du gyur pas yang dag pa 'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la ma chags pa'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong ba'i don to // yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid la mnyam pa nyid du gyur pas yang dag pa 'am /
translated: Right action means the meaning of nonattachment to the three realms, the meaning of seeing and knowing reality as it is.

original: log par mi rtog go /🔽byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yang dag pa'i las la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du las thams cad shes shing mthong ba'i phyir chos thams cad mi len /
analyzed: log par mi rtog go / byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yang dag pa'i las la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du las thams cad shes shing mthong ba'i phyir chos thams cad mi len /
translated: Because it is the same as right reality, it is right and not conceptualized as wrong.

original: mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mi mthong ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas, in this way, know and see all actions as they really are in right action, and therefore do not grasp or see any dharmas.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' la nan tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' la nan tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called right livelihood.

original: yang dag pa'i las la las ngan pa med de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las la las ngan pa med de /
translated: In right action there is no bad action,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong bas yang dag pa'i las kyis mtha' la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong bas yang dag pa'i las kyis mtha' la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and because it is known and seen as it really is, it is called abiding in right action.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'tsho ba thams cad la log pa'i 'tsho bar shin tu shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'tsho ba thams cad la log pa'i 'tsho bar shin tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva knows that all livelihood is wrong livelihood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽To the extent that there are signs of livelihood, signs of phenomena, signs of appropriation, up to signs of nirvāṇa, signs of buddhahood, and signs of purity,

original: ji tsam du 'tsho ba'i mtshan ma dang / chos kyi mtshan ma dang / len pa'i mtshan ma nas mya ngan las 'da' pa'i mtshan ma dang / sangs rgyas kyi mtshan ma'i bar dang / rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas su mtshan mar 'dzin te /🔽de la tshor ba @101a *//
analyzed: ji tsam du 'tsho ba'i mtshan ma dang / chos kyi mtshan ma dang / len pa'i mtshan ma nas mya ngan las 'da' pa'i mtshan ma dang / sangs rgyas kyi mtshan ma'i bar dang / rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas su mtshan mar 'dzin te / de la tshor ba @101a *//
translated: to that extent there is grasping at signs of buddhahood.

original: rnam par dag par 'dzin na log par 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'dzin na log par 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: If one grasps at the purity of feelings, that is called wrong livelihood.

original: yang dag par 'tsho ba ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad la chags pa thams cad btang ste tshong dpogs kyang yongs su bcad nas rtog pa med cing spros pa med la spros pa thams cad las 'das pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'tsho ba ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad la chags pa thams cad btang ste tshong dpogs kyang yongs su bcad nas rtog pa med cing spros pa med la spros pa thams cad las 'das pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Right livelihood is when one gives up all attachment to the requisites of livelihood, abandons even the thought of commerce, is without conceptualization, without proliferation, and beyond all proliferation. That is called right livelihood.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la ngan pa'i 'tsho ba'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la ngan pa'i 'tsho ba'am /
translated: In right livelihood, there is no wrong livelihood.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bar rnam par mi rtog pa ni thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i 'tsho ba 'thob par 'gyur bas de bas na rnam par dag pa'i yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bar rnam par mi rtog pa ni thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i 'tsho ba 'thob par 'gyur bas de bas na rnam par dag pa'i yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Non-conceptuality with regard to right livelihood” means that one attains a livelihood that is pure in all ways. Therefore, it is called “attaining a pure right livelihood.”

original: gzhan yang / 'tsho ba thams cad ni kun kyang ma skyes pas log pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'tsho ba thams cad ni kun kyang ma skyes pas log pa'am /
translated: Moreover, all livelihoods are false because they are unborn.

original: yang dag pa med de /
analyzed: yang dag pa med de /
translated: They are neither real nor unreal.

original: gang zag de ni rnam par dag pa'i 'tsho ba thob cing yang dag pa'i lam la bde bar gnas pa spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag de ni rnam par dag pa'i 'tsho ba thob cing yang dag pa'i lam la bde bar gnas pa spros pa med pa'o //
translated: That person attains a pure livelihood and abides happily on the right path, free of conceptual elaboration.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba de la gnas pas yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba mi len /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba de la gnas pas yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba mi len /
translated: Abiding in that right livelihood, one does not take up right livelihood.

original: log par 'tsho ba mi spong ste /
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba mi spong ste /
translated: One does not abandon wrong livelihood.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o /
translated: Therefore, it is called “abiding in right livelihood.”

original: ;gang de'i tshe de ltar gyur pa ni yang dag pa la gnas pa zhes kyang mi bya /
analyzed: ;gang de'i tshe de ltar gyur pa ni yang dag pa la gnas pa zhes kyang mi bya /
translated: At that time, it is neither called “abiding in the right”

original: ngan pa la gnas pa zhes kyang mi bya ste /
analyzed: ngan pa la gnas pa zhes kyang mi bya ste /
translated: nor is it called “abiding in the wrong.”

original: rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi 'tsho ba thob ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi 'tsho ba thob ste /
translated: They attain the livelihood of pure equality.

original: 'tsho ba'i mtshan ma dang bral bas g-yo ba med /🔽mngon par 'du bya ba med /🔽'tsho bar mi rtog /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i mtshan ma dang bral bas g-yo ba med / mngon par 'du bya ba med / 'tsho bar mi rtog /
translated: Free from the signs of livelihood, they are unmoving.🔽They do not form mental constructs.🔽They do not conceptualize livelihood.

original: 'tsho ba ma yin par mi rtog go /
analyzed: 'tsho ba ma yin par mi rtog go /
translated: They do not conceptualize non-livelihood.

original: de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes @101b ba dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes @101b ba dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ste /
translated: This is knowing and seeing things as they really are.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called right livelihood.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la mkhas pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la mkhas pa ni gang /
translated: what is the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas’ expertise in right effort?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la gnas pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la gnas pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is it for the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas to abide in right effort?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtson 'grus kyi lam thams cad gcod pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtson 'grus kyi lam thams cad gcod pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because bodhisattvas cut off all paths of diligence, it is called abiding in right effort.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtsol ba thams cad ni kun kyang log pa ste /
analyzed: rtsol ba thams cad ni kun kyang log pa ste /
translated: All efforts are also reversed.

original: ji tsam du bskyed pa dang / byed pa dang / spyod pa thams cad kyang log pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du bskyed pa dang / byed pa dang / spyod pa thams cad kyang log pa'o //
translated: All that is generated, created, and practiced is reversed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos thams cad ni byed pa log pa las byas par yod par gyur te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni byed pa log pa las byas par yod par gyur te /
translated: All phenomena are created from the reversal of creation.

original: thams cad yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: They are all unreal.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas na log pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas na log pa'o //
translated: Since they are unreal, they are reversed.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa med /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa med /
translated: What is called right effort is not generated,

original: byas pa med /
analyzed: byas pa med /
translated: not created,

original: spyod pa med /
analyzed: spyod pa med /
translated: not practiced,

original: smon pa med de /
analyzed: smon pa med de /
translated: and not wished for.

original: chos thams cad la byas pa yongs su bcad pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la byed pa yongs su bcad pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad la byas pa yongs su bcad pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la byed pa yongs su bcad pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: It is the elimination of creation in all phenomena.🔽Because bodhisattvas eliminate creation in all phenomena, they do not create the signs of nirvāṇa,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan ma'i bar du'ang byed pa'i mtshan ma mi skyed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan ma'i bar du'ang byed pa'i mtshan ma mi skyed do //
translated: up to the signs of buddhahood.

original: de ltar bya ba thams cad la yang dag pa ma yin par shes pas bya ba med pa'i phyir rnal 'byor du spyod do //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba thams cad la yang dag pa ma yin par shes pas bya ba med pa'i phyir rnal 'byor du spyod do //
translated: Thus, by knowing that all activities are not real, they are not engaged in, and so one practices yoga.

original: gang yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la ni mngon par 'du bya ba med de /
analyzed: gang yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la ni mngon par 'du bya ba med de /
translated: Those who are truly diligent do not make any effort.

original: chos @102a *// thams cad mnyam pa /
analyzed: chos @102a *// thams cad mnyam pa /
translated: All phenomena are equal,

original: khyad par med pa /
analyzed: khyad par med pa /
translated: without distinction,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa /
translated: without effort,🔽and beyond the signs of effort.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan ma la shin tu 'das so; ;byang chub sems dpas de ltar brtson 'grus la brtson 'grus ma yin par shes te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan ma la shin tu 'das so; ;byang chub sems dpas de ltar brtson 'grus la brtson 'grus ma yin par shes te /
translated: Bodhisattvas know that diligence is not diligence.

original: mi len mi gtong bas yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi len mi gtong bas yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they neither grasp nor reject, they are said to abide in right effort.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus la dmigs su med pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus la dmigs su med pa'i don to //
translated: Right effort means that diligence is not an object.

original: chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong ba'i don to //
translated: It means to know and see phenomena as they are.

original: gang de ltar yang dag pa'i rtsol ba mthong ba ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'am /
