analyzed: gang de ltar yang dag pa'i rtsol ba mthong ba ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'am /
translated: Those who see right effort in this way do not see right effort or wrong effort.

original: log pa'i rtsol bar rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: log pa'i rtsol bar rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: They do not conceptualize wrong effort.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called right effort.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i dran pa la mkhas pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i dran pa la mkhas pa zhe na /
translated: how are bodhisattva mahāsattvas skilled in right mindfulness?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa thams cad dran pa log par shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dran pa thams cad dran pa log par shes so //
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas know that all mindfulness is mistaken mindfulness.

original: ji tsam du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thams cad dran pa log pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thams cad dran pa log pa'o //
translated: All the foundations of mindfulness are mistaken mindfulness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dran pa thams cad ni dran pa log pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa thams cad ni dran pa log pa ste /
translated: All mindfulness is mistaken mindfulness.

original: gal te gnas la dmigs nas dran pa skyed na'ang dran pa log pa ste /
analyzed: gal te gnas la dmigs nas dran pa skyed na'ang dran pa log pa ste /
translated: If mindfulness arises by observing a basis, that is mistaken mindfulness.

original: gang sems pa dang / dran pa med pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems pa dang / dran pa med pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of thought and mindfulness is called right mindfulness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dran pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin @102b par log par dmigs pa'i rkyen las byung bas na de'i phyir ji tsam du dran pa skye bar gnas de thams cad log pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin @102b par log par dmigs pa'i rkyen las byung bas na de'i phyir ji tsam du dran pa skye bar gnas de thams cad log pa'o //
translated: All memories arise from the conditions of false, inverted observations. Therefore, all the places where memories arise are inverted.

original: dmigs pa'i gnas mi skye mi 'gog pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i gnas mi skye mi 'gog pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nondwelling and unceasing basis of observation is called right mindfulness.

original: gang dran pa'i las 'byung ba'i gnas med pa ni rnam par dag pa'i dran pa la bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang dran pa'i las 'byung ba'i gnas med pa ni rnam par dag pa'i dran pa la bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The absence of a basis for the arising of the activity of memory is called right mindfulness.

original: de la ni dran pa log par 'byung ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: de la ni dran pa log par 'byung ba'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no basis for the arising of inverted memory.

original: de ltar chos thams cad log par shes shing mthong bas yang dag pa'i chos la dran pa med de /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad log par shes shing mthong bas yang dag pa'i chos la dran pa med de /
translated: Thus, by knowing and seeing all phenomena as inverted, there is no memory of right phenomena.

original: de'i phyir na yang dag pa'i dran pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang dag pa'i dran pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called right mindfulness.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni log pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa rnam par mi 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni log pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa rnam par mi 'byed pa'o //
translated: Right mindfulness is the nondifferentiation of inverted and right mindfulness.

original: de ltar dran pa thams cad la dran pa'i mtshan ma med par khong du chud cing rtogs pas rtag tu btang snyams kyi sems drug spyod de /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa thams cad la dran pa'i mtshan ma med par khong du chud cing rtogs pas rtag tu btang snyams kyi sems drug spyod de /
translated: Thus, by understanding and realizing that all mindfulness is devoid of the characteristics of mindfulness, they always practice the six recollections.

original: de'i phyir na yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called right mindfulness and right concentration.

original: de ltar de la chags shing zhen pa med pas dran pa med par yang rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: de ltar de la chags shing zhen pa med pas dran pa med par yang rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: Since they are not attached to or fixated on that, they are also not conceptual in the absence of mindfulness.

original: chos thams cad la dran pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs so //🔽de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dran pa thams cad shes shing mthong bas dran pa'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dran pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs so // de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dran pa thams cad shes shing mthong bas dran pa'am /
translated: They realize the sameness of all mindfulness with respect to all phenomena.🔽Thus, by knowing and seeing all mindfulness as it truly is, they do not grasp at mindfulness

original: dran pa ma yin par mi len /
analyzed: dran pa ma yin par mi len /
translated: or non-mindfulness.

original: mi gtong ste /
analyzed: mi gtong ste /
translated: They do not abandon them.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i dran pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //🔽de ltar dran pa des mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i dran pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o // de ltar dran pa des mnyam pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is called right mindfulness and right concentration.🔽In that way, that mindfulness does not distinguish between what is the same

original: mi mnyam pa nyid du rnam par mi 'byed la /🔽dran pa @103a *//
analyzed: mi mnyam pa nyid du rnam par mi 'byed la / dran pa @103a *//
translated: and what is not the same.🔽It does not engage with or observe

original: dang / dran pa ma yin pa la'ang mi 'jug mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dang / dran pa ma yin pa la'ang mi 'jug mi dmigs so //
translated: mindfulness or non-mindfulness.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pas dran pa thams cad la dran pa ma yin par shes te /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pas dran pa thams cad la dran pa ma yin par shes te /
translated: In this way, by not objectifying, they know that all mindfulness is not mindfulness.

original: dran pa dang / dran pa ma yin pa la sems mi 'byed do //🔽de ltar des yang dag pa'i dran pa la gnas pas bstan du med /🔽brjod du med /🔽tshig tu smra ba'i lam thams cad bcad pa /
analyzed: dran pa dang / dran pa ma yin pa la sems mi 'byed do // de ltar des yang dag pa'i dran pa la gnas pas bstan du med / brjod du med / tshig tu smra ba'i lam thams cad bcad pa /
translated: They do not discriminate between mindfulness and not mindfulness.

original: tshig tu smra ba'i lam thams cad dang bral ba'o //🔽yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshig tu smra ba thams cad shes pas bdag gam /
analyzed: tshig tu smra ba'i lam thams cad dang bral ba'o // yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshig tu smra ba thams cad shes pas bdag gam /
translated: In this way, by abiding in right mindfulness, they cut off all paths of speech and are free from all paths of speech.

original: gzhan du rnam par mi 'byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par mi 'byed do //
translated: They know all speech that is in accord with reality just as it is, and do not discriminate between self and other.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i dran pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i dran pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called abiding in right mindfulness.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa zhe na /
translated: how do bodhisattva-mahāsattvas abide in right samādhi?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ting nge 'dzin thams cad la log pa'i ting nge 'dzin du rtogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ting nge 'dzin thams cad la log pa'i ting nge 'dzin du rtogs so //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas realize that all samādhis are false samādhis.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ji tsam du chos thams cad la ting nge 'dzin du mi dmigs pa la zhugs pa las ting nge 'dzin la mtshan mar shes /
analyzed: ji tsam du chos thams cad la ting nge 'dzin du mi dmigs pa la zhugs pa las ting nge 'dzin la mtshan mar shes /
translated: Because it is the case that, to the extent that one engages in the non-apprehension of all phenomena as meditative absorption, one is aware of the signs of meditative absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dga' ba la 'jug pas ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma thams cad log pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dga' ba la 'jug pas ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma thams cad log pa'o //
translated: By engaging in the joy of meditative absorption, all the signs of meditative absorption are reversed.

original: log pa ni chags pa'i don yin gyi de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: log pa ni chags pa'i don yin gyi de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi de lta ma yin no //
translated: Reversal has the meaning of attachment, but that is not the case with meditative absorption.

original: ji ltar dmigs pa la zhugs pa'i mtshan ma nyid log pa'i mtshan ma med cing re ba med /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa la zhugs pa'i mtshan ma nyid log pa'i mtshan ma med cing re ba med /
translated: Just as the signs of engagement with an object are reversed, there are no signs, no hopes,

original: spros pa med /
analyzed: spros pa med /
translated: no conceptual elaborations,

original: rtog @103b pa med pa ni ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //🔽gal te chags shing zhen pa med na bdag gam /
analyzed: rtog @103b pa med pa ni ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o // gal te chags shing zhen pa med na bdag gam /
translated: and no thoughts. This is called meditative absorption.🔽If there is no attachment or clinging, there is no conceptualization in terms of self or

original: gzhan du rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: other.

original: chags pa'i dga' ba bcad nas ting nge 'dzin gyi rol mi len cing ting nge 'dzin du 'jug pa'i mtshams bcad de /
analyzed: chags pa'i dga' ba bcad nas ting nge 'dzin gyi rol mi len cing ting nge 'dzin du 'jug pa'i mtshams bcad de /
translated: Having cut off the joy of attachment, one does not take up the taste of meditative absorption and cuts off the boundary of engagement with meditative absorption.

original: sems ci la'ang mi gnas pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems ci la'ang mi gnas pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: The mind that does not abide anywhere is called right meditative absorption.

original: gzhan yang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mi gnas shing spros pa med pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pas ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid la shin tu mkhas shing sems
analyzed: gzhan yang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mi gnas shing spros pa med pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pas ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid la shin tu mkhas shing sems
translated: Moreover, “right samādhi” means not abiding in any samādhi, being free from conceptual elaboration, and being skilled in the characteristics of samādhi through realizing the essence of phenomena just as they are.

original: ci la'ang mi chags pa'o //
analyzed: ci la'ang mi chags pa'o //
translated: The mind is not attached to anything.

original: bdag dang / gzhan du rtog pa'i lam gcod cing ji skad du smra ba la'ang rnam par mi rtog la rnam par rtog pa thams cad bcad pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan du rtog pa'i lam gcod cing ji skad du smra ba la'ang rnam par mi rtog la rnam par rtog pa thams cad bcad pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “right samādhi” because it cuts off the path of conceptualizing self and other, is free from discursive thought, and severs all conceptualization.

original: gzhan yang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin log pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin log pa'am /
translated: Moreover, “right samādhi” means not producing wrong or🔽right perceptions,

original: yang dag pa'i 'du shes mi skyed cing 'du shes thams cad bcom pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'du shes mi skyed cing 'du shes thams cad bcom pa /
translated: having destroyed all perceptions,

original: 'du shes thams cad bcad pa /
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad bcad pa /
translated: and having severed all perceptions.

original: 'du shes thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “right samādhi” because it stops all perceptions.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni log pa'am yang dag pa mi skyed la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni log pa'am yang dag pa mi skyed la /
translated: “Right samādhi” means not producing error or correctness.

original: log pa / yang dag par rnam par mi 'byed pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: log pa / yang dag par rnam par mi 'byed pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Not distinguishing error or correctness is called “right samādhi.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin du sbyor ba thams cad khong du chud cing @104a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin du sbyor ba thams cad khong du chud cing @104a *//
translated: Bodhisattvas understand all the applications of samādhi.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas ting nge 'dzin nam /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas ting nge 'dzin nam /
translated: Abiding in right samādhi, they are not bound by samādhi

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan mas 'ching bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan mas 'ching bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: or the characteristics of samādhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la shin tu 'das pas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la shin tu 'das pas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they have completely transcended the characteristics of samādhi, it is called “abiding in right samādhi.”

original: gzhan yang / chos thams cad la spros pa med cing mnyam pa'i chos la log pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos thams cad la spros pa med cing mnyam pa'i chos la log pa 'am /
translated: Moreover, all phenomena are free of conceptual elaboration and are equal. There is no error or correctness in the Dharma of equality.

original: yang dag par spros pa med do; ;yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni chos thams cad mnyam pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par spros pa med do; ;yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni chos thams cad mnyam pa'i don to //
translated: Right samādhi is the meaning of the equality of all phenomena.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / khams gsum gyi 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lam rgyud lngar 'khor ba thams cad shes shing mthong ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / khams gsum gyi 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lam rgyud lngar 'khor ba thams cad shes shing mthong ba'i don to //
translated: Right samādhi is the transcendence of all samādhis and all conditioned phenomena of the three realms. It is the meaning of knowing and seeing the path just as it is, all the way to the end of saṃsāra in the five destinies.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i lam la mkhas pa dang / lam gyi sbyor ba la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'phags pa'i lam la mkhas pa dang / lam gyi sbyor ba la mkhas pa ste /
translated: thus bodhisattva mahāsattvas are skilled in the noble path and skilled in the application of the path.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, through knowing and seeing things just as they are, they will reach the end of saṃsāra.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba'i le'u ste brgyad do ////
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba'i le'u ste brgyad do ////
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter on the noble eightfold path.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mkhas pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mkhas pa ni gang /
translated: what is the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ skill in worldly and transcendent phenomena?

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las @104b 'das pa'i chos la sbyor ba thob pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las @104b 'das pa'i chos la sbyor ba thob pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is it to attain the mundane and supramundane dharmas?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos yang dag pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos yang dag pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas correctly understand the mundane and supramundane dharmas.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi chos gang zhe na /
translated: What are the mundane dharmas?

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du de tsam du chos la rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa ni phyin ci log las skyes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du de tsam du chos la rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa ni phyin ci log las skyes te /
translated: Bodhisattvas think, ‘The mere conceptualization and discursive thought about phenomena arise from error.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen gyis bskyed pas yang dag pa ma yin pa la rag lus so //
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen gyis bskyed pas yang dag pa ma yin pa la rag lus so //
translated: Since they are produced by causes and conditions, they are not real but depend on something else.

original: mtshan ma gnyis las byung bas stong pa ci'ang med pa ni nya lcibs la snang ba'i kha dog sna tshogs dang me mgal bskor ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma gnyis las byung bas stong pa ci'ang med pa ni nya lcibs la snang ba'i kha dog sna tshogs dang me mgal bskor ba lta bu ste /
translated: Since they arise from two characteristics, they are empty and nonexistent, like the various colors that appear in a fish’s eyes or like a fire wheel.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag slu ba'o //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag slu ba'o //
translated: They deceive childish ordinary beings.

original: 'jig cing nyams pa'i chos can las bla dags su 'jig rten ces btags pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig cing nyams pa'i chos can las bla dags su 'jig rten ces btags pa ste /
translated: They are subject to destruction and decay, and the term “mundane” is designated in reference to that.

original: de la 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos 'di dag ni thams cad bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos 'di dag ni thams cad bden pa ma yin te /
translated: “Worldly phenomena” are all not true.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen las skyes par byas pa dang / byung ba'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen las skyes par byas pa dang / byung ba'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: They are created from unreal conditions and have no characteristics of arising.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la btags te ming dang / gzugs kyi phyir bshad do //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la btags te ming dang / gzugs kyi phyir bshad do //
translated: They are explained to be the aggregates, elements, sense bases, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tactile objects, and mental objects, and are designated as name-and-form.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo sems chags shing zhen pas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su chags shing zhen pa ni kha tshar dar 'dzings pa'am /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo sems chags shing zhen pas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su chags shing zhen pa ni kha tshar dar 'dzings pa'am /
translated: Foolish ordinary beings, with attached minds, are attached to various things, like a ball of thread

original: rtsva khri shing glags pa gcig la gcig 'brel pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rtsva khri shing glags pa gcig la gcig 'brel pa lta bu ste /
translated: or like grass and sticks entangled with each other.

original: phyin ci log dang ldan pa rjes su 'jig @105a *//🔽rten gyi chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang ldan pa rjes su 'jig @105a *// rten gyi chos zhes brjod do //
translated: They are mistaken and follow after each other.🔽This is called a worldly phenomenon.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang zhe na /
translated: “Supramundane phenomena” are as follows.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi chos thog ma nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dben pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi chos thog ma nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dben pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The world is originally empty and quiescent, and this is called transcending the world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mkhas pa dag ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyang dmigs su med /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyang dmigs su med de /🔽'jig rten dag 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas kyang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyang dmigs su med / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyang dmigs su med de / 'jig rten dag 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas kyang dmigs su med do //
translated: The wise do not apprehend the world,🔽nor do they apprehend transcending the world.

original: de la 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang rnam par brtag tu med de /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang rnam par brtag tu med de /
translated: The world and transcending the world are both unapprehendable.🔽The world and transcending the world are both unapprehendable.

original: 'jig rten gyi phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes brjod kyi 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes brjod kyi 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The world is called transcending the world because of the world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la nges pa'i mtshan nyid du dmigs su med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la nges pa'i mtshan nyid du dmigs su med do //
translated: The world has no definite characteristics that can be apprehended.

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni thog ma nas stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni thog ma nas stong pa nyid de /
translated: The characteristics of the world and transcending the world are originally empty.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of worldly phenomena are uncertain.

original: 'jig rten ni thog ma nas rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni thog ma nas rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The world is characterized by primordial quiescence.

original: byang chub sems dpas de ltar 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la dmigs su med par rtog pas 'jig rten gyi chos la'ang mi chags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de ltar 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la dmigs su med par rtog pas 'jig rten gyi chos la'ang mi chags /
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas contemplate the worldly and world-transcending phenomena as being beyond reference points, and so they are not attached to worldly phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa la'ang mi chags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa la'ang mi chags so //
translated: They are also not attached to world-transcending phenomena.

original: de ltar 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mi rton cing mi chags pas 'jig rten dang @105b rtsod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mi rton cing mi chags pas 'jig rten dang @105b rtsod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they do not rely on or become attached to worldly or world-transcending phenomena, and so they do not dispute with the world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mkhas pa dag ni 'jig rten la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rtogs so //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni 'jig rten la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rtogs so //
translated: The wise understand and realize that the characteristics of the world are not real.

original: 'jig rten la yang dag pa ma yin par mthong bas 'jig rten nam 'jig rten las 'das par mi rtog go /
analyzed: 'jig rten la yang dag pa ma yin par mthong bas 'jig rten nam 'jig rten las 'das par mi rtog go /
translated: Because they see the world as unreal, they do not conceptualize the world or world-transcending phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i don to //
translated: The so-called world refers to the meaning of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad der ma 'dus pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad der ma 'dus pa med do //
translated: There is nothing in the world that is not included in this.

original: mkhas pa dag gis brtags na phung po med de /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis brtags na phung po med de /
translated: When the wise investigate, they find that there are no aggregates.

original: phung pos phung por mi dmigs /
analyzed: phung pos phung por mi dmigs /
translated: The aggregates cannot be apprehended as aggregates.

original: phung po'i rang bzhin du mi dmigs /🔽phung po 'ongs pa'i gnas dmigs su med /
analyzed: phung po'i rang bzhin du mi dmigs / phung po 'ongs pa'i gnas dmigs su med /
translated: They cannot be apprehended as the nature of the aggregates.🔽The place where the aggregates come from cannot be apprehended.

original: 'dug pa'i gnas kyang dmigs su med /
analyzed: 'dug pa'i gnas kyang dmigs su med /
translated: The place where they stay cannot be apprehended.

original: song ba'i gnas kyang dmigs su med de /
analyzed: song ba'i gnas kyang dmigs su med de /
translated: The place where they go cannot be apprehended.

original: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad kyang dmigs su med /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad kyang dmigs su med /
translated: The five aggregates, the twelve sense sources, and the eighteen elements cannot be apprehended.

original: rnam par brtag tu med /
analyzed: rnam par brtag tu med /
translated: They cannot be investigated.

original: ming med / rang bzhin med /
analyzed: ming med / rang bzhin med /
translated: They have no name, no nature,

original: mtshan nyid med /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med /
translated: no characteristics,

original: spyod du med pas 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod du med pas 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and cannot be practiced. Therefore, they are called supramundane.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos yongs su rtog pa'i tshe 'jig rten gyi chos rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang lhan cig pa ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos yongs su rtog pa'i tshe 'jig rten gyi chos rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang lhan cig pa ma yin /
translated: When bodhisattva-mahāsattvas contemplate mundane and supramundane phenomena, mundane phenomena are not separate from supramundane phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyang 'jig rten gyi chos dang bral ba ma yin /🔽de ltar gang zag des de ltar 'jig rten dang ma bral bar 'jig rten las 'das @106a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyang 'jig rten gyi chos dang bral ba ma yin / de ltar gang zag des de ltar 'jig rten dang ma bral bar 'jig rten las 'das @106a *//
translated: Supramundane phenomena are also not separate from mundane phenomena.

original: pa'i chos kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: pa'i chos kyang mthong ngo //
translated: In this way, without being separate from the mundane, that person also sees supramundane phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang ma bral bar 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang ma bral bar 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyang mthong ngo //
translated: Without being separate from supramundane phenomena, they also see mundane phenomena.

original: de ltar gang zag des spyod pa rnam pa gnyis la mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag des spyod pa rnam pa gnyis la mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: In this way, that person does not observe the two kinds of conduct:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: the true characteristics of the mundane are supramundane.

original: 'jig rten la 'jig rten gyi mtshan nyid dmigs su med /
analyzed: 'jig rten la 'jig rten gyi mtshan nyid dmigs su med /
translated: The characteristics of the world cannot be observed in the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos la 'jig rten gyi chos dmigs su med de /🔽de ltar ci'ang med pas chos de rtogs shing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos la 'jig rten gyi chos dmigs su med de / de ltar ci'ang med pas chos de rtogs shing /
translated: The characteristics of worldly phenomena cannot be observed in worldly phenomena.

original: khong du chud pa na 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa na 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is like this, with nothing at all, when one realizes and comprehends this Dharma, it is called ‘supramundane.’

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: ci ste 'jig rten zhes bya ba 'jig rten las 'das pa dang tha dad pa ma yin na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du'ang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: ci ste 'jig rten zhes bya ba 'jig rten las 'das pa dang tha dad pa ma yin na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du'ang mi 'byung la /
translated: if what is called the world is not separate from the supramundane, then the blessed buddhas would not appear in the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten thams cad dmigs pa med par yang mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten thams cad dmigs pa med par yang mi gsung ngo //
translated: The Thus-Gone One would not teach that all worlds are unobservable.

original: 'jig rten thams cad ni ma skyes pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten thams cad shes shing mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad ni ma skyes pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten thams cad shes shing mthong ngo //
translated: Since all worlds are unborn, all worlds are known and seen as they are.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: gang 'jig rten du mi dmigs shing 'jig rten la mi 'jug pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten du mi dmigs shing 'jig rten la mi 'jug pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: that which is unobservable in the world and does not engage with the world is supramundane.

original: de bas na 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should understand it like this:

original: yang dag pa ji ltar bzhin du 'jig rten rtogs shing 'jig rten dmigs su med par khong du chud pas @106b 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji ltar bzhin du 'jig rten rtogs shing 'jig rten dmigs su med par khong du chud pas @106b 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “transcending the world” because it understands the world as it really is, and because it penetrates the non-apprehension of the world.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung ngo //🔽ji tsam du chos su gtogs pa 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung ngo // ji tsam du chos su gtogs pa 'jig rten nam /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat Buddha appears in the world.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad mi gnyis pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad mi gnyis pa /
translated: All that is included in the Dharma, whether mundane or supramundane, is non-dual.

original: dbyer med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbyer med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is understood and seen as it really is, without distinction or division, it is called a supramundane Dharma.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: de ltar 'jig rten ni shin tu zab cing gting dpag dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten ni shin tu zab cing gting dpag dka' ba'o //
translated: the world is thus very profound and difficult to fathom.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos la gnas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos la dmigs pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la re ba dang / kun rdzob tu smra ba'i tshig la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du dmigs pa dang / chos gnyis la gnas pa ni chos 'di la 'bab cing 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos la gnas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos la dmigs pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la re ba dang / kun rdzob tu smra ba'i tshig la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du dmigs pa dang / chos gnyis la gnas pa ni chos 'di la 'bab cing 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Abiding in worldly dharmas, taking worldly dharmas as objects, hoping for supramundane dharmas, taking the characteristics of ultimate truth to be the words of conventional speech, and abiding in dualistic dharmas—none of these will lead to engaging with and entering this Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ltar gang zag de ni 'jig rten mi shes /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag de ni 'jig rten mi shes /
translated: Because such people do not understand the world,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa mi shes te chos rnam pa gnyis spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa mi shes te chos rnam pa gnyis spyod pa'o //
translated: and do not understand what is beyond the world, they engage with dualistic dharmas.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: chos rnam pa gnyis spyod pa na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chud cing rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnam pa gnyis spyod pa na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chud cing rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: when one engages with dualistic dharmas, one will not understand or realize the world and what is beyond the world.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la shin tu mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyor ba'ang thob pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la shin tu mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyor ba'ang thob pa'o //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas are thus very skilled in worldly and supramundane dharmas, and they have also attained the application of worldly and supramundane dharmas.

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba'i le'u ste dgu pa'o ////
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba'i le'u ste dgu pa'o ////
translated: This is the ninth chapter, on the worldly and supramundane dharmas.

original: @107a *// 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: @107a *// 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos shin tu mkhas pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos shin tu mkhas pa ni gang /
translated: what is it for bodhisattva-mahāsattvas to be very skilled in conditioned and unconditioned dharmas?

original: 'dus byas dang; 'dus ma byas pa'i chos kyi sbyor ba thob pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang; 'dus ma byas pa'i chos kyi sbyor ba thob pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is it to attain the application of conditioned and unconditioned dharmas?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams rnam par 'byed cing yang dag par rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams rnam par 'byed cing yang dag par rtog go /
translated: bodhisattva-mahāsattvas discern and understand conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: de la ji ltar na 'dus byas kyi chos la rnam par 'byed cing yang dag par rtog pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na 'dus byas kyi chos la rnam par 'byed cing yang dag par rtog pa zhe na /
translated: How does one discern and understand conditioned phenomena?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos ni mngon par 'dus pa ste tshor ba byed /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos ni mngon par 'dus pa ste tshor ba byed /
translated: Conditioned phenomena are the result of coming together and the experience of sensation.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos ni rang skyes shing rang bgrang ba'i grangs su gtogs pas 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos ni rang skyes shing rang bgrang ba'i grangs su gtogs pas 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Conditioned phenomena are included in the enumeration of things that arise and are counted. Therefore, they are called conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa'i 'du byed kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa'i 'du byed kyi dbang gis so //
translated: Conditioned phenomena are the result of the power of conditioning that comes from the coming together of unreal causes and conditions.

original: 'du byed ces bya ba ni bgrang ba'i grangs su gtogs shing mtshan nyid gnyis kyi rkyen gyis shes pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi chos zhes btags so //
analyzed: 'du byed ces bya ba ni bgrang ba'i grangs su gtogs shing mtshan nyid gnyis kyi rkyen gyis shes pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi chos zhes btags so //
translated: Conditioning is included in the enumeration of things that are counted and are known through the conditions of the two characteristics. Therefore, they are called conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos de ni byas pa med /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos de ni byas pa med /
translated: Those conditioned phenomena are not created.

original: byed pa med kyi rang skyes pas bskyed pa'ang med do //
analyzed: byed pa med kyi rang skyes pas bskyed pa'ang med do //
translated: They are not made, but arise by themselves. They are not produced.

original: de bas na 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni nang na mi gnas /
translated: Conditioned phenomena do not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: nor do they exist externally.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas /
translated: It does not abide between the two.

original: gcig pa ma yin /
analyzed: gcig pa ma yin /
translated: It is not the same.

original: tha dad pa ma yin te /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa las @107b chung ngo //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin te / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa las @107b chung ngo //
translated: It is not different.🔽It is not real.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis byung gi yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis byung gi yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not produced by the power of ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyi mthus spyod pa yod kyang byas pa med /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mthus spyod pa yod kyang byas pa med /
translated: Although it exists through the power of volitional action, it is not created.

original: byung ba med pas 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byung ba med pas 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it does not arise, it is called conditioned.

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni mtshan mas bcings pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni mtshan mas bcings pa'i don te /
translated: Conditioned means bound by characteristics.

original: bus pa ma rabs phyin ci log la chags pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs phyin ci log la chags pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: It is explained for the sake of childish, ordinary beings who are attached to error.

original: mkhas pa dag shin tu chung cing rtogs pa ni 'dus byas kyi chos su mi dmigs /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag shin tu chung cing rtogs pa ni 'dus byas kyi chos su mi dmigs /
translated: The wise do not apprehend conditioned phenomena as small or as realized.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos su rtogs par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos su rtogs par mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend conditioned phenomena as realized.

original: mkhas pa dag ni grangs su mi bgrang ba'i phyir 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni grangs su mi bgrang ba'i phyir 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The wise do not count them, so they are called conditioned phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mkhas pa dag 'dus byas kyi rnam pa de la ji ltar na chud cing rtogs pa zhe na /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag 'dus byas kyi rnam pa de la ji ltar na chud cing rtogs pa zhe na /
translated: The wise do not apprehend the aspects of conditioned phenomena as realized.

original: mkhas pa dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa dngos po med cing rnam par bcings pa med de /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa dngos po med cing rnam par bcings pa med de /
translated: The wise see that all conditioned phenomena are not real, are nonexistent, and are not bound.

original: bgrang ba'i grangs su mi rtogs par blta'o //
analyzed: bgrang ba'i grangs su mi rtogs par blta'o //
translated: They are not conceptualized as countable things.

original: de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i tshe 'dus byas kyi chos la'ang mi chags /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i tshe 'dus byas kyi chos la'ang mi chags /
translated: When contemplating in this way, they do not become attached to conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos su'ang mi len to //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos su'ang mi len to //
translated: They do not grasp at conditioned phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos las gzhan pa 'dus ma byas pa'i chos yod pa'am /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos las gzhan pa 'dus ma byas pa'i chos yod pa'am /
translated: there are no unconditioned phenomena apart from conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos las gzhan pa 'dus byas kyi chos yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos las gzhan pa 'dus byas kyi chos yod pa ma yin te /
translated: and there are no conditioned phenomena apart from unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid de ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid de ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the reality of conditioned phenomena are unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'dus byas kyi nang sna 'dus byas pa med /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi nang sna 'dus byas pa med /
translated: There are no conditioned phenomena within conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi nang na 'dus ma byas pa med kyi skye bo phyin ci log tu thar pa dag gis 'dus @108a *//
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi nang na 'dus ma byas pa med kyi skye bo phyin ci log tu thar pa dag gis 'dus @108a *//
translated: and there are no unconditioned phenomena within unconditioned phenomena. However, due to the mistaken views of beings, conditioned phenomena are seen as unconditioned, and unconditioned phenomena are seen as conditioned.

original: byas kyi mtshan nyid shes shing mthong bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ni 'dus byas ba'o //
analyzed: byas kyi mtshan nyid shes shing mthong bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ni 'dus byas ba'o //
translated: In order to understand and see the characteristics of the conditioned, it is explained in a differentiated way: ‘This is conditioned,

original: 'di ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: this is unconditioned,

original: 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: this is the characteristic of the conditioned,

original: 'di ni 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes rnam par phye ste bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes rnam par phye ste bshad do //
translated: this is the characteristic of the unconditioned.’

original: de la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is called the characteristic of the conditioned?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'pho ba'o //
translated: arising, ceasing, abiding, and changing.

original: de la 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is called the characteristic of the unconditioned?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mi skye ba dang / mi 'gog pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / mi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba dang / mi 'gog pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / mi 'pho ba'o //
translated: non-arising, non-ceasing, non-abiding, and non-changing.

original: de ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang bus pa so so'i skye bo dag bkri ba'i don du gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang bus pa so so'i skye bo dag bkri ba'i don du gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the characteristics of the conditioned and the unconditioned are taught for the sake of guiding the childish ordinary beings.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos ni ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos ni ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: conditioned phenomena have the characteristic of non-arising.

original: mi 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: mi 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The characteristic of non-cessation,

original: mi gnas pa dang / mi 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi gnas pa dang / mi 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of non-abiding and non-transference.

original: gnas pa dang / 'pho bar gsungs pa'ang mtshan ma med cing skye ba med do //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / 'pho bar gsungs pa'ang mtshan ma med cing skye ba med do //
translated: Abiding and transference are also without characteristics and unborn.

original: gal te 'dus ma byas kyi chos la mtshan nyid gsum du yod par nges na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di dag ni skye ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: gal te 'dus ma byas kyi chos la mtshan nyid gsum du yod par nges na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di dag ni skye ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: If it is certain that unconditioned phenomena have three characteristics, then the Bhagavān should have clearly stated, ‘These are the characteristics of arising,

original: 'di dag ni 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: These are the characteristics of cessation,

original: 'di dag ni gnas pa dang / 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes gcig tu chad par gsungs pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni gnas pa dang / 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes gcig tu chad par gsungs pa'i rigs na /
translated: And these are the characteristics of abiding and transference.’

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos thams cad mtshan ma med par gsungs @108b so; ;'jig rten 'dzin /🔽ma skyes pa la gal te mtshan ma yod dam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos thams cad mtshan ma med par gsungs @108b so; ;'jig rten 'dzin / ma skyes pa la gal te mtshan ma yod dam /
translated: the Tathāgata has taught that all phenomena are without characteristics.🔽Lokadhara, if something is unborn, can it have characteristics?

original: mi 'gog pa la gal te mtshan ma yod dam /
analyzed: mi 'gog pa la gal te mtshan ma yod dam /
translated: If something is unceasing, can it have characteristics?

original: mi gnas pa dang / mi 'pho ba la gal te mtshan ma yod na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dus ma byas pa'ang nges par mtshan ma yod ces gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa dang / mi 'pho ba la gal te mtshan ma yod na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dus ma byas pa'ang nges par mtshan ma yod ces gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were characteristics in the unconditioned, the unconditioned would be conditioned.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: ci ste 'dus ma byas pa la mtshan ma yod na de ni 'dus ma byas pa ma yin no; ;mtshan ma can du bshad pa dang / bus pa so so'i skye bo dag chos la grangs su gcod pa dag ni 'dus byas la mtshan nyid gsum du gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste 'dus ma byas pa la mtshan ma yod na de ni 'dus ma byas pa ma yin no; ;mtshan ma can du bshad pa dang / bus pa so so'i skye bo dag chos la grangs su gcod pa dag ni 'dus byas la mtshan nyid gsum du gsungs te /
translated: if the unconditioned had characteristics, it would not be unconditioned. The characteristics of the conditioned are explained as follows: childish ordinary beings, who count things as dharmas, say that the conditioned has three characteristics:

original: skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas shing 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas shing 'pho ba'o //
translated: arising, ceasing, and abiding and changing.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid gsum ni ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gog pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'pho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid gsum ni ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gog pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'pho ba med pa'o //
translated: The three characteristics of the unconditioned are non-arising, non-ceasing, and neither abiding nor changing.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: skyes bu la las 'dus byas dang; 'dus ma byas pa'i chos chud cing rtogs na skyes bu de la ni skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas shing 'pho ba med de /
analyzed: skyes bu la las 'dus byas dang; 'dus ma byas pa'i chos chud cing rtogs na skyes bu de la ni skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas shing 'pho ba med de /
translated: If a person understands and realizes conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, that person will not fall into the categories of arising, cessation, abiding, or transformation.

original: de bas na 'dus ma byas thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dus ma byas thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the attainment of the unconditioned.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin skye ba dang / 'gog pa ni kun 'byung 'byung ba'i don shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin skye ba dang / 'gog pa ni kun 'byung 'byung ba'i don shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: Lokadhara, arising and cessation are the understanding and seeing of the meaning of the arising of origination.

original: chos la kun 'byung med na 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: chos la kun 'byung med na 'byung ba med do //
translated: If there is no origination of phenomena, there is no arising.

original: kun 'byung ma skyes na phyir ldog pa med de /
analyzed: kun 'byung ma skyes na phyir ldog pa med de /
translated: If origination does not arise, there is no reversal.

original: gnas shing 'pho ba'ang med do //
analyzed: gnas shing 'pho ba'ang med do //
translated: There is also no abiding or transformation.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi de kho na nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽gang gis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba @109a *//
analyzed: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi de kho na nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing shes pa zhes bya'o // gang gis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba @109a *//
translated: this is called the correct seeing and understanding of the suchness of conditioned phenomena.

original: bzhin du shes shing mthong ba skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas shing 'pho ba'i grangs su mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: bzhin du shes shing mthong ba skye ba dang / 'gog pa dang / gnas shing 'pho ba'i grangs su mi ltung ngo //
translated: Those who correctly see and understand in this way will not fall into the categories of arising, cessation, abiding, or transformation.

original: byang chub sems dpas de ltar 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la 'di snyam du 'dus byas kyi chos dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos dang lhan cig par mi lta /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de ltar 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la 'di snyam du 'dus byas kyi chos dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos dang lhan cig par mi lta /
translated: The bodhisattva, in this way, does not see the conditioned and the unconditioned as a pair of things,

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i chos kyang 'dus byas kyi chos dang lhan cig par mi lta'o snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i chos kyang 'dus byas kyi chos dang lhan cig par mi lta'o snyam du bsams nas /
translated: nor does he see the unconditioned as a pair with the conditioned.🔽He thinks, “The reality-characteristic of conditioned things is the unconditioned.” He does not conceptualize.

original: yang 'di snyam du 'dus byas kyi chos kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus ma byas pa nyid do snyam sems shing rnam par mi rtog go ;'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos su rnam par mi rtog pas de nyid 'dus ma byas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du 'dus byas kyi chos kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus ma byas pa nyid do snyam sems shing rnam par mi rtog go ;'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos su rnam par mi rtog pas de nyid 'dus ma byas pa'i chos so //
translated: Since he does not conceptualize conditioned and unconditioned things, that itself is the unconditioned.

original: gal te 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnam par rtog na des 'dus ma byas pa chud cing rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnam par rtog na des 'dus ma byas pa chud cing rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he conceptualizes the conditioned and the unconditioned, he will not penetrate and realize the unconditioned.

original: gang gis rnam par rtog pa thams cad yongs su bcad na 'dus ma byas pa'i de kho na nyid du chud cing rtogs pa zhes bya'o; ;dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa /
analyzed: gang gis rnam par rtog pa thams cad yongs su bcad na 'dus ma byas pa'i de kho na nyid du chud cing rtogs pa zhes bya'o; ;dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa /
translated: If one can cut off all conceptualization, one will be said to have entered and realized the suchness of the unconditioned.🔽The realization of the characteristics of objectification,

original: dmigs pa kun bcad pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa kun bcad pa /
translated: the cutting off of all objectification,

original: grangs sam / grangs pa ma yin par mi rtogs so //
analyzed: grangs sam / grangs pa ma yin par mi rtogs so //
translated: is not realized as a number or as not a number.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: these are called the bodhisattva mahasattva’s application to conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de'ang 'dus byas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: de'ang 'dus byas kyi chos sam /
translated: Moreover, because conditioned phenomena

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i chos su mi dmigs @109b pas ni mi chags pa dang / mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i chos su mi dmigs @109b pas ni mi chags pa dang / mi 'dzin to //
translated: and unconditioned phenomena are not objectified, one is neither attached nor grasping.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bcu'o ////
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bcu'o ////
translated: This was the tenth chapter, on “Conditioned and Unconditioned.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar phung po lnga la shin tu mkhas pa dang / khams bco brgyad la shin tu mkhas pa dang / skye mched bcu gnyis la shin tu mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bcu gnyis la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar phung po lnga la shin tu mkhas pa dang / khams bco brgyad la shin tu mkhas pa dang / skye mched bcu gnyis la shin tu mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bcu gnyis la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
translated: very skilled in the eighteen elements, very skilled in the twelve sense sources, very skilled in the twelve links of dependent origination,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la shin tu mkhas pa dang / dbang po lnga la shin tu mkhas pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la shin tu mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la shin tu mkhas pa dang / dbang po lnga la shin tu mkhas pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la shin tu mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
translated: very skilled in the four establishments of mindfulness, very skilled in the five faculties, very skilled in the eightfold noble path, very skilled in mundane and supramundane phenomena,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la shin tu mkhas pas chos thams cad kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid kyang shin tu mkhas la /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la shin tu mkhas pas chos thams cad kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid kyang shin tu mkhas la /
translated: and very skilled in conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, they are very skilled in the defining characteristics of the reality of all phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa la'ang shin tu mkhas shing dran pa'i mthu rnyed pa dang / chos thams cad kyi tshig rnam par 'byed pa'i blo dang ldan pa dang / lus 'di brjes ma thag tu dran pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ldan zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa la'ang shin tu mkhas shing dran pa'i mthu rnyed pa dang / chos thams cad kyi tshig rnam par 'byed pa'i blo dang ldan pa dang / lus 'di brjes ma thag tu dran pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ldan zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also be very skilled in discerning the characteristics of phenomena and will attain the power of mindfulness. They will possess the intelligence to discern the words of all teachings, and they will be endowed with uninterrupted mindfulness as soon as they leave this body, until they attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: sngon bskal pa tshad med grangs med pa 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: sngon bskal pa tshad med grangs med pa 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: in the past, countless, limitless, incalculable eons ago,

original: dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po zhes bya ba /
translated: there was a king of mountains called Mount Meru of Jambu River Gold.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa @110a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa @110a *//
translated: There was a thus-gone one,

original: dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa /
translated: a worthy one,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: a perfect buddha with knowledge and virtue,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a blissful one,

original: 'jig rten rig pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: an unsurpassed being,

original: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: a charioteer to be tamed,

original: lha dang / mi'i ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang / mi'i ston pa /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du mngon par byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du mngon par byung ngo //
translated: The Buddha Bhagavān appeared in the world.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: bcom ldan 'das dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa lnga snyed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa lnga snyed do //
translated: the lifespan of the Bhagavān Sumeru King of Mountains of the Jambū River Gold was five eons.

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi 'khor yang tshad med do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi 'khor yang tshad med do //
translated: His assembly of śrāvakas was also immeasurable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yongs su dag la rab tu bde ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yongs su dag la rab tu bde ba dang ldan no //
translated: That buddha realm was completely pure and endowed with great happiness.

original: de na gnas pa'i sems can dag kyang rab tu bde zhing skyid la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi shas srab pa /
analyzed: de na gnas pa'i sems can dag kyang rab tu bde zhing skyid la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi shas srab pa /
translated: The beings who lived there were extremely happy and prosperous, with little desire, anger, or ignorance.

original: gdul sla ba /🔽bcos sla ba /
analyzed: gdul sla ba / bcos sla ba /
translated: They were easy to guide,🔽easy to transform,

original: rnam par dag par sla ba sha stag go /
analyzed: rnam par dag par sla ba sha stag go /
translated: and easy to purify.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: bcom ldan 'das dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po'ang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams la sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya ba'i mdo ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po'ang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams la sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya ba'i mdo ston to //
translated: Bhagavān, Sumeru, the king of mountains made of the gold of the Jambū River, also taught the bodhisattva assembly the sūtra called “The Bodhisattva Piṭaka That Cuts Through the Doubts of All Sentient Beings.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: de'i tshe na 'khor de na byang chub sems dpa' rin chen 'od ces bya ba zhig phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe na 'khor de na byang chub sems dpa' rin chen 'od ces bya ba zhig phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
translated: at that time in the assembly there was a bodhisattva called Ratnaprabha who had questions about the aggregates, elements, sense sources, dependent origination, four establishments of mindfulness, five faculties,

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang / 'jig @110b rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la sbyor ba bshad pa thos nas de'i tshe shin tu brtson 'grus brtsams te tshe lo khri phrag nyi shu'i bar du'ang nam du'ang ngan sems ma bskyed de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang / 'jig @110b rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la sbyor ba bshad pa thos nas de'i tshe shin tu brtson 'grus brtsams te tshe lo khri phrag nyi shu'i bar du'ang nam du'ang ngan sems ma bskyed de /
translated: Having heard this explanation of the application to the eightfold noble path, mundane and supramundane dharmas, conditioned and unconditioned dharmas, at that time he exerted himself with great diligence and for twenty thousand years never gave rise to any evil thoughts.

original: 'dod chags kyi sems dang / zhe sdang gi sems dang / gti mug gi sems dang / khe dang / grags pa dang / zas dang / skom dang gos dang / lhung bzed la bsam pa'i sems ma skyes kyi chos 'di sbyor ba la 'jug pa'i phyir brtson 'grus chen po bskyed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi sems dang / zhe sdang gi sems dang / gti mug gi sems dang / khe dang / grags pa dang / zas dang / skom dang gos dang / lhung bzed la bsam pa'i sems ma skyes kyi chos 'di sbyor ba la 'jug pa'i phyir brtson 'grus chen po bskyed do //
translated: He did not give rise to thoughts of desire, thoughts of anger, thoughts of ignorance, or thoughts of concern for profit, fame, food and drink, clothing, or alms bowl. In order to engage in the application to this dharma, he generated great diligence.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin chen 'od de bcom ldan 'das dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po'i bstan pa la nam 'tsho'i bar du tshangs par spyad pa spyod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin chen 'od de bcom ldan 'das dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po'i bstan pa la nam 'tsho'i bar du tshangs par spyad pa spyod de /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Ratnaprabha practiced pure conduct for as long as he lived in the doctrine of the Blessed One Sumerupradīparāja of Jambūnada Gold.

original: des tshe 'phos nas phyir yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nyid du skyes nas gzhon nu las tshe 'phos nas phyir yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nyid du skyes te tshangs par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: des tshe 'phos nas phyir yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nyid du skyes nas gzhon nu las tshe 'phos nas phyir yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nyid du skyes te tshangs par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: After he passed away, he was reborn again in that very buddha realm and practiced pure conduct as a youth.

original: bskal pa de re re na'ang skye ba lnga brgya len te tha mar bcom ldan 'das dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po yongs su mya ngan las 'das su nye ba na bskal pa lnga po'i tha mar shin tu mang du thos pa dang
analyzed: bskal pa de re re na'ang skye ba lnga brgya len te tha mar bcom ldan 'das dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po yongs su mya ngan las 'das su nye ba na bskal pa lnga po'i tha mar shin tu mang du thos pa dang
translated: In each of those eons, he took five hundred rebirths. In the end, when the Blessed One Sumerupradīparāja of Jambūnada Gold was about to pass into parinirvāṇa, in the final five eons, he became one of great learning,

original: / 'di lta bu'i yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos la sbyor ba'ang thob cing sangs rgyas de las chos thos pa dag thams cad yongs su dran par gyur te /
analyzed: / 'di lta bu'i yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos la sbyor ba'ang thob cing sangs rgyas de las chos thos pa dag thams cad yongs su dran par gyur te /
translated: He attained the application to the Dharma of such true characteristics, and he remembered all the Dharmas he had heard from that Buddha.

original: de ltar dran pa'i mthu dang ldan pas @111a *//
analyzed: de ltar dran pa'i mthu dang ldan pas @111a *//
translated: Thus, endowed with the power of memory,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das /
translated: he addressed the Bhagavān, saying, Bhagavān,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag bdag gis rgyas par bstan par 'tshal na gnang bar mdzad du gsol lo //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag bdag gis rgyas par bstan par 'tshal na gnang bar mdzad du gsol lo //
translated: I wish to extensively explain these Dharma discourses. Please grant me permission.

original: tshe de nyid du sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu btsud par gyur to //
analyzed: tshe de nyid du sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu btsud par gyur to //
translated: In that very life, he guided immeasurable and innumerable sentient beings to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,🔽 Bhagavān, I wish to extensively explain these Dharma discourses. Please grant me permission.

original: dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rin chen 'od kyis chos bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su bzung nas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu dam pa'i
analyzed: dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi ri rab ri'i rgyal po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rin chen 'od kyis chos bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su bzung nas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu dam pa'i
translated: When the king of mountains, Mount Meru of the gold of the Jambū River, was passing into parinirvāṇa, the bodhisattva Ratnaprabha, in order to protect the Dharma, took it into his care and, after the Blessed One had passed into parinirvāṇa, he made a great offering to the relics.🔽

original: chos bskal pa gcig gi bar du gnas par gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bskal pa gcig gi bar du gnas par gyur ro //
translated: When the king of mountains, Mount Sumeru of Jambū River gold, was about to enter parinirvāṇa, the bodhisattva Ratnaprabha, in order to protect the Dharma, took care of it and after the Bhagavān entered parinirvāṇa, the true Dharma remained for one eon.

original: bskal pa gcig la skye ba lnga brgya'i bar du rtag tu mi'i nang du skye zhing rab tu byung nas chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa nyid bskyed cing 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig la skye ba lnga brgya'i bar du rtag tu mi'i nang du skye zhing rab tu byung nas chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa nyid bskyed cing 'phel bar byed do //
translated: For one eon, for five hundred lifetimes, he was always born among humans, went forth, and caused the truth of all dharmas to increase and flourish.

original: gzhan yang / sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa'i sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i don byas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa'i sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i don byas so //
translated: Moreover, he benefited and brought happiness to immeasurable, limitless sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rin chen 'od de bzhin du mthar gyis sangs rgyas khri phrag du ma dang phrad nas tha ma sangs rgyas tshad med 'od kyis lung bstan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rin chen 'od de bzhin du mthar gyis sangs rgyas khri phrag du ma dang phrad nas tha ma sangs rgyas tshad med 'od kyis lung bstan pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Ratnaprabha in the same way gradually met with many thousands of buddhas, and finally was prophesied by the Buddha Amitaprabha.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa 'das nas gdod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa 'das nas gdod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: After countless eons had passed, he was prophesied to attain unsurpassed perfect complete awakening.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa de @111b nyid kyi tshe na'ang sangs rgyas khri phrag khrag khrig brgya stong dang phrad de /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa de @111b nyid kyi tshe na'ang sangs rgyas khri phrag khrag khrig brgya stong dang phrad de /
translated: During that very same countless eon he met with many quintillions of buddhas.

original: de nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: de nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: Then he fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect complete buddhahood.

original: don thams cad gdon mi za ba'i rgyan zhes bya ba /
analyzed: don thams cad gdon mi za ba'i rgyan zhes bya ba /
translated: The one called Sarvārthasiddha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: the tathāgata,

original: dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa /
translated: the arhat,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: the perfectly complete buddha,

original: mkhyen pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: the one with knowledge and feet,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the one who has gone to bliss,

original: 'jig rten rig pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa /
translated: the one who knows the world,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: the unsurpassed one,🔽the charioteer of humans to be tamed,🔽the teacher of gods and humans,🔽the buddha, the bhagavān,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /🔽lha dang / mi'i ston pa /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba / lha dang / mi'i ston pa /
translated: He is the one who tames beings and leads them.🔽He is the teacher of gods and humans.🔽

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He will be called the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the One of Perfect Understanding and Action, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the World, the Unsurpassed One, the Tamer of Humans, the Teacher of Devas and Humans, the Buddha, the Bhagavat.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor tshad med dpag tu med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor tshad med dpag tu med do //
translated: He will have an immeasurable and limitless retinue of bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi 'khor yang grangs med de /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi 'khor yang grangs med de /
translated: His retinue of śrāvakas will also be innumerable.

original: sangs rgyas de'i tshe'i tshad kyang bskal pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de'i tshe'i tshad kyang bskal pa gnyis te /
translated: The lifespan of that buddha will be two eons.

original: sangs rgyas de'i zhing rab tu bde ba dang ldan zhing rgyan dam pas shin tu brgyan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de'i zhing rab tu bde ba dang ldan zhing rgyan dam pas shin tu brgyan to //
translated: His buddha realm will be endowed with great happiness and adorned with the finest ornaments.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapālas,

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos de dag gi sbyor ba la shin tu mkhas par 'dod pa dag shin tu brtson 'grus su chos 'di dag la bslab pa dang / 'don pa dang / nan tan bya'o //
