analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos de dag gi sbyor ba la shin tu mkhas par 'dod pa dag shin tu brtson 'grus su chos 'di dag la bslab pa dang / 'don pa dang / nan tan bya'o //
translated: therefore, bodhisattvas who wish to be skilled in the practice of these dharmas should diligently train in, recite, and practice these dharmas.”

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos de dag la sbyor ba thob par 'dod pa dag chos rnam pa bzhi la shin tu brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos de dag la sbyor ba thob par 'dod pa dag chos rnam pa bzhi la shin tu brtson par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to attain application to those dharmas should strive in four dharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu byung ba dang / gcig pu 'dug pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / le lo'i sems yongs su bsal bar @112a *//
analyzed: khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu byung ba dang / gcig pu 'dug pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / le lo'i sems yongs su bsal bar @112a *//
translated: renouncing the household life and going forth from the household, living alone, purifying morality, and dispelling the mind of laziness.

original: bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnam pa de bzhi dang ldan pas mang du thos pa la brtson zhing bzod pa la bde bar gnas pas myur du chos rnam pa bzhi dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnam pa de bzhi dang ldan pas mang du thos pa la brtson zhing bzod pa la bde bar gnas pas myur du chos rnam pa bzhi dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses those four dharmas and strives for much learning, and who abides in patience, will quickly encounter four dharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dzambu'i gling gi dbus su skye ba dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad pa dang / chos kyi rjes su spyod pa dang / sdig pa'i las kyi sgrib pa sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dzambu'i gling gi dbus su skye ba dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad pa dang / chos kyi rjes su spyod pa dang / sdig pa'i las kyi sgrib pa sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: being born in the center of Jambudvīpa, encountering the Buddha, practicing the Dharma, and dispelling the obscurations of bad karma.

original: gzhan yang / 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Furthermore, Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos 'di la shin tu brtson pa dag ni sbyin pa'i stobs rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / bzod pa rnam par dag pa dang / brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos 'di la shin tu brtson pa dag ni sbyin pa'i stobs rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / bzod pa rnam par dag pa dang / brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: if bodhisattva mahāsattvas exert themselves in this teaching, they will attain the power of pure generosity, pure discipline, pure patience, pure diligence,

original: bsam gtan rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi stobs rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi stobs rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: and pure wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos 'di la gnas na de la sbyor ba'i stobs myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos 'di la gnas na de la sbyor ba'i stobs myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If bodhisattva mahāsattvas abide in this teaching, they will swiftly attain the power of application.

original: gzhan yang / 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Furthermore, Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi chos phra mo spyod kyang sems can dag la snying rje chen po'i sems dang ldan no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi chos phra mo spyod kyang sems can dag la snying rje chen po'i sems dang ldan no //
translated: even if bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the subtle qualities of the dhūta ascetic practices, they will have a mind of great compassion for sentient beings.

original: de ltar snying rje chen po'i sems la zhugs pas chos de dag gi sbyor ba la shin tu brtson par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar snying rje chen po'i sems la zhugs pas chos de dag gi sbyor ba la shin tu brtson par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by engaging in the mind of great compassion, they will be extremely diligent in the practice of these teachings.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' @112b sems dpa' chen po chos 'di lta bu dag thob par 'dod pa dag gzungs kyi sgor 'jug pa la shin tu brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' @112b sems dpa' chen po chos 'di lta bu dag thob par 'dod pa dag gzungs kyi sgor 'jug pa la shin tu brtson par bya'o //
translated: furthermore, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to attain such teachings should be diligent in entering the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: de la gzungs kyi sgor 'jug pa la brtson pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzungs kyi sgor 'jug pa la brtson pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by being diligent in entering the dhāraṇī gateway?

original: 'di lta ste; chos thams cad kyi rkyen tshad med pa la rtog pa dang / tshad med pa thams cad kyi rtog pa la sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba tshad med pa la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste; chos thams cad kyi rkyen tshad med pa la rtog pa dang / tshad med pa thams cad kyi rtog pa la sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba tshad med pa la rtog pa'o //
translated: It means contemplating the immeasurable conditions of all phenomena, applying oneself to the contemplation of all that is immeasurable, and contemplating immeasurable applications.

original: de ltar brtson pa'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor sbyor bas chos thams cad kyi sgo tshad med pa'i rkyen la 'jug pa dang / tshad med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa de lta bu'i mthu dang ldan pas chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa nyid la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor sbyor bas chos thams cad kyi sgo tshad med pa'i rkyen la 'jug pa dang / tshad med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa de lta bu'i mthu dang ldan pas chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa nyid la shin tu mkhas pa dang /
translated: With such power of application and engagement, they will become very skilled in the true nature of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa la shin tu mkhas pa dang / dran pa'i mthu dang ldan pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par 'byed pa la shin tu mkhas pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / lus 'phos nas kyang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa la shin tu mkhas pa dang / dran pa'i mthu dang ldan pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par 'byed pa la shin tu mkhas pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / lus 'phos nas kyang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: They will become very skilled in discerning the characteristics of all phenomena, they will possess the power of memory, they will possess the wisdom that is very skilled in discerning all phenomena, and they will possess the memory that is uninterrupted even when their bodies change.

original: tchos la phyir mi ldog pa nas nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tchos la phyir mi ldog pa nas nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain irreversibility from the Dharma and will attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapālas,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gzungs kyi sgor zhugs pas na ci dang / cir ldan pa de'i rgyu dang / rkyen gyis chos thams cad rtogs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gzungs kyi sgor zhugs pas na ci dang / cir ldan pa de'i rgyu dang / rkyen gyis chos thams cad rtogs te /
translated: because the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas have entered the dhāraṇī gateway, they realize all dharmas through their causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen gcig gis rgyu dang / rkyen stong la 'jug cing shes rab kyi rjes su chos thams cad la sbyor ba'ang thob @113a *//
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen gcig gis rgyu dang / rkyen stong la 'jug cing shes rab kyi rjes su chos thams cad la sbyor ba'ang thob @113a *//
translated: With a single cause and condition, they engage with and understand a thousand causes and conditions, and they attain the application of all dharmas in the wake of wisdom.

original: bo // 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: bo // 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar chos la brtson 'grus bskyed pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar chos la brtson 'grus bskyed pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, through their cultivation of diligence in the Dharma in this way, will enter the samādhi of the gateway of a single characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas mtshan nyid tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug go /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas mtshan nyid tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug go /
translated: Having attained the samādhi of the gateway of a single characteristic, they will enter the samādhi of immeasurable characteristics.

original: de ltar zhugs nas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rgyu dang / rkyen dang / thabs kyis chos thams cad kyi sgor 'jug go /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs nas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rgyu dang / rkyen dang / thabs kyis chos thams cad kyi sgor 'jug go /
translated: Having entered in this way, they will enter the gateway of all dharmas through various causes, conditions, and methods.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad kyi sgor zhugs pas chos thams cad la sbyor ba thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad kyi sgor zhugs pas chos thams cad la sbyor ba thob par gyur to //
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas enter the gateway of all dharmas and thus attain application to all dharmas.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab mang du bsgoms pas bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid la shin tu mkhas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la shin tu mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab mang du bsgoms pas bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid la shin tu mkhas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la shin tu mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: furthermore, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, through cultivating prajñā extensively, become very skilled in the characteristics of meditative concentration and become very skilled in signless samādhi.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin de'i shugs kyis dmigs pa tshad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba tshad med pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin de'i shugs kyis dmigs pa tshad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba tshad med pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the power of that samādhi, they become skilled in immeasurable objects and in immeasurable samādhi entrances.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpas 'di la gnas na chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la sbyor ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpas 'di la gnas na chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la sbyor ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If bodhisattvas abide in this way, they will attain application to the true characteristics of all dharmas.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rtag tu 'jig rten la dmigs pa'i thabs la rtog pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos la dmigs pa @113b la rtog pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rtag tu 'jig rten la dmigs pa'i thabs la rtog pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos la dmigs pa @113b la rtog pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: and moreover,

original: chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i thabs rnam par 'jig pa la brtson pa'i nan tan byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i thabs rnam par 'jig pa la brtson pa'i nan tan byed de /
translated: strive in the practice of destroying the means of focusing on all phenomena.

original: de la chags pa'i gnas kyang med do //
analyzed: de la chags pa'i gnas kyang med do //
translated: There is no basis for attachment there.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos de la bsgoms pas chos thams cad kyi yang dag par sbyor ba myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos de la bsgoms pas chos thams cad kyi yang dag par sbyor ba myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva, by cultivating that Dharma in this way, will quickly attain the correct application of all dharmas.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,🔽furthermore,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shin tu brtson 'grus bskyed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shin tu brtson 'grus bskyed de /
translated: the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas generate great diligence,

original: sbyor ba'i stobs bskyed kyang chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid rtog cing 'jig rten gyi bde ba la mi gnas /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i stobs bskyed kyang chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid rtog cing 'jig rten gyi bde ba la mi gnas /
translated: generate the power of application, contemplate the correct characteristics of all dharmas, do not dwell in worldly happiness,

original: 'jig rten gyi chos dang 'dres par mi spyod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos dang 'dres par mi spyod do //
translated: and do not engage in mixing with worldly dharmas.

original: de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pas na myur du chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'gyur zhing chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa la shin tu mkhas pa dang / dran pa'i mthu thob pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i shes rab thob pa dang /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pas na myur du chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'gyur zhing chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa la shin tu mkhas pa dang / dran pa'i mthu thob pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i shes rab thob pa dang /
translated: Endowed with such qualities, they will quickly become skilled in the true characteristics of phenomena, and they will become very skilled in discerning the characteristics of phenomena. They will attain the power of memory, and they will attain the wisdom that is skilled in discerning the categories of all phenomena.

original: lus 'di 'phos nas kyang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dran pa dang ldan zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus 'di 'phos nas kyang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dran pa dang ldan zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even after they have left this body, they will be endowed with uninterrupted mindfulness and will attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos 'di dag gi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pa dag chos 'di ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du yongs su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos 'di dag gi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pa dag chos 'di ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du yongs su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: therefore, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who wish to perfect these phenomena should cultivate these phenomena just as they are taught.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: khyod kyis chos 'di la shin tu brtson @114a *//
analyzed: khyod kyis chos 'di la shin tu brtson @114a *//
translated: you should strive in these phenomena.

original: par bsgoms na ring por mi thogs par chos 'di la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par bsgoms na ring por mi thogs par chos 'di la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cultivates this, one will before long attain unobstructed wisdom in this Dharma.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: sngon 'das pa'i bskal pa tshad med /
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i bskal pa tshad med /
translated: in the past, beyond immeasurable,

original: dpag tu med /
analyzed: dpag tu med /
translated: incalculable,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: inconceivable,

original: grangs med pa 'das pa de'i dus na /
analyzed: grangs med pa 'das pa de'i dus na /
translated: and innumerable eons ago,

original: tshad med yon tan 'od kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba /
analyzed: tshad med yon tan 'od kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba /
translated: there was a buddha named King of Immeasurable Merits Light,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: a tathāgata,

original: dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa /
translated: an arhat,

original: yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: a perfectly enlightened one,

original: mkhyen pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: one with knowledge and conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a blissful one,

original: 'jig rten rig pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: bla na med pa skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: bla na med pa skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: an unsurpassed one, a charioteer to be tamed,

original: lha dang / mi'i ston pa; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du mngon par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lha dang / mi'i ston pa; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du mngon par 'byung ngo //
translated: a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavān who appeared in the world.

original: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal po de'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa gcig go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal po de'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa gcig go /
translated: The lifespan of the Bhagavān King of Immeasurable Merits Light was one eon.

original: sangs rgyas de'i zhing yang rin po che sna bdun gyi dra bas bla bre bres so //🔽rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ta la rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams de yongs su brgyan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de'i zhing yang rin po che sna bdun gyi dra bas bla bre bres so // rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ta la rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams de yongs su brgyan to //
translated: The buddha realm of that buddha was covered with a canopy of nets of the seven precious substances.🔽That world realm was adorned with palm trees of the seven precious substances.

original: shing ta la de dag la'ang rin po che sna bdun gyi dra bas steng bla bre bres te /
analyzed: shing ta la de dag la'ang rin po che sna bdun gyi dra bas steng bla bre bres te /
translated: Those palm trees were also covered with canopies of nets of the seven precious substances.

original: shing de dag re re'i 'og na'ang seng ge'i khri re re ste /
analyzed: shing de dag re re'i 'og na'ang seng ge'i khri re re ste /
translated: Under each of those trees was a lion throne.

original: shing ta la de dag kun las lha'i na bza' rang skyes so //
analyzed: shing ta la de dag kun las lha'i na bza' rang skyes so //
translated: Divine clothing grew on all those palm trees.

original: seng ge'i khri de dag kyang rin po che bee d'urya dang / dzambu'i chu klung gi gser dang / mu tig dmar po las byas pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri de dag kyang rin po che bee d'urya dang / dzambu'i chu klung gi gser dang / mu tig dmar po las byas pa'o //
translated: Those lion thrones were made of beryl, gold from the Jambū River, and red pearls.

original: shing ta la de dag gi phyogs bzhi na bsung gi shing dang / me tog gi @114b shing gis bskor zhing brgyan to //
analyzed: shing ta la de dag gi phyogs bzhi na bsung gi shing dang / me tog gi @114b shing gis bskor zhing brgyan to //
translated: In the four directions of those palm trees were fragrant trees and flower trees that surrounded and adorned them.

original: shing de dag re re'i 'og na'ang rdzing bu re re ste /
analyzed: shing de dag re re'i 'og na'ang rdzing bu re re ste /
translated: Under each of those trees was a pond

original: yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus yongs su gang ngo //
analyzed: yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus yongs su gang ngo //
translated: that was completely filled with water endowed with the eight qualities.

original: rdzing bu de dag kyang shel dang / aasmra garba dang / mu tig dmar po las byas pa /
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag kyang shel dang / aasmra garba dang / mu tig dmar po las byas pa /
translated: These ponds are made of crystal, asmarpada, and red pearls.

original: chu de dag gi steng na padma sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan gyis steng yongs su khebs te /
analyzed: chu de dag gi steng na padma sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan gyis steng yongs su khebs te /
translated: The water in these ponds is covered with blue, red, white, and purple lotuses.

original: rdzing de rnams kyi 'gram yang rin po che sna bdun las byas so //
analyzed: rdzing de rnams kyi 'gram yang rin po che sna bdun las byas so //
translated: The banks of these ponds are made of the seven precious substances.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapālas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni de ltar rin po che mang pos yongs su brgyan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni de ltar rin po che mang pos yongs su brgyan te /
translated: this buddha land is adorned with many precious substances.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de'i phyogs bzhi na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de'i phyogs bzhi na /
translated: In the four directions of this world system

original: gzhan yang / sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha rdzas kyi shing pa ri dz'a ta ka dang / ko bi d'a ra stong phrag du mas 'jig rten gyi khams de'i mtha' yongs su bskor to //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha rdzas kyi shing pa ri dz'a ta ka dang / ko bi d'a ra stong phrag du mas 'jig rten gyi khams de'i mtha' yongs su bskor to //
translated: there are also many thousands of divine trees of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, such as the parijātaka and the kovidāra, that surround the world system.

original: rin po che'i shing de dag gi 'od zer gyis nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma'i 'od thams cad mi snang bar zil gyis mnan to //
analyzed: rin po che'i shing de dag gi 'od zer gyis nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma'i 'od thams cad mi snang bar zil gyis mnan to //
translated: The light of these precious trees outshines the light of the sun, moon, and all the stars.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapālas,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de'i shing ta la dang / rin po che'i dra bar kun nas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgra dbyangs dam pa ji ltar lha rnams kyi glu dang / bstod pa'i dbyangs lta bu rang 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de'i shing ta la dang / rin po che'i dra bar kun nas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgra dbyangs dam pa ji ltar lha rnams kyi glu dang / bstod pa'i dbyangs lta bu rang 'byung ste /
translated: In that world system, the palm trees and jeweled nets spontaneously emit various sublime sounds like the songs and praises of the gods.

original: rtag tu 'di lta bu'i dbyangs shin tu snyan pa grag go /
analyzed: rtag tu 'di lta bu'i dbyangs shin tu snyan pa grag go /
translated: Such beautiful sounds are always heard.

original: ngan song gsum med de /
analyzed: ngan song gsum med de /
translated: There are no three evil destinies.

original: ngan song gsum gyi ming tsam yang mi grag go /
analyzed: ngan song gsum gyi ming tsam yang mi grag go /
translated: Even the names of the three evil destinies are not heard.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapala,

original: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal pos sems can rnams la chos 'di dag rgyas par @115a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal pos sems can rnams la chos 'di dag rgyas par @115a *//
translated: the Bhagavat King of Immeasurable Light extensively taught these dharmas to sentient beings.

original: gsungs so // 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsungs so // 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod cing sems can thams cad shin tu dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod cing sems can thams cad shin tu dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: He taught the perfection of wisdom and the Bodhisattva canon called “Cutting Through the Doubts of All Sentient Beings and Bringing Great Joy to All Sentient Beings.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapala,

original: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal po chos ston pa'i tshe nyin zhag gcig la'ang sems can tshad med pa khri phrag brgya stong snyed bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal po chos ston pa'i tshe nyin zhag gcig la'ang sems can tshad med pa khri phrag brgya stong snyed bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: When the Bhagavat King of Immeasurable Radiance and Virtue taught the Dharma, in a single day he caused immeasurable hundreds of thousands of sentient beings to generate the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sems bskyed pa de dag thams cad kyang byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de dag thams cad kyang byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of those who generated the mind of awakening would complete the accumulations for awakening.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal pos de ltar sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal pos de ltar sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so //
translated: the Bhagavat King of Immeasurable Radiance and Virtue thus ripened immeasurable, innumerable sentient beings for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang shin tu mang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang shin tu mang ngo //
translated: In that buddha realm there were also many bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: bcom ldan 'das de yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos bskal pa phyed kyi bar du gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos bskal pa phyed kyi bar du gnas par gyur to //
translated: After the parinirvāṇa of that Bhagavān, the true Dharma remained for half a eon.

original: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal po yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig tu nye ba na 'og ma'i phyogs sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu 'das pa'i pha rol nas byang chub sems dpa' tshad med blo gros @115b zhes
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal po yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig tu nye ba na 'og ma'i phyogs sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu 'das pa'i pha rol nas byang chub sems dpa' tshad med blo gros @115b zhes
translated: After the parinirvāṇa of Bhagavān Amitābha­guṇa­rāja, when the true Dharma was about to perish, a bodhisattva named Amitamati

original: bya ba zhig de nas tshe 'phos te zhing 'dir skyes nas lo bcu drug lon pa dang rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: bya ba zhig de nas tshe 'phos te zhing 'dir skyes nas lo bcu drug lon pa dang rab tu byung ste /
translated: passed away from that realm and was reborn in this buddha field. At the age of sixteen, he went forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal po'i chos rnam par 'jig tu nye ba na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sbyor ba'i mdo thos par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad med 'od kyi yon tan rgyal po'i chos rnam par 'jig tu nye ba na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sbyor ba'i mdo thos par gyur to //
translated: When the true Dharma of Bhagavān Amitābha­guṇa­rāja was about to perish, the bodhisattva mahāsattva heard the sūtra that connects to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases for the liberation of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshad med blo gros kyis mdo sde 'di thos nas brtson 'grus chen po skyed de chos 'di dag gi mthar yang phyin cing sbyor ba'i mthu shin tu zab mo dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshad med blo gros kyis mdo sde 'di thos nas brtson 'grus chen po skyed de chos 'di dag gi mthar yang phyin cing sbyor ba'i mthu shin tu zab mo dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: The bodhisattva Immeasurable Wisdom, having heard this sutra, generated great diligence and attained the culmination of these dharmas, becoming endowed with the power of profound practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyi rgyu dang / rkyen gyis de nas tshe 'phos nas sangs rgyas khri phrag nyi shu dang phrad de chos 'di dag dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyi rgyu dang / rkyen gyis de nas tshe 'phos nas sangs rgyas khri phrag nyi shu dang phrad de chos 'di dag dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: By the causes and conditions of that root of virtue, that bodhisattva, after passing away from that life, encountered two hundred thousand buddhas and became endowed with these dharmas.

original: sngon gyis gnas kyang rtag tu dran pas gzhon nu nas rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: sngon gyis gnas kyang rtag tu dran pas gzhon nu nas rab tu byung ste /
translated: Always remembering his past lives, he went forth as a youth.

original: tshangs par spyad par spyod cing rtag tu dran pa'i mthu dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyad par spyod cing rtag tu dran pa'i mthu dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: Practicing pure conduct, he was always endowed with the power of mindfulness.

original: gang nas gang du skyes pa'i gnas kun tu chos 'di lta bu dang ma bral te skye ba'i gnas thams cad du dran pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: gang nas gang du skyes pa'i gnas kun tu chos 'di lta bu dang ma bral te skye ba'i gnas thams cad du dran pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ldan te /
translated: In all the places where he was born, he was never separated from such dharmas, and in all his lives he was endowed with uninterrupted mindfulness.

original: de nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas mtshan yang tshad med 'od kyi bkod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas mtshan yang tshad med 'od kyi bkod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, after fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he will be called King of Infinite Light.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @116a *//
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @116a *//
translated: therefore, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who wish to quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: 'dod pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa dag nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lnga brgya tha ma la shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom zhing yi dam chen po bskyed nas mos pa chen po dang / brtson 'grus chen po dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa dag nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lnga brgya tha ma la shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom zhing yi dam chen po bskyed nas mos pa chen po dang / brtson 'grus chen po dang /
translated: and who wish to perfect omniscient wisdom, should, after my parinirvāṇa, in the final five hundred years, exert great diligence, generate great resolve, and arouse great interest, great diligence,

original: bag byed pa chen po bskyed de /
analyzed: bag byed pa chen po bskyed de /
translated: and great effort.

original: phyi ma'i dus ngan par gyur pa de'i tshe mdo sde 'di dag la sogs pa shin tu bsrung zhing bskyab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus ngan par gyur pa de'i tshe mdo sde 'di dag la sogs pa shin tu bsrung zhing bskyab par bya'o //
translated: In the future, during the degenerate age, you should protect and guard these sūtras.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong la sogs pa 'dug pa stan las langs nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de ba de logs su thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong la sogs pa 'dug pa stan las langs nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de ba de logs su thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: At that time, the bodhisattvas Bhadrapāla and so forth rose from their seats, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdag cag kyang phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha ma la dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig tu nye ba na bdag cag gis mdo sde 'di dag la sogs pa bsrung zhing bskyab pa'i phyir brtson 'grus shin tu bskyed de klog pa dang /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha ma la dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig tu nye ba na bdag cag gis mdo sde 'di dag la sogs pa bsrung zhing bskyab pa'i phyir brtson 'grus shin tu bskyed de klog pa dang /
translated: we too will generate great diligence in order to protect and guard these sūtras and so forth during the final five hundred years of the future when the sublime Dharma is about to perish. We will read them,

original: 'don pa dang / nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher yang dag par bstan pa 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'don pa dang / nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher yang dag par bstan pa 'tshal lo //
translated: recite them, listen to them, uphold them, and teach them extensively to others.”

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' stong du ma snyed 'dug pa las langs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar nas mig mi 'dzum par blta zhing 'di skad du yi dam du bcas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' stong du ma snyed 'dug pa las langs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar nas mig mi 'dzum par blta zhing 'di skad du yi dam du bcas so //
translated: Furthermore, having risen from the seats of thousands of bodhisattvas, they joined their palms together in the direction of the Bhagavān, gazed upon him with unblinking eyes, and made this vow:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: bdag cag gis phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha @116b ma la 'di lta bu shin tu zab mo chags pa med pa'i mdo sde sangs rgyas thams cad kyis snang ba /
analyzed: bdag cag gis phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha @116b ma la 'di lta bu shin tu zab mo chags pa med pa'i mdo sde sangs rgyas thams cad kyis snang ba /
translated: in the future, during the final five hundred years, we will protect and uphold this sūtra, which is so profound, free from attachment, and illuminated by all the buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i yon tan skye bar 'gyur ba /🔽byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba bdag cag gis shin tu bsrung zhing 'dzin par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i yon tan skye bar 'gyur ba /🔽byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba bdag cag gis shin tu bsrung zhing 'dzin par 'tshal lo //
translated: which gives rise to the virtuous qualities of all bodhisattvas,🔽and which brings about the completion of the accumulation of merit for all bodhisattvas.”

original: chos 'di thos nas rnam par dag cing sems rab tu dag par gyur te tshol ba dang / 'chang ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'don pa dang / klog pa la shin tu brtson par bgyi'o //
analyzed: chos 'di thos nas rnam par dag cing sems rab tu dag par gyur te tshol ba dang / 'chang ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'don pa dang / klog pa la shin tu brtson par bgyi'o //
translated: Having heard this Dharma, they will become pure and their minds will become pure. They will strive to seek, uphold, memorize, recite, and read it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das bzhad mo 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang / de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer gyis kun tu snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das bzhad mo 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang / de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer gyis kun tu snang bar gyur te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān smiled, and at that time the trichiliocosm was illuminated with light.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yos so //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yos so //
translated: The trichiliocosm shook in six ways.

original: de'i tshe na dga' bo 'dug pa las langs nas bla gos phyogs gcig tu byas te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha ngas la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de'i logs su thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na dga' bo 'dug pa las langs nas bla gos phyogs gcig tu byas te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha ngas la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de'i logs su thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: At that time Nanda rose from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, joined his palms towards the Bhagavān, and said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: ci'i rgyu / ci'i rkyen gyis na deng 'dir bzhad mo 'dzum pa mdzad de sa chen po yang rab tu g-yos par gyur /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu / ci'i rkyen gyis na deng 'dir bzhad mo 'dzum pa mdzad de sa chen po yang rab tu g-yos par gyur /
translated: What is the cause? What is the condition that you are now smiling and laughing, and that the great earth is trembling?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di rnams yi dam chen po bcas nas phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su shin tu zab @117a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di rnams yi dam chen po bcas nas phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su shin tu zab @117a *//
translated: The Buddha said:

original: mo'i mdo sde chags pa med pa'i chos 'di lta bu shin tu bsrung zhing 'dzin par yi dam bcas pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: mo'i mdo sde chags pa med pa'i chos 'di lta bu shin tu bsrung zhing 'dzin par yi dam bcas pa mthong ngam /
translated: “Do you see these bodhisattva-mahāsattvas making great vows, vowing in the future to protect and uphold this kind of profound, unattached Dharma of the sūtras?

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag ni skye ba 'di gcig bur yi dam 'di lta bur bcas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag ni skye ba 'di gcig bur yi dam 'di lta bur bcas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Nanda, these bodhisattvas are not making such vows in this one lifetime alone.

original: dga' bo / ngas mngon par dran te byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med dpag tu med pa rnams su'ang yi dam 'di lta bu bcas te dus gsum du sangs rgyas de dag gi chos kyang shin tu bsrungs te sems can tshad med dpag tu
analyzed: dga' bo / ngas mngon par dran te byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med dpag tu med pa rnams su'ang yi dam 'di lta bu bcas te dus gsum du sangs rgyas de dag gi chos kyang shin tu bsrungs te sems can tshad med dpag tu
translated: Ananda, I remember that these Bodhisattvas have made this vow in immeasurable and limitless Buddha-lands. They have guarded the Dharma of those Buddhas of the three periods of time and have caused immeasurable and limitless sentient beings to abide in the Buddha’s Dharma.

original: med pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas so //
analyzed: med pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas so //
translated: Ananda, I recall that these Bodhisattvas have made this vow in immeasurable and limitless Buddha-lands, and for three periods of time have well protected the Dharma of those Buddhas, benefiting and bringing happiness to immeasurable and limitless sentient beings.

original: de'ang dus gsum du nga'i chos kyang skyob cing bsrung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'ang dus gsum du nga'i chos kyang skyob cing bsrung bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will also protect and guard my Dharma for three periods of time.

original: da ltar gyi dus dang / nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og chos rnam par 'jig tu nye ba na sems can tshad med pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus dang / nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og chos rnam par 'jig tu nye ba na sems can tshad med pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the present, and after my nirvana, when the Dharma is about to perish, they will benefit and bring happiness to immeasurable sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: World-Holder!

original: bzang skyong la sogs pa dus gsum du nga'i chos bsrung bar ma zad kyi bskal pa bzang po'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyang dus gsum du bsrung zhing 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzang skyong la sogs pa dus gsum du nga'i chos bsrung bar ma zad kyi bskal pa bzang po'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyang dus gsum du bsrung zhing 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Bhadrapāla and the others will not only protect my Dharma in the three times, but they will also protect and uphold the Dharma of all the Buddhas of the Fortunate Eon.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di lta bu dag kyang bsrung zhing 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di lta bu dag kyang bsrung zhing 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, they will also protect and uphold the Buddhadharma of the future.

original: dga' bo / ngas skyes bu de dag gi yon tan tshad med pa lhun gyis grub pa dang / sems can tshad med pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa bshad @117b na brjod kyis mi rdzogs so //
analyzed: dga' bo / ngas skyes bu de dag gi yon tan tshad med pa lhun gyis grub pa dang / sems can tshad med pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa bshad @117b na brjod kyis mi rdzogs so //
translated: Nanda, I cannot fully describe the immeasurable spontaneous qualities of those beings and the benefit and happiness they bring to immeasurable sentient beings.

original: dga' bo / ngas skyes bu de dag gi yon tan kun bshad na skye bo dag yid ches par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo / ngas skyes bu de dag gi yon tan kun bshad na skye bo dag yid ches par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nanda, if I were to explain all the qualities of those beings, people would not believe it.

original: gal te skye bo dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung la yid ches par ma gyur na yun ring por bde ba stor nas sdug bsngal mang po myong zhing ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi smon lam la gnas pa ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: gal te skye bo dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung la yid ches par ma gyur na yun ring por bde ba stor nas sdug bsngal mang po myong zhing ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur ro // dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi smon lam la gnas pa ni ma gtogs te /
translated: If people do not believe in the Buddha’s teaching, they will lose happiness for a long time and experience much suffering, falling into the evil destinies.

original: sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa phyogs gcig cig bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa phyogs gcig cig bshad par bya'o //
translated: “ Nanda, I will explain only a part of the benefits that bodhisattvas who keep their previous aspirations achieve for the sake of sentient beings and the happiness they bring about.

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de'i sems can yongs su gang ba thams cad dmyal ba chen por lhung la /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de'i sems can yongs su gang ba thams cad dmyal ba chen por lhung la /
translated: Suppose that all the sentient beings who fill this great trichiliocosm were to fall into the great hells.

original: de la skyes bu gcig gis 'di skad du de dag la khyed rnams ma 'jigs shig /
analyzed: de la skyes bu gcig gis 'di skad du de dag la khyed rnams ma 'jigs shig /
translated: Then a person might say to them, ‘Do not be afraid!

original: khyed rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal kun so so nas nga blang ngo zhes smras te /
analyzed: khyed rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal kun so so nas nga blang ngo zhes smras te /
translated: I will take on all the sufferings of the great hells that you are experiencing.’

original: sems can de dag ni dmyal ba chen po las thar pa de dag gi dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal kun so sor re re nas lo brgya stong gi bar du lus kyis blangs na /
analyzed: sems can de dag ni dmyal ba chen po las thar pa de dag gi dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal kun so sor re re nas lo brgya stong gi bar du lus kyis blangs na /
translated: If those beings were to be freed from the great hells, and if they were to take on the suffering of the hells one by one for a hundred thousand years,

original: dga' bo / de khyod kyis yid la ji snyam /
analyzed: dga' bo / de khyod kyis yid la ji snyam /
translated: Nanda, what do you think?

original: skyes bu des shin tu bde ba chen po dang / phan pa chen po byas pa yin nam /
analyzed: skyes bu des shin tu bde ba chen po dang / phan pa chen po byas pa yin nam /
translated: Would that person have done a great service and brought them great happiness?”

original: dga' bos gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: dga' bos gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Nanda replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni shin tu phan pa chen po dang / bde ba chen po bgyis pa lags so //
analyzed: de ni shin tu phan pa chen po dang / bde ba chen po bgyis pa lags so //
translated: he would have done a great service and brought them great happiness.”

original: dga' bo / skyes bu des sems can de dag dmyal ba las phyung nas kyang bdag gi @118a *//
analyzed: dga' bo / skyes bu des sems can de dag dmyal ba las phyung nas kyang bdag gi @118a *//
translated: “Nanda, if that person were to free those beings from the hells and,

original: mthu rtsal gyis thams cad 'jig rten gyi bde ba mchog dam pa dang ldan pa byas na /
analyzed: mthu rtsal gyis thams cad 'jig rten gyi bde ba mchog dam pa dang ldan pa byas na /
translated: through his own power, bring them all to the highest worldly happiness,

original: dga' bo / skyes bu des shin tu drin gyis phan btags shing sems can dag la shin tu bde ba byin nam /
analyzed: dga' bo / skyes bu des shin tu drin gyis phan btags shing sems can dag la shin tu bde ba byin nam /
translated: Nanda, would that person have brought them great kindness and given them great happiness?”

original: dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: Nanda replied,🔽“Blessed One,

original: skyes bu des phan par bgyis pa ni tshig gis brjod par sla ba ma lags so //
analyzed: skyes bu des phan par bgyis pa ni tshig gis brjod par sla ba ma lags so //
translated: The benefits that this person has brought about are not easy to describe in words.

original: dga' bo / ngas der bden par gsungs te; byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong la sogs pas sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa'i gan na skyes bu des phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa ni rtsis sam /
analyzed: dga' bo / ngas der bden par gsungs te; byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong la sogs pas sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa'i gan na skyes bu des phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa ni rtsis sam /
translated: Nanda, I speak the truth when I say that compared to the benefits and happiness that the bodhisattvas Bhadrapāla and so on have brought about for sentient beings, the benefits and happiness that this person has brought about do not amount even to a fraction,

original: bgrang ba'am / dpe'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bgrang ba'am / dpe'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: do not even count, and are not even worth an analogy.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dga' bo / skyes bu des bde ba'i yo byad kyis phan pa byas pa ni thams cad kyang 'dus byas kyi chos dang 'brel pa yin pas skyo zhing chog shes pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: dga' bo / skyes bu des bde ba'i yo byad kyis phan pa byas pa ni thams cad kyang 'dus byas kyi chos dang 'brel pa yin pas skyo zhing chog shes pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: Nanda, the benefits that this person has brought about through providing for their happiness are all related to conditioned phenomena, and so are not for the sake of disenchantment and contentment,

original: 'dod pa spong ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa spong ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: are not for the sake of abandoning desire,

original: shes rab kyi phyir ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi phyir ma yin /
translated: are not for the sake of insight,

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu'i phyir ma yin /
translated: are not for the sake of the fruits of the ascetic life,

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: and are not for the sake of nirvāṇa.

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis sems can dag la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa ni bla na med pa'i bde ba dang / mkhas pa dag sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tshol ba la mos pa byin pa /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis sems can dag la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas pa ni bla na med pa'i bde ba dang / mkhas pa dag sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tshol ba la mos pa byin pa /
translated: Nanda, those bodhisattvas who have acted for the benefit and happiness of sentient beings will attain unsurpassed happiness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed pa /
translated: The wise ones who have given rise to the aspiration for the enlightenment of buddhahood will engage in the activities of the buddhas.

original: yang dag pa'i gnas su ma chud pa dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis thob par @118b 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bstan cing gsungs pas phan pa dang / dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gnas su ma chud pa dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis thob par @118b 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bstan cing gsungs pas phan pa dang / dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have not yet reached the authentic state will attain the state of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and through the teachings and explanations of the buddhas’ qualities, the bodhisattvas will benefit and delight in them.”

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' rnams bstan cing brjod de phan pa dang / dga' bar byas pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gdung bskyab cing bsrung ba'i phyir 'jig rten na gnas so //
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' rnams bstan cing brjod de phan pa dang / dga' bar byas pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gdung bskyab cing bsrung ba'i phyir 'jig rten na gnas so //
translated: Nanda, the bodhisattvas, by teaching and describing the bodhisattvas, benefit and gladden them. In order to make the lineage of the buddhas uninterrupted, the bodhisattvas remain in the world in order to protect and guard the lineage of omniscient wisdom.

original: dga' bo / skyes bu de dag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du sangs rgyas rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su'ang bskal pa tshad med pa khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du sangs rgyas rgyun mi 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: dga' bo / skyes bu de dag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du sangs rgyas rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su'ang bskal pa tshad med pa khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du sangs rgyas rgyun mi 'chad par byed do //
translated: Nanda, those people, when they previously practiced bodhisattva conduct, for hundreds of thousands of millions of eons made the lineage of the buddhas uninterrupted, and in the future as well, for hundreds of thousands of millions of immeasurable eons, they will make the lineage of the buddhas uninterrupted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' po / byang chub sems dpa' de dag sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sangs rgyas tshad med pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la btsud de byang chub sems dpa' de rnams skye ba thams cad du chos yongs su bskyabs nas sangs rgyas khris phrag brgya
analyzed: dga' po / byang chub sems dpa' de dag sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sangs rgyas tshad med pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la btsud de byang chub sems dpa' de rnams skye ba thams cad du chos yongs su bskyabs nas sangs rgyas khris phrag brgya
translated: Those bodhisattvas, in all their lifetimes, having fully protected the Dharma, caused a hundred thousand trillion buddhas

original: stong rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhun gyis grub par byas so //
analyzed: stong rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhun gyis grub par byas so //
translated: to spontaneously accomplish unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de nas kyang sems can grangs med pa brgya stong rnams sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la btsud de /🔽bstan cing bslabs pa'i mthus sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa na thams cad bla na @119a *//
analyzed: de nas kyang sems can grangs med pa brgya stong rnams sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la btsud de / bstan cing bslabs pa'i mthus sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa na thams cad bla na @119a *//
translated: Then, having introduced countless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings to the enlightenment of buddhahood,

original: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: through the power of teaching and training, when they fully possess the qualities of buddhahood, all of them will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: dga' bo / bzang skyong la sogs pa skye bo mang po la sangs rgyas kyi bde ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i bde ba stobs pa'i phyir shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: dga' bo / bzang skyong la sogs pa skye bo mang po la sangs rgyas kyi bde ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i bde ba stobs pa'i phyir shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: Nanda, they are striving with great perseverance in order to bestow the bliss of the Buddha and the bliss of omniscience upon the many, headed by Bhadrapāla.

original: dga' bo / de la gang zhig byang chub sems dpa'i pha dang / ma lta bu dang / gnas dang / skyabs dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'byung gnas gang yin pa bshad par 'dod na bzang skyong la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgya po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bo / de la gang zhig byang chub sems dpa'i pha dang / ma lta bu dang / gnas dang / skyabs dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'byung gnas gang yin pa bshad par 'dod na bzang skyong la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgya po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Nanda, if someone asks, ‘Who are the mothers and fathers of the bodhisattvas, and who are the abodes, refuges, and sources of the bodhisattvas?’ you should reply, ‘The one hundred bodhisattvas headed by Bhadrapāla.’

original: dga' bo / de la gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs skye bar 'gyur zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: dga' bo / de la gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs skye bar 'gyur zhes 'dri na /
translated: “Nanda, if someone asks, ‘Who are the families into which bodhisattvas are born?’

original: de la / 'di skad du /
analyzed: de la / 'di skad du /
translated: you should reply,

original: bzang skyong la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgya po yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bzang skyong la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgya po yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: ‘The one hundred bodhisattvas headed by Bhadrapāla.’

original: de ltar rigs kyi bu de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir 'jig rten na gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar rigs kyi bu de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir 'jig rten na gnas so //
translated: Thus, sons of good family, they remain in the world in order to ensure that the lineage of the buddhas is not interrupted and that the lineage of omniscient wisdom is not interrupted.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag la sogs pas phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha mar yang bstan cing bslab pa la sbyor ba'i mthu dang / bde ba'i rgyu dang / rkyen gyis skye bo mang po ngan song gsum du mi ltung zhing de ma yin pa sems can tshad med pa brgya stong rnams byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la bkod do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag la sogs pas phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha mar yang bstan cing bslab pa la sbyor ba'i mthu dang / bde ba'i rgyu dang / rkyen gyis skye bo mang po ngan song gsum du mi ltung zhing de ma yin pa sems can tshad med pa brgya stong rnams byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la bkod do //
translated: Sons of good family, and so forth, in the final five hundred years of the future, through the power of teaching and applying the training, and through the causes and conditions of happiness, they will prevent many beings from falling into the three lower realms, and they will establish countless hundreds of thousands of other sentient beings in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: dga' bo / sangs rgyas brgya stong du ma rnams kyis rigs @119b kyi bu de dag gi yon tan brjod kyang rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo / sangs rgyas brgya stong du ma rnams kyis rigs @119b kyi bu de dag gi yon tan brjod kyang rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nanda, even if many hundreds of thousands of buddhas were to describe the qualities of those sons of good family, they would not be exhausted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu de dag la sogs pas de lta bu'i yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag la sogs pas de lta bu'i yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Son of good family, it is because they possess such inconceivable qualities.

original: dga' bo / ngas bskal pa grangs med tshad med pa brgya stong gi bar du chos yongs su bsgrubs pa rnams rigs kyi bu 'di dag gis bsrung zhing 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo / ngas bskal pa grangs med tshad med pa brgya stong gi bar du chos yongs su bsgrubs pa rnams rigs kyi bu 'di dag gis bsrung zhing 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nanda, I have practiced the Dharma for hundreds of thousands of incalculable eons, and these sons of good family will protect and uphold it.

original: dga' bo / ngas bskal pa khri phrag tshad med pa'i bar du chos dkon mchog bsgrubs pa rnams 'di dag la gtad cing gdams so //
analyzed: dga' bo / ngas bskal pa khri phrag tshad med pa'i bar du chos dkon mchog bsgrubs pa rnams 'di dag la gtad cing gdams so //
translated: Nanda, I have practiced the Dharma Jewel for countless tens of thousands of eons, and I entrust it to them.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med grangs med pa na da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med grangs med pa na da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Son of good family, it is because they are contemplated by all the buddhas who are present in the countless buddha fields.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu de dag la rtag tu lha dang / mi dang / 'jig rten du bcas pa thams cad kyis phyag bya ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu de dag la rtag tu lha dang / mi dang / 'jig rten du bcas pa thams cad kyis phyag bya ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: Nanda, these sons of good family are always worthy of being venerated by all gods, humans, and the world.

original: dga' bo / skyes bu de dag la ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas stong snyed kyang chos gsungs pa'i tshe rtag par bsngags shing gsungs so //
analyzed: dga' bo / skyes bu de dag la ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas stong snyed kyang chos gsungs pa'i tshe rtag par bsngags shing gsungs so //
translated: Ananda, the Buddhas of the ten quarters, a thousand in number, when they preach the Dharma, always praise and extol these men.

original: dga' bo / ngas nges par lung bstan te /🔽sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir gang zhig phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus sum mdo sde 'di 'chang ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / 'don pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa dang / gzhan la rgya cher ston cing 'chad na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: dga' bo / ngas nges par lung bstan te / sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir gang zhig phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus sum mdo sde 'di 'chang ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / 'don pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa dang / gzhan la rgya cher ston cing 'chad na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Ananda, I also now prophesy that

original: rigs kyi bu mo de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la shin tu nye bar bsnyen pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la shin tu nye bar bsnyen pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: if in the future any hold, embrace, read, recite, master, and explain to others in full detail this Sutra of the Great Nirvana, then know that this son or daughter of a virtuous family is one who has approached very near to the wisdom of omniscience.

original: @120a *// skyes bu gang zhig phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mdo sde 'di thos nas shin tu zab mo'i chos 'di la dad cing mos te yi dam bcas na ngas de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par bya'o //🔽phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha mar dad cing mos pas sems bskyed de brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams nas mdo sde 'di bsrung zhing 'dzin pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: @120a *// skyes bu gang zhig phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mdo sde 'di thos nas shin tu zab mo'i chos 'di la dad cing mos te yi dam bcas na ngas de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par bya'o // phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha mar dad cing mos pas sems bskyed de brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams nas mdo sde 'di bsrung zhing 'dzin pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: If there are any beings who, in the future, hear this sutra and, with faith and understanding, aspire to this profound Dharma, I will also prophesy their unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'ang ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi chos kyis gtad cing gdams so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'ang ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi chos kyis gtad cing gdams so //
translated: In the future, in the final five hundred years, those sons and daughters of a virtuous family who, with faith and understanding, arouse the aspiration, apply themselves with great diligence, and protect and uphold this sutra, I will also entrust and instruct with the Dharma of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gal te nyan thos pa zhig gi chos zab mo 'di dag la dad cing log pa'i sems med na de'ang phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas byams pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes ngas lung bstan to; ;sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tshol ba gang zhig
analyzed: gal te nyan thos pa zhig gi chos zab mo 'di dag la dad cing log pa'i sems med na de'ang phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas byams pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes ngas lung bstan to; ;sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tshol ba gang zhig
translated: Those who seek the enlightenment of buddhahood

original: chos 'di 'dzin cing dang na sangs rgyas byams pas lung bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos 'di 'dzin cing dang na sangs rgyas byams pas lung bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: and uphold and have faith in this teaching will receive a prophecy from Maitreya Buddha.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyis rab tu 'byung zhing byang chub kyi rgyud slob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyis rab tu 'byung zhing byang chub kyi rgyud slob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through their previous aspirations, they will go forth and study the lineage of enlightenment.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Nanda, if there are sons or daughters of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha ma la chos 'di'i phyir shin tu brtson 'grus bskyed na skyes bu de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rno zhing rtag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha ma la chos 'di'i phyir shin tu brtson 'grus bskyed na skyes bu de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rno zhing rtag par rig par bya'o //
translated: who, in the final five hundred years of the future, generate great diligence for the sake of this teaching, know that the roots of virtue of those people will be extremely sharp and constant.

original: sngon byung ba'i bstan pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig go ///
analyzed: sngon byung ba'i bstan pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig go ///
translated: This concludes the eleventh chapter, on the teachings of the past.

original: de nas de'i tshe byang chub @120b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten 'dzin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe byang chub @120b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten 'dzin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then at that time, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Lokapāṇi addressed the Bhagavān, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don gyi slad du mdo sde bskyab pa'i slad du byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don gyi slad du mdo sde bskyab pa'i slad du byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
translated: please grant your blessings for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and for the sake of protecting the sūtras.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyi ma ma mchis pa'i dus su mdo sde thos na sems yongs su dag pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde bar ldan zhing chos 'di dag bsgrub pa'i slad du shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyi ma ma mchis pa'i dus su mdo sde thos na sems yongs su dag pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde bar ldan zhing chos 'di dag bsgrub pa'i slad du shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the future, when the bodhisattva mahāsattvas hear the sūtras, their minds will be completely purified, and they will be endowed with joy and happiness, and for the sake of accomplishing these dharmas, they will exert themselves with utmost diligence.”

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde 'di byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dri dang / bsung ngo mtshar rmad dang ldan pas yongs su khyab par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde 'di byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dri dang / bsung ngo mtshar rmad dang ldan pas yongs su khyab par gyur to //
translated: At that time, in order to bless this sūtra, the Bhagavān used his supernormal powers to cause the trichiliocosm to be filled with a wondrous fragrance and aroma.

original: sems can rnams gcig la gcig byams pa'i sems kyis blta bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can rnams gcig la gcig byams pa'i sems kyis blta bar gyur to //
translated: All beings looked upon one another with loving minds.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar byin gyis brlabs nas 'jig rten 'dzin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar byin gyis brlabs nas 'jig rten 'dzin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: After the Bhagavān had blessed it in this way, he said to Lokapāla,

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapāla,

original: ngas chos kyi phyag rgya'i mdo sde 'di byin gyis brlabs pa ni thams cad kyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngas chos kyi phyag rgya'i mdo sde 'di byin gyis brlabs pa ni thams cad kyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I have blessed this Dharma-seal sūtra in order to cut through everyone’s doubts.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /🔽gang zhig gis mdo sde 'di 'chang ngam; 'dzin tam /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin / gang zhig gis mdo sde 'di 'chang ngam; 'dzin tam /
translated: Lokapāla,🔽if someone upholds,

original: klog gam / 'don na ring por mi thogs par thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klog gam / 'don na ring por mi thogs par thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: recites, and chants this sūtra, they will before long attain omniscient wisdom.”

original: skyes bu de dag myur du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs @121a *//
analyzed: skyes bu de dag myur du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs @121a *//
translated: Those beings will quickly complete the wisdom of omniscience.🔽

original: par 'gyur bar lung bstan to //
analyzed: par 'gyur bar lung bstan to //
translated: I prophesy that these people will quickly perfect the wisdom of omniscience.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapālas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gang zhig mdo sde chos kyi phyag rgya 'di 'chang ngam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gang zhig mdo sde chos kyi phyag rgya 'di 'chang ngam /
translated: if bodhisattva-mahāsattvas uphold,

original: 'dzin tam / klog gam /
analyzed: 'dzin tam / klog gam /
translated: retain, read,

original: 'don tam / yid la byed dam /
analyzed: 'don tam / yid la byed dam /
translated: recite, contemplate,

original: gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher ston cing 'chad na skyes bu de ring po mi thogs par gyur du phung po lnga la sbyor ba dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / rtan cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher ston cing 'chad na skyes bu de ring po mi thogs par gyur du phung po lnga la sbyor ba dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / rtan cing 'brel te byung ba bcu gnyis dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang /
translated: and extensively teach and explain this Dharma-mudrā sūtra to others, then these people will, before long, attain the five aggregates, the twelve sense bases, the eighteen elements, the twelve links of dependent arising, the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang /
translated: They will attain the four correct exertions, the four supports for miraculous ability, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, mundane and supramundane qualities,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la sbyor ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos la sbyor ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and conditioned and unconditioned qualities.

original: gzhan yang / chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid myur du thob par 'gyur chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa myur du thob pa dang / dran pa'i stobs myur du thob pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i shes rab myur du thob pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid myur du thob par 'gyur chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa myur du thob pa dang / dran pa'i stobs myur du thob pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i shes rab myur du thob pa dang /
translated: “Moreover, they will quickly attain the correct characteristics of phenomena, they will quickly attain expertise in discerning the characteristics of all phenomena, they will quickly attain the power of memory, they will quickly attain the insight that is expertise in discerning all phenomena,

original: gzhan yang lus 'di brjes kyang dran pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ldan pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du myur du thob par 'gyur @121b ro; ;'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus 'di brjes kyang dran pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ldan pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du myur du thob par 'gyur @121b ro; ;'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Moreover, even after they have changed bodies, they will be endowed with an uninterrupted continuity of memory and will quickly attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.”🔽“Lokapāla,

original: mdo sde 'di ni phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su skye bo mang po la chos chen po'i snang ba byed cing ye shes 'od kyis bsod nams kyi rgyu dang / rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di ni phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su skye bo mang po la chos chen po'i snang ba byed cing ye shes 'od kyis bsod nams kyi rgyu dang / rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: this sūtra will shine the great Dharma’s light on many beings in the future and will be the cause and condition for the light of wisdom and merit.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it will perfect the bodhisattvas’ accumulations for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /🔽byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mdo sde 'di'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin / byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mdo sde 'di'am /
translated: “Lokapāla,🔽if a bodhisattva in the future encounters this sūtra

original: mdo sde zab mo gzhan byang chub kyi sde snod du gtogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang ldan pa dang phrad na /
analyzed: mdo sde zab mo gzhan byang chub kyi sde snod du gtogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang ldan pa dang phrad na /
translated: or other profound sūtras that belong to the canon of the bodhisattvas and are endowed with the perfections,

original: skyes bu de la bdud kyis bar du mi gcod cing las kyis grib las kyang bar du gcid par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu de la bdud kyis bar du mi gcod cing las kyis grib las kyang bar du gcid par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Māra will not create obstacles for this person, nor will the defilements of karma create obstacles.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /🔽skyes bu de ma skyes pa'i chos kyi bzod pa ma thob pa zhig na'ang sangs rgyas gnyis sam /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin / skyes bu de ma skyes pa'i chos kyi bzod pa ma thob pa zhig na'ang sangs rgyas gnyis sam /
translated: “Lokapāla,

original: sangs rgyas gsum po las ma skyes pa'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par 'gyur bar ngas lung bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsum po las ma skyes pa'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par 'gyur bar ngas lung bstan to //
translated: if this person has not yet attained the acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas, I prophesy that he will attain the acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas from two or three buddhas.

original: gal te ma skyes pa'i chos kyi bzod pa thob pa zhig na'ang chos thams cad la myur du dbang thob par 'gyur ba dang / myur du sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa thob pa dang / myur du nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi 'khor tshad med pa thob pa dang /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa'i chos kyi bzod pa thob pa zhig na'ang chos thams cad la myur du dbang thob par 'gyur ba dang / myur du sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa thob pa dang / myur du nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi 'khor tshad med pa thob pa dang /
translated: If he has attained the acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas, he will quickly attain mastery over all dharmas, quickly attain a pure buddha realm, quickly attain an immeasurable retinue of śrāvakas,

original: myur du byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and quickly attain a retinue of bodhisattvas.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapāla,

original: ngas mdo sde chos kyi phyag rgya 'di gsungs pa ni sems can thams cad phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo mang po'i the tshom gcad pa'i phyir @122a *//
analyzed: ngas mdo sde chos kyi phyag rgya 'di gsungs pa ni sems can thams cad phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo mang po'i the tshom gcad pa'i phyir @122a *//
